loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: La Sra. Cecilia tiene 54 años y es casada con dos hijos que son de 25 y 23 años ella se dedica al  servicio de internet que se encuentran en la zona Rio Madre de la ciudad de La Paz,  este préstamo es el octavo  que ha tomado de emprender, la Sra. Cecilia va a usar este préstamo para compra de computadoras para  su negocio, la  razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de mas computadoras ya que su clientela está incrementando y ella desea darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes, La Sra. Cecilia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son competencia ya que existen varios cafés internet en la zona pero ella les trata muy amablemente a sus clientes y por esta razón siempre van a su negocio y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 54 years old and is married with two children aged 23 and 25.  She has an internet cafe located in the area of Rio Madre in the city of La Paz.

This is the eighth business loan that she has taken.  She will use the funds to buy computers for her business.  The reason for seeking this loan is that her customer base is growing and she wants to be able to provide better service and have computers for all of them to use.

Cecilia faces challenges in her business such as competition other internet cafes in the area, but she treats her customers very well and for this reason they always go to her cafe.  She will use her profits to keep growing her business.

loans.use: to purchase computers.

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en: Sokhom is a 45-year-old married mother living in a rural area in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. She has five children, two (one daughter and one son) of whom still depend on her and help in the family’s business. She has struggled to feed her children by farming rice on 10 hectares of land for several years. However, a drought that ruined the crop yields is still the main challenge for her business. Sokhom’s group consists of two members. She has been with VisionFund for four loans while the other member has taken six loans. She has completely paid back the past loans, which have given her a better living. She is able to earn about KHR 84,000 per day from her current business and she can manage to save about 20,000 each day. She is leading the group to request a loan with VisionFund of KHR 1,000,000 each. Sokhom will use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seed for her farm. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her income to keep the children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seed

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is a mother of four children: three sons and a daughter. Two of the children are studying and the other two remain at home.

Her husband is a rickshaw driver and drives a three-wheeled autorickshaw to provide transport services to his passengers.

Naseem is an embroidery expert and works for her neighboring clients. She is very talented in her work and receives regular orders every month. She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her business because she has a large order to fulfill. With the loan, she will buy embroidery material in bulk, which will allow her to finish the order on time.

loans.use: To buy embroidery material

loans.name: Arnol

texts.en:
Arnol is single and lives in Sandugan, Larena, Siquijor.  He is 32 years old.

To earn a living, Arnol has a transportation business.  He has been doing this for two years and earns approximately PHP 5,000. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle business.

Arnol has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for more than one year.  In the future, Arnol hopes to succeed in his business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle business

loans.name: Mwinyiisa

texts.en:
Mwinyiisa is single and doesn't have any children. He has a small stall in which he sells fried fish. His premises are located in the grounds of Msambweni market.

Mwinyiisa is a very hardworking and honest person. He is requesting a loan to buy bundles of fish for resale as he anticipates an increase in demand during this season. He already has an established customer base.

Mwinyiisa is grateful to Yehu Microfinance and Kiva for the opportunity he is receiving because it will enable him to continue providing his customers with good-quality products which will, in turn, enable him to continue improving the standard.

loans.use: to buy bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Marfa De Los Angeles

texts.es: Marfa está estudiando la carrera de Licenciatura Comercial, está cursando el IV año. El crédito es solicitado para la compra de una computadora portátil. Algunos de los trabajos de la universidad son investigaciones y en este momento se le hace un poco difícil, ya que no cuenta con una computadora personal y tiene que alquilarla. El próximo año culminará su carrera y espera poder desarrollarse en una empresa en donde reconozcan sus capacidades como persona y profesional.
texts.en: Marfa is currently pursuing a degree in business, and is in the fourth year of the program  She is seeking his loan so that she can buy a laptop computer.  Some of her university assignments involve research, and at present this is somewhat difficult since she doesn't have her own computer and has to rent one.  Next year she will graduate, and she hopes to be able to launch a business in which she will be able to develop her potential as a person and a professional.

loans.use: to buy a laptop computer.

loans.name: Omari

texts.en:
Omari, age 37, is married. He lives in Msambweni and sells fish, which he catches himself from the Msambweni Indian ocean. He has done this for approximately eight years. He tells us that he has everything he needs in order to do this work. He also tells us that this job has helped him to help his family with the household costs and to get them ahead. He is a very hard-working person who has always taken pains to get ahead and succeed.

He is requesting this loan for the purchase of a motorboat and fishing tackle, which will help him greatly in his business. He thanks Yehu Microfinance for this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase a motorboat and fishing tackle.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando is 41 years old and lives in Colambutan Settlement, Tudela. Fernando is widowed with four children. 

Fernando has a store where he sells vinegar in the community. Fernando has had this business for five years. Fernando has requested a loan of 4,500 PHP to purchase additional vinegar to sell.

Fernando has been a member of PMPC for two years.  In the future, Fernando hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional vinegar to sell

loans.name: Conrada

texts.en:
Conrada is 65 years old and lives in Lutao, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with two children. 

To earn a living, Conrada has a business selling dried fish. She earns about PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. Conrada has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more dried fish to sell. Conrada has been a member of PMPC for six years.  In the future, Conrada would like to engage in another type of business.

loans.use: To purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Ma. Ligaya

texts.en:
Ma. Ligaya is a married woman from Tagbilaran, Bohol, Philippines. She has four children, ages 9, 7, 5, and 1 year. She has been engaged in a food vending and firewood selling business for some time now. 

Ma. Ligaya works hard in order to support her family, especially the needs of her children. 

She is requesting a loan worth 4,000 PHP to buy additional school supplies for her children and for the renovation of their house. She believes that this loan could be a great help to improve their lives.

Ma. Ligaya wants to increase her income from her business and she is planning to make other investments. Moreover, her foremost concern is the education and welfare of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional school supplies for her children and for the renovation of their house.

loans.name: Zahran's Group

texts.en:
Zahran is 46 years old, married and a mother of five children. Her sons are studying while her daughter remains at home.

Both Zahran and her husband operate a milk-selling business. For that reason, they have a buffalo at home. They never compromise on quality, which is why their clients are increasing day by day. For that reason, Zahran has applied for a loan. With the loan investment, her husband will buy another buffalo that will help him get a larger quantity of milk to sell and increase his profits.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo

loans.name: Emma Linda

texts.en:
Emma Linda is a 48-year-old married woman with two children. She is from Tagbilaran, Bohol, Philippines. She is in a food vending business. She sells snack food to the people in the community and to the school children. This gives her the income that she uses to finance the needs of the family.

Emma Linda is a hardworking woman who is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy ingredients for food vending such as flour, sugar, milk and other items. With this loan, she will be able to earn more, thus increasing her income. 

Emma Linda is hopeful that one day her business will prosper. She also wants to send her children to school to learn and have a better education. She dreams of seeing them as professionals someday.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, milk and other items

loans.name: Cirenia

texts.en: Cirenia is 49 years old and comes from the community of Maribojoc, Bohol. She is married with five children. Her eldest is 21 and her youngest is 8 years old. Cirenia operates an eatery and a sari-sari store (general store). Her husband also help in their business as a cook. She is asking for a loan to buy soft drinks, meat and chips. The income that she will generate will be used for the family's daily consumption, savings and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, meat and chips

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 40 years old. She is currently married and has five children, all of whom attend school. 

Eunice has had a grocery store in her town for over nine years. She sells top necessity products and drinks to her neighbours and passersby.

She is asking for the loan to invest in buying sugar, rice, and flour in larger quantities to get a better buying price and a higher profit in sales.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, and flour.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac has been running a restaurant and a milk bar business in Nyahururu town and has been in the business for three years. He is 35 years old, married to Jane and together they have three children.

He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD. He will use the loan to buy more stock of baking flour and cooking oil for use in his restaurant business and buy more milk stock for sale. With the anticipated income, he plans to improve the living standards of his family.

In the future, Isaac plans to expand his business and thereby make more income.

loans.use: to buy more stock of baking flour and cooking oil for use in his restaurant business and to buy more milk for sale.

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom is 41 years old. He is married to Dorcas and together they have three children. He is a tailor and has been in the business for the past six years.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He was introduced to KADET by credit officers. He will use the loan to purchase textile materials for use in his business.

He hopes to expand his business and become a fashion designer.

loans.use: to purchase textile materials

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 38 years old.  He is married to Salome and together they have two children.  He operates a welding business and has been in business for one year.

He was introduced to KADET LTD through a credit officer and this is his first loan.  He will use the full loan amount to repair his welding machines.

He hopes to educate his children through the college level.

loans.use: to repair his welding machines.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina, 41, is married and has six children, four of whom attend school. She earns a living selling cereals and has two years of experience. 

She started the business because she needed to earn more income for the household because her husband did not earn enough. She has increased her customer base and income, selling her merchandise at the market. The loan will be used to buy sacks of maize and also for transport cost.

Amina lives with her family in their house that lacks electricity and piped water. Her dream is to open a wholesale business in the future.

loans.use: to buy sacks of maize and also for transport cost.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
El señor Rolando tiene 25 años, es soltero y vive con su madre en la ciudad de Carapeguá, cuenta que desde muy temprana edad empezó a vender las colchas que ellos mismos producen con su madre y su padre, después de muchos años se independizó y empezó a trabajar por cuenta propia.
Lleva  productos artesanales de la zona a venderlos por las ciudades de Fernando de la Mora y Asunción, se transporta en su motocicleta que gracias  a este trabajo logró comprarse y también ayudarle a la familia para salir adelante.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hamacas, frazadas y sábanas puesto que tiene muchos pedidos de estos productos y quiere poder cumplir con la demanda de ellos.
texts.en:
Rolando is 25 years old, single, and lives with his mother in the city of Carapeguá. He says that from a very young age he began to sell bedspreads that he produces with his mother and father. After many years he became independent and began to work on his own.

He brings many handicrafts from the area to sell in the cities of Fernando de la Mora and Asunción. He transports them on his motorcycle which, thanks to this job, he managed to buy for himself and also help his family to get ahead.

He is requesting the loan to buy hammocks, blankets, and sheets as he has many orders for these products and he wants to be able to fulfill their demand.

loans.use: to buy hammocks, blankets, and sheets.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is 39 years old and lives in Lumangkapan, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor.  She is married and has three children.

Juvy operates a piggery in her backyard to earn a living.  She has had this business for 12 years and earns a monthly income of 5,000 PHP doing this type of work.  She is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP in order to purchase feed and medicine for use in her business.

Juvy has been a member of the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for almost two years.  In the future, Juvy hopes to have sufficient capital to use as a revolving fund to support her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and medicine for her piggery business.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 34 years old and lives in Taboc Norte, Oroquieta City.  She is married and has three children. 

Cristina operates a business selling barbeque to earn a living.  She has been in business for three years and earns a monthly income of 3,000 PHP doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP in order to purchase chicken and pork to use in her barbeque business.

Cristina has been a member of PMPC for five years.  In the future, she hopes to increase her savings.

loans.use: to purchase chicken and pork for her barbeque business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy sells clothing in Olkalau.  She used her previous loan to increase her stock of clothes for sale and it has been profitable for her.  To meet the demand of her customers, Lucy plans to use this loan to buy more clothes to add to her inventory of items for sale in her business.  With the anticipated profits, she plans to pay school fees for her children.

In the future, Lucy hopes to buy a plot of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy clothes to increase her inventory of items for sale.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La Señorita Irma, tiene 21 años, se dedica junto con su familia a la confección y venta de ropas. Irma cuenta con varias maquinas y con la ayuda de la familia para realizar sus trabajos de confección y las vende en un salón comercial.
Ella es una joven con muchas metas y sueños que desea poder cumplir, es por ellos que siempre se esfuerza y trata de salir adelante. Solicita el crédito para la compra de telas e hilos para la confección de una cantidad de ropas que le permita tener un stock de prendas variado y atractivo al público.
texts.en:
Irma is 21 years old and makes a living tailoring and selling clothing together with her family. She relies on several machines and the help of her family to perform her tailoring jobs. She sells these in a commercial shop.

She is a young person with many goals and dreams that desires to be able to fulfill them. Because of these she always makes an effort and tries to get ahead. She is requesting the loan to buy material and thread for tailoring a quantity of clothing that will allow her to have a stock of varied and attractive garments for the public.

loans.use: to buy material and thread.

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
Virgen del Rosario es el grupo integrado por 12 mujeres de la ciudad de Encarnación, se encuentran  en el 2º ciclo, y gracias a su trabajo y dedicación están saliendo adelante y ayudándose las unas a las otras.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Dorila, nos cuenta que se dedica  a la  venta de comidas y tiene un pequeño copetín donde los vende, es una persona muy trabajadora y siempre se motiva en las ganas que tiene de salir adelante y ayudar a su familia.
Cuenta Dorila, que solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para poder seguir haciendo los comestibles que vende, y de esa forma seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Virgen del Rosario is a group made up of twelve women from the city of Encarnación and in its second loan cycle. Thanks to their work and dedication they are getting ahead and helping one another.

One of the members of the group is Dorila. She tells us that she makes a living selling food and has a small restaurant where she sells it. She's a very hard-working person and is always motivated with the desire she has to get ahead and help her family.

Dorila says that she is requesting the loan to buy supplies to be able to continue making the food she sells, and in this way, continue providing her customers with a good service.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make food.

loans.name: La Alegría Group

texts.es:
El comité La Alegría es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, 18 mujeres forman parte de el, donde todas ellas se ayudan al máximo para poder salir adelante y de esa forma también darle a sus familias lo que necesitan.
Virginia es la presidenta del grupo, y cuenta que siempre trata de ayudar a sus compañeras, las motiva y les insta a poder seguir trabajando y saliendo adelante. Ella vende todo tipo de prendas, de invierno y también de verano y gracias a su trabajo está saliendo adelante y de esa forma ayuda a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas en general, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir trabajando y cumpliendo con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The committee La Alegría is from the city of San Lorenzo. Eighteen women form part of it where all of them help each other out as much as possible to be able to get ahead and in this way also give their families what they need.

Virginia is president of the group and says that she always tries to help the members, motivate them, and urge them to be able to continue working and getting ahead. She sells all types of clothing- winter and also summer- and thanks to her work is getting ahead and in this way helping her family.

She is requesting the loan to buy general clothing since in this way she will be able to continue working and fulfilling her customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La  Sra. Justina viven en la ciudad de Villa Elisa, tiene 49 años, trabaja en su casa en un taller de costura, junto a sus 2 hijos mayores, además tiene 15 empelados quienes dependen de ella.
Cuenta Justina que desde muy joven que trabaja, ya que ha venido desde el interior del país con ganas de salir adelante y superarse. Había empezado a trabajar en distintos talleres de costuras, ya que casi toda la familia se dedicaba a ese trabajo, luego trabajó con su hermano cerca de su casa por casi 15 años en el taller, hasta que decidió montar en su propia casa un pequeño taller para lo cual empezó a comprar  2 máquinas industriales, y a partir de allí siguió creciendo y mediante su trabajo está saliendo adelante y ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de repuestos para sus maquinas, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir trabajando y cumpliendo con sus clientes, a la vez que seguirá ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Justina lives in the city of Villa Elisa. She is 49 years old and works at home in a sewing workshop together with her two adult children. In addition she has 15 employees who depend on her.

Justina notes that she has been working since she was very young because she came from the interior of the country eager to get ahead and succeed. She began working in different sewing workshops because almost all of her family engaged in that work. Then she worked with her sister in a workshop near her house for almost 15 years before deciding to open a small workshop in her home. She began by buying two industrial machines and then continued growing. By virtue of her work she is getting ahead and helping her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy parts for her machines so that she will be able to continue working and meeting her customers’ demands while at the same time helping her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her sewing machines.

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
El comite es un grupo muy activo y antiguo,  y a pesar de tener algunos inconvenientes dentro del comite siempre supieron salir adelante , el grupo se encuentra en el ciclo 12º , tienen ahorros y caja chica que les facilitan el retiro del proximo credito.
La Sra.  Agustina es la presidenta del grupo, y siempre sabe  llevar bien adelante su puesto ya que es muy estricta y a la vez comprensiva, ella tiene ventas de hamburguezas y panchos , tambien bebidas de todas clases , tiene 2 locales en las cuales trabaja con su marido. La Sra. Desea tener agrandar su negocio con el correr de los años , y con la ayuda de la Fundacion.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para su negocio, como ser bebidas, hamburguesas y panchos. Agradece por la ayuda y la oportunidad que está recibiendo, la cual le será muy provechosa.
texts.en:
This comunal bank is a very active and long-standing group, which, despite having some problems always learned how to get ahead. The group is in its 12th loan cycle and has savings and petty cash that will facilitate repayment of this next loan.

Sra. Agustina is the president of the group and always knows how to perform her role well because she is very strict but also understanding.

Agustina sells hamburgers and hotdogs and also all kinds of drinks. She has two locales where she works with her husband. She has expanded her business with the passing of the years and with the help of the Fundación.

She is requesting a loan to purchase supplies for her business, such as drinks, hamburgers and hotdogs. She is grateful for the help and the opportunity that she is receiving, which will be very profitable for her.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, hamburgers and hotdogs, etc.

loans.name: Kuña Pora Renda Group

texts.es:
El comité llamado Kuña Pora Renda, es de la ciudad de Carapeguá. Actualmente el comité se encuentra en el 6º ciclo con 15 integrantes, son señoras trabajadoras que se esmeran en progresar.
Mencionamos a la Sra. Gerónima que con esfuerzo para sostener su hogar trabaja como empleada doméstica y también trabaja en la venta de comestibles con la intención de generar sus mayores ingresos para ayudar a su familia. La Sra Gerónima está muy contenta y orgullosa por formar parte de la Fundación Paraguaya, se siente incentivada con ganas de continuar trabajando y progresar aún más.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para poder seguir haciendo los comestibles que vende, como ser carne, condimentos, verduras, discos de empanada, harina y demás. Ella y su grupo agradecen por la ayuda que están recibiendo de Kiva y de fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
The Kuña Pora Renda committee is in the city of Carapeguá. Right now it is in its sixth cycle with fifteen members. they are hardworking women who strive to progress. 
.
Gerónima has been able to support her family by working as a domestic employee. She also sells food in order to generate more income to help her family. Gerónima is very happy and proud to be a part of the Fundación Paraguaya. She feels motivated to continue working and progressing even more. 

She is asking for the loan to buy materials to keep making the foods she sells like meat, condiments, vegetables, flour and more. She and her group are grateful for the help they are receiving from Kiva and the Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy meat, condiments, vegetables, empanadas, flour and more.

loans.name: San Rafael Group

texts.es:
En el Barrio San Rafael de la ciudad de Caaguazú, 17 señoras  se unieron para formar un grupo, en donde el compromiso es conjunto y la clave del éxito poseer un espíritu emprendedor, actualmente están en el 10mo. Ciclo donde todas ellas se ayudan para salir adelante y ser mejores cada día.
Liz es la presidenta, es una persona dinámica, trabajadora y muy buena para las ventas. Se dedica a la venta de prendas, como ser abrigos, camisas, pantalones, jeans y demás, gracias a lo cual está ayudando a su familia a salir adelante.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, con lo cual desea poder surtirse y de esa forma seguir trabajando y cumpliendo con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
In the San Rafael neighborhood in the city of Caaguazú, 17 women got together to form a group. The comittment is joint and the key to success is to possess an enterprising spirit. Right now they are in their 10th cycle and they help each other to get ahead and improve every day.

Liz is the president. She is a dynamic, hardworking person and very good at sales. She sells clothing such as coats, shirts, pants, jeans and more. Because of this she is helping her family to get ahead. 

She is asking for the loan to buy clothing to stock up and keep working and filling her custoemrs' orders.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is 32 years old. She is a single mother of two children. She sells cereals and has been in the business for the past two years.

This is her second loan cycle from KADET LTD. She paid her previous loans well and in good time. She will use the loan amount to purchase more stock of cereals for sale.

She hopes to start selling cereals wholesale in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of cereals for sale.

loans.name: Mujeres Dinamicas Group

texts.es:
El comité “MUJERES DINÁMICAS” se encuentra en el Séptimo ciclo del programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya, tiene 21 integrantes y todas ellas ya realizan actividades productivas y también hacen actividades juntas para poder fomentar su compañerismo.
Maria Cecilia es la presidenta del grupo, y nos cuenta que siempre trata de dar lo mejor de ella poder ayudar a sus amigas del grupo a salir adelante. Ella es peluquera, y comenta que tiene buena clientela porque siempre da muy buen servicio a sus clientes, y de esa forma se va ganando campo en su negocio.
Solicita el crédito para poder surtir su negocio, pues tiene muchos clientes y no quiere que le falten sus productos. Quiere comprar tintes, gel, peines, shampoo, enjuagues y demás.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres Dinámicas" [Dynamic Women] is in the seventh cycle of Fundación Paraguaya's [MFI] Entrepeneurial Women Programme. The group has 21 members, all of whom have productive businesses and also work together to foster their unity. Maria Cecilia is the group's president and always tries to give her best to help her group friends to move ahead. She is a hair dresser with a good customer base because she always provides great customer service, which is how she has been gaining ground in her business. 

Maria Cecilia will use the loan to supply her business, since she has many customers and wants to ensure she has enough inventory. She wants to buy hair coloring, hair gel, combs, shampoo, conditioner and other products.

loans.use: to buy hair colouring, hair gel, combs, shampoo, conditioner and other products.

loans.name: Elvio

texts.es:
El señor Elvio es de la Ciudad de Santaní, es casado y tiene hijos. El señor se dedica a la compra y venta de neumáticos nuevos y seminuevos, también realiza servicios de gomería.
Es un señor muy trabajador, responsable y muy honesto, según comento empezó a trabajar como ayudante en una gomería, y después como chofer, su sueño de siempre era de trabajar en forma independiente y así no depender más de otra persona, luego a través de su esfuerzo y dedicación ya cuenta con su propio negocio.
El señor acude a la fundación y a kiva en busca de ayuda económica para comprar más neumáticos para su gomería y de esa forma satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y ofrecerles un buen servicio.
texts.en:
Elvio is from the city of Santaní. He is married and has children. He buys and sells new and semi-new tores. He also does tire repair. 

He is a hardworking, responsible and very honest man. He says he started to work as an assistant in tire repair and later became a driver. His dream was always to work for himself and not depend on anyone. Later, through his hard work and dedication, he already has his own business. 

He has gone to the Foundation and to Kiva seeking financial help to buy more tires and in this way meet his customers' needs and offer a good service.

loans.use: to buy tires to sell.

loans.name: Santa Barbara Group

texts.es:
El comité “Santa Bárbara” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní, donde todas ellas trabajan dentro de un ambiente de colaboración y ayuda mutua, son mujeres jefas de familia que ayudan a los suyos por medio de su trabajo.
Una de las miembros y presidenta del grupo es la señora María Estela, quien se dedica a la costura hace ya un buen tiempo, es una persona muy trabajadora y que desea salir adelante. Cuenta que hace la confección de todo tipo de prendas y que son de muy buena calidad, por lo que le está yendo muy bien.
Ella desea seguir creciendo, y es por ello que solicita el crédito, pues tiene muchos pedidos y le gustaría poder cumplir con ellos, quiere comprar telas, gomas, botones, y demás insumos.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Santa Bárbara” was formed when some neighbors from the city of Santaní got together.  Their group works together in an atmosphere of collaboration and mutual help.  These women are the heads of their households, and they help their families through their work.
One of the members, the president of the group, is Sra. María Estela.  For a long time she has made her living by sewing.  She is a very hardworking person who wants to get ahead.  She says that she makes all types of high quality garments.  The quality is why her business has been going so well.
Sra. María Estela wants to keep growing her business, which is why she is requesting the loan.  She has a lot of orders that she would like to fill.  She wants to purchase fabric, elastic, buttons and other supplies.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, elastic, buttons and other supplies.

loans.name: Afiwavi

texts.fr: Afiwavi 31 ans, mère d’un enfant de 8 ans et célibataire assure l’entretien et l’éducation de sa progéniture en pratiquant du commerce. Elle commercialise spécialement le maïs, la farine de manioc, le haricot et quelques autres céréales.Afiwavi opère depuis 6 ans cette activité et sollicite un quatrième crédit de WAGES dans le but de s’approvisionner en marchandise. Elle espère avec ce crédit agrandir son activité et trouver un meilleur logement avec les bénéfices générés pour elle et son fils.
texts.en: Afiwavi is 31 years old and the mother of an eight-year old child. She is single and provides for her child’s education thanks to her business. More specifically, she sells corn, manioc flour, beans and other cereals. Afiwavi has been in this business for six years and is now seeking her fourth loan from WAGES in order to replenish her stock. She hopes to expand her business with this loan and, thanks to the revenues obtained, find better housing for herself and her son.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Antonieto

texts.en:
Antonieto is married with 4 children. He is 56 years old and lives in Pelong, Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Antonieto is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. He has been doing this for 20 years. He has requested a loan of 14,900 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase farm fertilizers and other supplies.

Antonieto has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. He hopes to have a brighter future ahead.

loans.use: to purchase farm fertilizers and other supplies

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en: Cristy is 51 years old, a widow, and blessed with two children. She manages a ready-to-wear clothing business to provide for the family's daily needs. She took out a loan of 14,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase additional ready-to-wear stock. She hopes the loan will help her to improve the family's standard of living through her business efforts. Cristy would like her business to progress so she can sell and supply clothing all over Mindanao, not only in the Zamboanga del Norte area.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her ready-to-wear clothing business.

loans.name: Godula

texts.en:
Godula is married with 3 children. She is 65 years old and lives in Maikay, Tudela.

Godula is a farmer who raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan of 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

Godula has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Milena

texts.en:
Milena is a married woman and she has two children. She is from Kosovo and she lives in a Serbian community. She is a hardworking woman who helps her family to improve their life.

Milena runs a Cable TV business in her area. Milena has been in this business for three years. She started with very simple equipment. Now she has managed more or less to improve her business and profit. 

She is the only one in her community that provides TV channels broadcasting and this makes it possible for her to have a better profit.

Milena is requesting a loan to by tools to improve the quality of her equipment in order to increase the number of clients.

Her goal is to save money, to ensure a better education for her children.

loans.use: To by tools to improve the quality of her equipment in order to increase the number of clients

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 46 years old. She is married to John and together they have six children, all above 18 years old.She is a farmer and has been in the business for the past 22 years.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She was introduced by one of their field officers. She will use the loan amount to purchase seedlings, pesticides and fertilizer for use on her farm.

She hopes to be a leading farmer in her area.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Malkhaz

texts.en:
Malkhaz is 39 years old. He lives in the village Duisi, Kakheti region with his family, wife Laura, mother (pensioner), 17-year-old daughter, and 3-year-old son. His daughter goes to school. Malkhaz requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for his agricultural business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time, because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Malkhaz works as a shepherd in the village. Most of the time he is out of house at pasture. He earns 150 Laris per month. His salary and pension of his mother are the only source of the income for the family. It amounts to 250 Laris per month. It is hardly enough on food for a five member family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category. 

Malkhaz requested a loan from Credo to start-up an agricultural business. His loan request was approved in the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Malkhaz will purchase up to 30 calves. He will grow them during the following 5-6 months. He will take good care of the calves, as he is an experienced shepherd.  After selling the calves, he will purchase more of them and go through the same cycle. The new business initiative will increase the income of the family and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Norair

texts.en:
Norair is 48 years old. He is married and lives in a small village in the Akhalkalaki District with his family: his wife, parents, and three children (aged 23, 2, and 1). His parents are pensioners; his wife is a school director with a monthly salary. Norair is busy with his agricultural business. He has 2 milking cows and 3 calves, produces cheese, and sells it locally. He also has some agricultural land. The family's total average monthly income is 500 Georgian laris (GEL).

Norair requested a loan to purchase a tractor. He will cultivate the family's land and sow various vegetables there. After properly performed seasonal work, he hopes to get a good-quality harvest and sell it for a good price. He will also use the tractor to provide seasonal agricultural services to local farmers and charge a service fee for the work. This will significantly increase the family's income, and the increased income will enable Norair to reinvest in the family's agricultural land to expand it and make it more profitable. With all of these activities, the family's living conditions will improve.

loans.use: to purchase a tractor

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is fifty six years old and married with five children. He has been operating a retail shop for the last nine years, earning a monthly income of 12,500 Kenyan shillings (KES).

Michael has applied for his first loan of 20,000 KES from KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to purchase more stocks of sugar, soap, and rice  for sale.

He will reinvest the anticipated profits in his business. His future dreams are to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of sugar, soap, and rice

loans.name: Rapael

texts.en:
Rapael is 50 years old. He lives in a small village of Ninotsminda District with his family, wife Marine and their three children (16, 18 and 21 years old). The older child is unemployed and the younger children still go to the school. Rapael and Marine run an agricultural business. They have calves and milking cows and produce cheese. They also own a plot of land where they grow potatoes. They sell the produced cheese and harvested potatoes on the local open market. 

Rapael requested a loan to help him mow his agricultural land. He plans to hire a tractor to mow the plot. He will make hay from the moved grass. Part of the hay will be sold for a good price and the rest will be used for feeding his cattle. Thus, Rapael will get additional income. With the increased income, they will be able to expand their agricultural business. Thus, the living conditions of the family will improve.

loans.use: to hire a tractor to mow his agricultural land

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson has been running a quarrying business in Olkalou town that has been very profitable. Wilson is 36 years old and single.

Having repaid his previous loan well and in good time, this will be his second loan, and he plans to use it to buy more quarrying tools. He also plans to employ more workers and increase his production.

In the future, Wilson hopes to invest more in his business and open more businesses such as a hotel.

loans.use: To buy more quarrying tools and  employ more workers.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 38 and married to Anastacia. They have two children. James is a middleman who deals in potatoes and cabbages. He has been in this business for the past 16 years.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He was introduced to us by one of our field officers. He will use the loan to purchase more potatoes and cabbages for resale.

He hopes to purchase a truck that he can use for transportation.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes and cabbages for resale.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is single. He is a motorcycle driver and has been running his motor transportation business for five years. He needs this loan to do maintenance on his motorcycle. With the profits from his business, he will build up his savings.

loans.use: to maintain his motorcycle.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is 54 years old. She lives in the village of Shilda, in the Kakheti region, with her 21-year-old son, daughter-in-law, and mother. Marine is a widow. Several times, she has asked for loans from local financial institutions to start up an agricultural business, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected each time because of the family's low income and poor living conditions. 

Marine’s son is an agricultural worker in the village. Her daughter-in-law works as a nurse. The total average monthly income of the family comes to 350 laris per month. It is not enough for a four-person family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category. 

Marine has requested a loan from Credo to start up a business trading in fruit and vegetables in Tbilisi (the capital city of the country). Her loan request was approved as part of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up and re-startup credit with soft conditions to the rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit, Marine will purchase fruit and vegetables from local farmers at wholesale prices and take them for sale to Tbilisi open market. Marine plans to increase the turnover in her trade business gradually. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the income of the family. Marine will work hard, and she will be able to improve the living conditions of herself and her family members.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Felistus

texts.en:
Felistus is 34 years old. She is single and has two children who are 15 and 10 years old. She has been in the charcoal business for seven years and has a monthly income of KES 10,000.

This loan will be used to buy more charcoal for resale. The anticipated profits will be used to pay for her children's school fees and food.


This is Felistus's second loan with KADET LTD; she has successfully repaid her previous loan. Her hope and dream is to be financially stable and to provide quality education to her children.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is a single mother of one child who goes to school. She has operated a mini bakery business for 10 years. She goes door to door selling snacks retail to all kinds of people. She has applied for a loan of 700000 UGX from MCDTSACCO to buy more cooking oil, baking flour and cowpeas. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She works seven days a week. She aspires to own a fully stocked bakery, to become a wholesaler and to get a permanent business location. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, baking flour and cowpeas for her mini bakery.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 26 years old, is married and has one child, age 1. Her husband works as a carpenter. She has spent seven years running a bar, selling soda and beer. The loan she requested will be used for buying soda and beer. She wants to use the profits to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more beer and soda to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 50 years old and the mother of five children, two in school. She has sold bananas and other foodstuffs for the past four years. With the loan, she wants to buy more bananas and other foodstuffs. She plans to use the profits to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: to buy bananas and other foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Obadiah

texts.en:
Obadiah is 28 years old, married and has one child, age 4. He has run a butcher shop and charcoal business for one year and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000.The loan will be used to purchase more meat and charcoal to sell. 

The anticipated profits will be used to diversify his business.This is his second loan from KADET LTD and has successfully repaid the previous loan.His hopes and dreams are to improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy meat for his butcher shop and more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Muhamet

texts.en:
Muhamet is married. He has four children, three boys and one girl, all of whom are attending school. He lives in a small village in Kosovo. The majority of people in his area and are unemployed, so they get their income mainly from agriculture.

In anticipation of the increase in their family’s expenses, including the children’s school fees and plans for their future education, Muhamet started his livestock business in the hopes that the profit would be enough to cover the extra expenses. He is working with his boys, who help him a lot. He has been selling fresh milk to a local dairy farm and has made a good profit so far. 

He is asking for a loan from KosInvest to buy more cows and calves in order to increase his business. In the future, he plans to add more cows and to increase milk production.

He really appreciates all the support from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy more cows and calves in order to expand his business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 48 years old, and is widowed with two children. She is a mixed-crop farmer. For the past three years, her primary business has been farming, and her secondary business has been running a hotel. Her monthly income, which she uses to support her family, has been KES 10,500.  

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Lucy will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the two businesses, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to venture into pig and rabbit rearing.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is 33 years old and married. She has three children, who are aged between 13 and 2 years old.

Beth has been running a boutique for the past 11 years. She has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD to buy more clothes to add to her stock for sale.

She hopes to expand her business and own a big boutique shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy clothes to add to her stock.

loans.name: Ira

texts.en:
Ira is 60 years old and lives in the Kutaisi District, West Georgia, with her husband, Shota, and two children, 25 and 23 years old. Ira requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for an agricultural business start-up but without success. His loan request was rejected because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

The family runs a small-scale agricultural business. They grow maize and nuts on a family-owned plot of the land and sell the harvest at Kutaisi Market. Total average monthly income of the family accounts to 300 Laris, including monthly social assistance paid by the government which considers the family to be living in poverty. Their income is hardly enough to feed the four-member family. 

Ira requested a loan from Credo to start up a trade business. Her loan request was approved through a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides credit with soft conditions extended to the country's rural poor. They do not have access to mainstream credit because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to low income. With the loan, Ira will purchase clothing at wholesale markets and sell it in Kutaisi with a price mark-up. She will take clothing to the local houses. In time, she will gain loyal customers and increase sales. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly increase the income of the family. Ira will work hard and she will be able to improve the living conditions of herself and her family members.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Jacklyne

texts.en: Jacklyne is 30 years old, married and has three children, ages 10, 9 and 3. She lives in Kisumu city and her husband Dancan operates a motorcycle business in town. Jacklyne has sold second-hand clothes for the last two years. She is taking her first loan with KADET LTD worth KES 20,000, with which she intends to buy more clothes to sell. The anticipated profits will be used to pay fees for her children. Her dream is to become successful in business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is a 24-year-old single man from Kisumu.He has operated a printing a business for the last four years and makes a monthly income of KES 10,000.

He is taking his first loan with KADET LTD worth KES 20,000 which he is planning to use to buy materials like stationery, pens, markers, pencils and printing paper. He plans to use his profits to open another shop in a different part of the town and lead a better life.

His dream is to become a mega printer.

loans.use: to buy more stationery, pencils, printing paper and other supplies for his business.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a farmer in her rural home in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya where she lives with her family of five adult children. She has been in farming for over 20 years. Her farm produces mainly maize, beans and milk that goes to the local market.

Harriet has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy piglets. She says the income will help improve her living standards as well as repay the loan. She intends to use the income from pig farming to increase the number of her dairy cows since milk still pays far better than pig farming though it requires a larger investment.

Harriet says rampant crop failure lately due to unpredictable weather changes has severely limited smallholder farms.

loans.use: to buy piglets.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 39-year-old dairy farmer married to Veronica, who is a mixed crop farmer. They are blessed with three children ages 11, 4 and 2. He has been in the dairy business for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 5,000 to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Daniel will use the loan to buy animal feed and a heifer. With the anticipated profit, he will educate his children.

His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and start mixed crop farming business which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and a heifer.

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina ”Virgen del Carmen“ están en el séptimo Ciclo  con 10  integrantes , es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas, solidarias  y responsable entre ellas, se nota por sobre todo que desean salir adelante y trabajar duro.
Victoriana, la presidenta, se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de comestibles, como ser empanadas, sándwich, y demás clases, cuenta que trabaja desde muy tempranas horas, que es cuando se levanta a hacer sus alimentos. Tiene muy buena clientela gracias a que sus comidas son muy ricas y queridas por sus clientes.
Solicita la ayuda de Kiva y de fundación paraguaya para la compra de insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus comestibles, como ser condimentos, verduras,  hortalizas, carnes y demás. Ella y su grupo agradecen por la ayuda que reciben, pues les será de muy importante.
texts.en:
The communal bank is called ”Virgen del Carmen,“ and they are in their seventh loan cycle with ten members. It is a group that stands out in the neighborhood for being very close-knit, supportive and responsible. It is noted especially that they wish to work hard and succeed.

Victoriana, the chairperson, sells all types of food, such as empanadas, sandwiches and other kinds.  She says that she works from a very early hour, which is when she gets up to make her food. 

She has a very good clientele, because her meals are very delicious and her customers love them.

She is requesting the help of Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya, in order to buy supplies to be able to continue making her food, such as condiments, greens, vegetables, meats and other ingredients. She and her group are grateful for the help they receive, as it will be very important for them.

loans.use: To buy condiments, greens, vegetables, meats and other ingredients.

loans.name: Dato

texts.en:
Dato is 41 years old and lives in a small village of the Akhmeta District, East Georgia. Dato is a widower who lives in the village with his 19-year-old son and 17-year-old daughter. He requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for an agricultural business start-up but without success. His loan request was rejected because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

Dato’s daughter goes to school. Dato and his son work as agricultural workers in the village. They earn on average 150 Laris per month and it is the total average monthly income of the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs in the vulnerable group category. 

Dato requested credit for a start-up of agricultural business. His loan request was approved through a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides credit with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to mainstream credit because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to low income. With the received credit, Dato will purchase up to 30 calves. He will raise them over 5 to 6 months. He will take good care of the calves, as he has previous experience working with livestock. After selling the calves, he will purchase more of them and go through the same cycle. The new business initiative will increase the income of the family and Dato will be able to provide better living conditions for his children.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es: La Sra. Tomasa tiene 32 tiene tres hijos que son de las edades de 9, 7 y 5 años, ella se dedica a la Agricultura sembrando variedad de vegetales como también papa y yuca en su parcela que se encuentra en la comunidad de CAÑADA STRONGERST, este préstamo es su octava secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Tomasa  va a utilizar  este préstamo para la siembra de yuca y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para obtener recursos  para la siembra y poder subsistir,  la Sra. Tomasa enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las inclemencias del clima que en muchas ocasiones arruinan los sembradíos,  y utilizara los beneficios Para mejorara la calidad de vida su familia ya que ella corre con todos los gastos del hogar, la Sra. es una persona  responsable y trabajadora se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Tomasa is 32 years old and has three children who are 9, 7 and 5 years old. She works in agriculture, planting a variety of vegetables - such as potato and yucca - on her parcel of land, which is located in the community of Cañada Strongerst. This loan is her eighth cycle with Emprender. Tomasa is going to use this loan for planting yucca and for preparing the land. Her reason for requesting this loan is to have the resources to plant and be able to subsist. Tomasa faces challenges in her business such as the inclement weather that, on many occasions, ruins her crops. She will use the benefits to improve the quality of life for her family, as she is responsible for all of the household expenses. Tomasa is a responsible and hard-working person who feels grateful to the organization for the offered support.

loans.use: to plant yucca and prepare the land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor for the maintenance of the coffee plantation.

loans.name: Flor Blanca Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR BLANCA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lidia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejedora de busos de bebe, tejedora de mantas de lana, carnicería, tienda de refrescos y dulces, hilandera de lana de vicuña, venta de salchipapas, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lidia es una integrante, ella indica que desde hace un ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando conjuntamente su tía por invitación de una promotora que trabaja en la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido y venta de mantas, ella cuenta que aprendió este oficio de una tía que realizaba mantas y posteriormente se capacito en una institución para mejorar esta técnica y realizar el emprendimiento del negocio.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para ampliar el negocio (compra de máquina brostera) mismo que comprará las empresas distribuidoras y posteriormente lo instalara en su espacio de comercialización. Estas dos formas de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro.

En la fotografía no se encuentran las señoras Rosmery y Paula, ya que las mismas fueron a realizarse el control médico.
texts.en:
The communal bank "FLOR BLANCA" will begin its first cycle in the Pro Mujer program at the Social Center in Alto Lima.  It is comprised of ten members and led by a board of directors with Lidia as its president.  The members of the communal bank have different businesses, including knitting baby clothes, making wool blankets,running a butcher shop, softdrinks and sweets store, vicuña wool spinning, sales of hotdogs and food.

The loan they are requesting will help the small business owners, including Lidia.  She says she joined Pro Mujer together with her aunt by invitation from a person working at the institution.  She currently has a business weaving and selling blankets.  She tells us she learned the trade from an aunt who made blankets; and then she took training at an institution to improve her technique and get started in business.

The loan is to expand her business by buying a broaster machine which she will buy from distributors and set up in her shop.  These two sources of income will allow her to support her family as best she can.  She is single and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that it is the savings part.

Rosmery and Paula are not shown in the photograph because they had doctors' appointments.

loans.use: To buy a broaster machine.

loans.name: Anzazi

texts.en:
Anzazi lives in the coastal town of Malindi, Kenya. She is married and has one child. Anzazi owns a food café, which has been in operation for two years. She also supplies cakes to the nearby shops. She prepares tea, beans, meat, and maize meal.

Anzazi was introduced to Milango by her neighbors and joined in order to access credit for her business. She is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to purchase more flour and food stuff for the café. Her aspiration is to be a well known supplier of cakes in the region. 

Anzazi will use the additional income from this loan to purchase a motorcycle for the transportation/supply of cakes to the wider area and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy flour and food stuff for the café.

loans.name: Elie

texts.en:
Elie is married with one child, aged five. His child goes to school. He has been a maize farmer for 4 years. His wife is also a maize farmer. He would like to get this loan to buy more seeds and support labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he wants to wants to pay school fees for his child.
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more seeds and support labor costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his milking stable.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 34 years old. A dairy farmer, he is married to Eunice who is a mixed crop farmer. They are blessed with three children. He has been in the dairy farming business for the past five years with the monthly income of KES 8,000 which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Simon will use the loan to buy animal feed and buy a pig to rear. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to own a pig and dairy farm and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and a pig to rear .

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo specializes in handcrafted silver filigree jewelry. He would like to stock up on materials and purchase two kilograms of fine silver.

Alfredo has been selling through NOVICA since 2005. This is his story:

Alfredo comes from Catacaos in northern Peru. "Catacaos is considered the City of Filigree. I began to learn this art when I was 11 years old, with friends who taught me little by little. I enjoy it because a jeweler's work is a delicate art. I was awarded a scholarship to study with a professor from Israel and was even offered the chance to teach filigree there. But I love Peru too much to leave."

"I'd like to thank you for this microcredit. With it, I'll be able to buy more quality silver and offer new designs to my customers. It will also permit me to give the artisans who collaborate with me the security of steady work. I send you a heartfelt hug and my most cordial gratitude."

Use the link below to view Alfredo's silver filigree jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=5201

loans.use: to stock up on materials and purchase fine silver

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fishing nets and a freezer.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 51 años, es una mujer trabajadora, empeñosa y con muchas ganas de sobresalir. Está separada de quien fue su pareja y actualmente vive en compañía de sus dos hijos mayores de 31 y 28 años, en la casa que forjó junto a su ex cónyuge.

Su actividad es la repostería, oficio que aprendió estudiando en un centro de educación ocupacional donde le enseñaron a elaborar deliciosas tortas y pasteles. Por la creatividad que expresa en cada trabajo que realiza obtiene pedidos de sus clientes con mucha frecuencia es por eso que continúa actualizándose en nuevos diseños, pues considera que siempre hay cosas nuevas que aprender. Tiene un horno en su casa donde realiza todas sus preparaciones y atiende a sus clientes desde hace 23 años. Le gusta  la repostería, así como las manualidades, se siente a gusto con su oficio pues le ha proporcionado muchas satisfacciones, como los ingresos económicos y el poder convertirse en una próspera micro empresaria. Por eso tiene planes de abrir una fuente de soda en su casa, ya que su ubicación en una esquina es estratégica para un buen negocio.

Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, se siente contenta con el apoyo financiero que está recibiendo, ya que eso le servirá para avanzar con su negocio. Además, afirma sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal, pues considera que todos sus miembros son personas responsables y muy comprometidas.

Con el monto solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, comprará los ingredientes e insumos para la preparación de sus tortas como moldes, colorantes, saborizantes y algunos utensilios de repostería.
texts.en:
Carmen, 51, is a determined, hard-working woman who wants to be successful.  She is divorced from her husband and currently lives with her two eldest children, 31 and 28, in the house she and her ex-husband established.

She is in the baking business and learned her trade at a technical training center where they taught her to bake delicious cakes and pastries.  Because of the creativity she expresses in each piece of work, she receives many customer orders.  Therefore she stays up do date with the latest designs and feels there are always things to learn.  She has an oven at home where she has been making her products and attending to clients for 23 years.  She enjoys baking and crafts, and is comfortable in her business because she receives much satisfaction from the income she earns and being able to become a successful small business owner.  Therefore, she has plans to open a soda shop at home since her corner location is strategic for good business.

This is her third loan through MFP and she is happy to receive the financial support because it will help her get ahead in her business.  Also, she claims she is comfortable with her communal bank because she feels all the members are responsible and very committed.

She plans to use the 1,500 PEN to buy supplies and ingredients to make her cakes, such as pans, food coloring, flavors and baking utensils.

loans.use: To buy supplies and ingredients to make cakes.

loans.name: Celso

texts.es:
Celso tiene 41 años, es un hombre trabajador con muchas ganas de sobresalir. Es soltero e independiente, vive en una casa alquilada en compañía de cuatro amigos, con quienes comparte los gastos mutuamente.

Él se dedica a la agricultura, para eso se ha asociado con su padre, quien tiene un terreno donde cultivan frutos y verduras. Lleva en este negocio cerca de 7 años y le gusta, pues comparte con su padre el negocio familiar y además siente que los apoya y lograr generarse un ingreso económico. Comenta que lo que no le agrada es cuando alguna plaga se presenta en sus sembríos, ya que puede generar pérdidas o disminución en la producción, pero las combate a tiempo, aunque eso le genere más gastos. Tiene planeado abrir un restaurante en la ciudad, ya que el arte culinario es una de sus principales pasiones, pero por el momento continúa ahorrando para cumplir dicha meta.

Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP y se siente contento y agradecido por el apoyo financiero que le brindan para continuar. También está a gusto con su asesor de crédito y con los miembros de su banco comunal, pues conoce a sus integrantes, que en su mayoría son sus vecinos, y los considera personas responsables.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1800 nuevos soles, invertirá en el negocio que tiene en sociedad con su padre, pues se acerca la fecha de siembra de semillas para una nueva producción.
texts.en:
Celso, 41, is a hard worker and very determined to be successful.  He is single and independent, and lives in a rented house with four friends who all share the expenses.

He is a farmer, in association with his father who has a fruit and vegetable cropland. He has been in this business for nearly seven years and enjoys it, since he shares in his father's family business.  This way he feels he supports the family and also generates his own income.  He says what he dislikes is when crops suffer from disease, as this can generate losses and decrease production.  But he combats it in time, even though it is expensive.  He plans to open a restaurant in the city, since cooking is one of his main passions.  But for now he will continue saving toward that goal.

This is his third loan through MFP and he is happy and grateful for the final support he is receiving to continue.  He also likes his loan counselor and the members of his communal bank, most of whom are neighbors he knows and considers to be responsible.

He will use the 1,800 PEN to invest in the business he has jointly with his father, since the time is drawing near to begin planting for the new production season.

loans.use: To prepare for his next fruit and vegetable crop season.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gia

texts.en:
Gia is 28 years old. He lives in Akhmeta District, East Georgia, with his wife, Lela, and one-year-old son. Gia has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for agricultural business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was always rejected, because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

Gia works as a worker in the village. He earns on average 150 Laris per month, and it is the total average monthly income of the family. According to Credo's estimations, the family belongs to the subsistent poor category. 

He has requested credit for the start-up of an agricultural business. His loan request was approved under a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit Gia will purchase a tractor. He will perform agricultural work with the tractor on the lands of nearby farmers, mainly on tilling and sowing seasons and will be paid by landlords. It will significantly increase the income of the family, and Gia will be able to provide better living conditions for his son and wife.

loans.use: to purchase a tractor.

loans.name: Delina

texts.es:
Delina tiene 25 años, es una mujer trabajadora, empeñosa y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Vive en compañía de su pareja, Wagner, en la casa de sus suegros, junto a sus cuñados y su hijo de 6 años de edad.
Su actividad es la venta de comida típica de la zona y asados de carne, pollo, cerdo y pescado. Para ello instala una mesa en el frontis de su vivienda donde atiende de manera amable y cordial a sus clientes. Lleva en este negocio cerca de 2 años y cuenta con la ayuda de su suegra para la preparación de los potajes y la atención de los comensales, que en su mayoría son sus vecinos y transeúntes. Le gusta su negocio, ya que le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual poder solventar los gastos de su hogar y las necesidades de su pequeño hijo, quien es la motivación para seguir progresando. Por lo contrario, no le gusta cuando los precios de sus insumos suben reduciendo sus ganancias, pero aun así logra encontrar la rentabilidad en sus ventas. Tiene planes de seguir con su negocio y ampliarlo con mejores sillas y mesas para brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes.

Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que le están brindando para seguir con su negocio y avanzar con sus planes. Por otro lado, comenta sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal, pues considera a sus miembros buenas personas y cumplidas.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1800 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de los ingredientes para la preparación de sus comidas, a precio por mayor, para así tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Felina is 25 years old and is a hardworking, determined woman who really wants to get ahead in life. She lives with her partner, Wagner, in her parents-in-laws' house, together with her brothers in law and her 6-year-old son. 

She works selling traditional food of the region such as roast beef, chicken, pork and fish. For this purpose she has set up a table in the front-part of her home where she serves her clients in a cordial and friendly manner. She has had this business for around 2 years and her mother in law helps her to prepare stews and serve customers, who are mainly her neighbors and passers-by.

She likes her business, since it allows her to have a small income with which she can pay household expenses and the needs of her young son, who is her motivation to continue moving forward. On the other hand she does not like it when the prices of her supplies go up, reducing her earnings. However, she still manages to find profitability in her sales. She plans to continue with her business and improve it with better tables and chairs to offer her clients more comfort.

This is her third loan from MFP. She is grateful for the financial support they are offering her to continue with her business and her plans. She says she is happy with the communal bank, since  she considers its members to be good and reliable people. With the sum she is asking for of 1800 nuevos soles, she will buy ingredients required for the preparation of her dishes at wholesale price so as to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food preparation.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fishing nets, a freezer and a cooler.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor is a Peruvian artisan who specializes in alpaca sweaters, ponchos and accessories. He would like to invest in the bulk purchase of yarn in a variety of colors to expand his product lines.

Nestor has been selling through NOVICA since 2002. This is his story:

Nestor hails from Peru's Puno region, renowned for quality alpaca and sheep wool. He has been dedicated to the textile arts, a family trade for generations, for more than 25 years. When he first began to weave, he worked on the rustic looms he built along with other family members. Together they sold their creations at local markets until they were able to upgrade to more modern machinery, which in turn allowed them to develop new designs and expand their workshop.

"I started with a flat type of knit and little by little I ventured into creating collections with raised motifs that, for a long time, had been designs I had only sketched out on paper. Every year I learn more about new color trends, too, and so I have gradually been increasing the variety of designs I have to offer my customers. I wish to take this great opportunity of interest-free microcredit and use it toward the creation of my new collection. I feel like I finally have the time to dedicate to designing and knitting, rather than constantly searching for new ways of selling."

Use the link below to view Nestor's alpaca apparel and accessories on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=3463

loans.use: to make a bulk purchase of yarn in a variety of colors.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino, 33, lives in Tskaltubo District, West Georgia with her four year old daughter and her mother-in-law. Nino’s husband, Shalva, works out of the country and provides financial assistance to his family. Nino requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for her business start-up but without any success. Her loan request was always rejected because of her low income and her family’s poor living conditions.

Nino works as a music teacher. Her salary is the main source of income for the family, along with the income of Nino’s mother-in-law from small scale agricultural activities. The average monthly income of the family is 300 Laris. Also periodically Nino’s husband sends some funds to the family. According to Credo's estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category.

Nino requested a loan from Credo to create a music studio, where she will teach music, in particular Georgian songs to local children. Also, the family plans to construct a greenhouse. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup capital with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income.

With the credit received, Nino will purchase materials to renovate a room for her studio, as well as to purchase the relevant furniture for it. She will also purchase materials for the greenhouse construction. Nino’s mother-in-law will grow greens and tomatoes in the greenhouse and sell the harvest at the local market. Nino will be busy in her music studio. The new business initiatives of the family, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly increase their income and even double it. With this, Nino will be able to provide better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase materials to start a music studio.

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is taking out another loan to invest in a new business. He is very attentive towards other people. He has been operating a kiosk for four years, selling consumer goods. He is very well-known in his area and is very responsible. He is always looking to provide a better future for his family, and he has always achieved this. He also owns a motorbike taxi, which generates extra income.

Hamisi has decided to request a loan from Yehu to add stock of wheat flour, sacks of sugar, and balers of maize flour. He is very happy to have taken this decision because it will guarantee that the income will increase, and he will be able to fulfill his dream of ensuring that his family do not lack the basics. 

He pledges to make his loan repayments on time and even hopes that he will be able to do so before the scheduled repayment date.

loans.use: to add stock of wheat flour, sacks of sugar, and balers of maize flour.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 40-year-old married man with five children. He describes himself as aggressive, determined, and visionary. He operates a retail business where he sells consumer products in his retail shop. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a conducive business environment, and he has a large clientele.
