Hussein describes his biggest business challenge as a lack of funds. He will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy stock of flour and rice.

His business goal is to expand his business and own a wholesale in the future.

loans.use: to buy stock of flour and rice.

loans.name: Zainaba

texts.en:
Meet 32-year-old Zainab from Waterloo in the eastern part of Freetown, Sierra Leone. She is married with three children between the ages of seven and 15 years old. Her children are currently attending school. In 2000, Zainab established her general merchandise business. She began her business because she came from a very poor home and it was hard to take care of her family and relatives. She works at the business from 7:00 am until 7:30 pm seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is that during the rainy season purchasing power is slow.

Zainab requires a loan in order to buy more drinks containers, washing boards and dishes. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and educate her children. In the future, Zainab plans to expand her business and build a house. She thanks you for your support.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Zainaba from Sierra Leone

loans.use: To buy more drinks containers, washing boards and dishes.

loans.name: Sabire

texts.en:
Sabire is a Romani woman from a vulnerable ethnic minority community in central Albania. She is 50 years old and married with two children.

For the past five years, Sabire and her son have been collecting scrap materials for cash while her husband has immigrated to the neighboring countries. 

Sabire says, “Some people do what's easiest and avoid hard work — and that's precisely why I try to do the opposite. I spend all day collecting scrap to secure a bit of food for my children.”

She is requesting a Kiva loan to buy scrap materials and sell them directly to the manufacturers. This way, she will be able to generate more profit and her husband will consider coming back to get involved in the business. Sabire expresses her gratitude to lenders from Kiva for their support.

loans.use: To buy scrap materials.

loans.name: Kalemba

texts.en:
Kalemba is 28 years old and lives in the town of GABA in the Kampala South region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past five years, Kalemba has been working hard to manage his fish stall, where he sells fish fillets. 

To help expand his business, Kalemba has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase more fish in his business for resale. It will help Kalemba to generate greater profits to enlarge his business. Kalemba hopes that in the future he will be able to make a big factory. 

Kalemba is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small business owners like Kalemba who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to increase more fish in his business for resale.

loans.name: Lukiya

texts.en:
Lukiya, a married mother of three children, all of whom go to school, resides with the family in her own house that has access to electricity but not piped water. Lukiya has been selling used clothes door to door for four years now and generates additional income through hair plaiting. Her major business challenges includes seasonality and thieves.

Lukiya has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She aspires to develop her business and eventually establish a permanent business premise and begin importing used clothes.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two cows

loans.name: Kodé

texts.fr: Kodé est un homme marié, père de deux enfants.Il exerce depuis un peu moins de deux ans, un élevage de poulets de chair.Il achète des poussins qu'il élève et revend au bout de 45 jours avant de renouveler l'opération.Cette activité lui permet de prendre en charge les dépenses d'entretien de sa famille ainsi que ses propres besoins.Afin de réaliser une nouvelle opération, il sollicite un pret de 500 000f pour acheter des poussins, des aliments et des produits vétérinaires.Son ambition est de construire un grand poulailler dans sa localité.
texts.en:
Kodé is a married man and the father of two children.  He has been raising broiler chickens (raised specifically for meat production) for practically two years.  He buys young chickens, raises them and resells them after 45 days, before starting all over again and buying more young chickens.

This professional activity allows him to provide for his family and to meet his own needs.

In order to purchase more chickens, animal feed and veterinary products, he is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs.  His ambition is to build a large hen house in his own locality.

loans.use: to buy young chickens, animal feed and veterinary products.

loans.name: Zona Norte Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ZONA NORTE” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosmery es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de barrio, venta de comida, venta de plásticos por mayor, venta de peluches.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosmery es una integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una vecina que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio, ella cuenta que aprendió este oficio de una de sus cuñadas y que emprendió su espacio de comercialización desde hace un año atrás con ayuda de su mamá.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para ampliar el negocio (compra de estantes y vitrinas) mismo que comprará las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo instalara en su espacio de comercialización. Estas dos formas de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank "ZONA NORTE", starts the first cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of Focal Centre of Alto Lima. It is made up of seven members and is directed by a Board of Directors, where Mrs Rosmery is the President. Members of the communal Association carried out are varied of business among them have: neighborhood shop, food sales, sale of plastics and stuffed animals for sale.

The credit that will benefit small women microentrepreneurs where Mrs. Rosmery is a member, she indicates that this is the first time she participates in Pro Mujer, entering at the invitation of a neighbor who is a partner at the institution. Today she has a store in the neighborhood, she says she learned the business from her sister in law and started with her own space a year ago with the help of her mom.

The loan is to expand the business (purchase of shelves and cabinets) items that she will purchase in the fair in the city of El Alto and then install them in her space. These two forms of work allow her to generate some income to support her family, because she is single. 

When it is consulted what she likes of Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the area of health.

loans.use: to expand her business (purchase of shelves and cabinets)

loans.name: Bilbil

texts.en:
Bilbil is forty-five. He is married, has three children ranging from twenty to twenty five years old and is an Egyptian man from the Egyptian vulnerable community of central Albania. Note here, that he has been referred by Landi, another VFA client who raised money through Kiva and was touched by Kiva lenders' kindness. 

During the past fifteen something years, Bilbil has been selling used clothes to his community's residents in the village's and city's nearby areas. The profit has been okay, he claims, yet never enough to improve his living conditions. With the expansion of the business and involvement of all family members, he thinks that all of their earnings will give them a financial boost that will help them make renovations to their poorly built and anti-hygienic one-room house. 

To make it happen, he is requesting a loan for the first time to purchase more inventory of used clothes. 

Being told that this loan is a Kiva one, his family wants to express in advance their appreciation for the lenders' generosity.

loans.use: To buy used clothes

loans.name: Gufron

texts.en:
Gufron is a very hard-working man. He has worked in many places but that work did not satisfy him and three years ago he began own business. He leases building equipments to local people who build new house. He has enough skills to develop his business and that’s why his business has been developing year by year. 

Gufron has many clients in his town with many new buildings. He has a lovely wife and two children. His son helps him with the business and his daughter helps his wife with the housework. They live very happily but Gufron can’t improve their living conditions. That’s why he is asking for a loan to buy building equipments to develop his business. He awaits your help and support.

loans.use: To buy building supplies to develop his business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 29 años, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Su pareja es Aliardo, con quien tiene dos hijos, de 9 y 3 años.
Su actividad es la venta de productos de belleza que compra por catálogo y los vende entre sus amistades y familiares. Ha logrado buenos resultados y en ese transcurso va conociendo muchas personas que luego se convierten en sus clientes. Lleva en este negocio cerca de 12 años y siempre ha trabajado sola. Paralelamente también vende ropa para niños, pero de manera ocasional, por temporadas o en fechas festivas, desde hace 3 años. Lo que le gusta de su negocio es que puede manejar sus tiempos libres para dedicarlos a sus pequeños hijos, a quienes quiere mucho y son su motivación para salir adelante, además de los ingresos económicos con los cuales puede apoyar a su pareja en los gastos de su hogar.

Este es su tercer préstamo con la institución MFP y se siente agradecida con la oportunidad de contar con una línea de crédito para avanzar con su negocio. Además comenta estar a gusto con su banco comunal, pues considera que sus miembros son personas responsables y amables.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1200 nuevos soles, comprará más ropa de niño, de diversos modelos, y surtirá su stock de cosméticos y perfumería para ofrecer mayor cantidad de artículos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa, 29, is a hard working and resolute woman with a strong desire to advance in life. Her partner is Aliardo, father of her two children, 9 and 3.
She sells beauty products which she buys from a catalogue and her main customers are her relatives and friends. She has achieved good results and has met many people that later become her customers. She has been doing this for almost 12 years, working always on her own. She also started selling clothes for children three years ago, although seasonally and only for special occasions and festivities. What she likes about her business is that she can manage her spare time and invest it in her young children, who she loves dearly and who are her inspiration to move forward. She also likes to have an income to support her partner with household expenses. 
This is her third loan with MFP. She is thankful for the opportunity of having a credit line to help her expand her business. She also feels comfortable with her Community Bank because the members are responsible and kind people. 
With the requested amount of 1200 nuevos soles, Rosa will buy more clothes for children in various styles and will expand her stock of cosmetics and perfumes in order to offer more articles to her customers.

loans.use: To purchase more beauty supplies to increase her stock and children's clothes to continue her sales

loans.name: Watta

texts.en:
Meet 32-year-old Watta from the southern area of Kandeh in Bo, Sierra Leone. She is married and has four children between the ages of 6 years and 15 years. Her children are currently attending school. 

In 1999, Watta established her dry meat and dry fish business. She began her business because her husband is out of work. She walks four miles to go and buy the pork. Then she prepares the pork and fish from 8 p.m. until 2 a.m. She works at the business every day, going door to door to sell. She has more sales during special occasions. Her customer base has increased but she has insufficient capital to invest on her meat sales.

Watta requires a loan in order to buy more pork and fish. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and pay her installment. In the future, Watta plans to own a meat shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more pork and fish

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 41-year-old Mamie from Kandeh town. She is married and has five children between the ages of 12 years and 20 years. Four of her children attend school. 

Mamie runs a palm oil business. She sells palm oil, coconut oil, and cassava. She has been running this business for 10 years. She works at the business 12 hours per day and seven days per week.  Her other source of income come is from her younger brother. Mamie says that the main challenge to her business is competition.

Mamie has requested a loan in order to buy more palm oil, coconut oil, and cassava. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and improve her standard of living. In the future, she plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more palm oil, coconut oil, and cassava.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace  is married to a farmer and they both live together with their six dependents at Abura. 

She buys fresh fish from the sea shore and comes home to fry them to sell them at a market in the Central Region of Ghana. 

She wants to increase the quantity of fish fried and so a loan will go a long way to help buy additional fish to fry and sell.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to fry to sell.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: For the past 20 years, Adwoa has been selling salted fish at the Jukwa market. She is married to a farmer and has 5 children. She needs a large quantity of salted fish to be able to meet the increasing demands of her customers. With the help of the loan, she will buy some salted fish in a large quantity. She plans to reinvest her profit in her business for future growth.

loans.use: To buy some salted fish in a large quantity

loans.name: Afua

texts.en: Afua sells tomatoes, garden eggs, and other items at the Jukwa market. She is a widow who takes care of five dependants. Afua has been in this business for some time now. She hopes to increase her sales, so she needs a loan to purchase additional bags of garden eggs and tomatoes to sell in the market.

loans.use: To purchase additional bags of garden eggs and tomatoes to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr: Abdoulaye est un homme marié et père de deux enfants dont l'un fréquente l'école primaire.Il tient dans son quartier ( district) un  magasin de vente de denrées alimentaires et d'articles ménagers divers.Ce commerce qui génère des revenus assez consistants lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille.Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 500 000f pour acheter des sacs de riz, de l'huile, du sucre et d'autres denrée alimentaires.Son ambition est d'ouvrir une seconde boutique.
texts.en:
Abdoulaye is a married man and the father of two children, one of whom goes to primary school.  He runs a shop, in his own neighborhood (district), where he sells food products and household items.

Thanks to this retail business, he is able to generate a rather good income and to provide for himself and for his family.

In order to strengthen his business, he is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs to buy some bags of rice, oil, sugar, and other food products.  His ambition is to open a second shop.

loans.use: to buy some bags of rice, oil, sugar and other food products.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is married with four children and all her children go to school. She doesn't take care of any additional family members. She has a business of selling used shoes and has been in this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used shoes. She works six days a week selling shoes and sells to all categories of people at retail. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the ever increasing prices of used shoes. 

She aspires to see her business grow big so that she sells at wholesale only, and also to build rental rooms and to educate her children up to the university level. 

She resides in her own house, where the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used shoes

loans.name: Jenneh

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Jenneh from Kandeh town in the southern area of Bo. She is single with two children, age 3 and 7 years. One of her children is currently attending school. 

She began this business to generate income to support her children. As a single parent, she has no one to take care of her.

Jenneh runs a food stand within a market. She sells palm oil, rice, pepper and groundnuts. She has been running this business for eight years. She works at the business every day from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. Her business is the only source of income she has. She says that the main challenges to her business are insufficient capital to expand her business, and when sales are slow, some goods do perish.

Jenneh has requested a loan in order to buy more food such as palm oil, rice, pepper and groundnuts. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her children's welfare. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more food such as palm oil, rice, pepper and groundnuts.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is married and has six children, five of whom go to school. She takes care of her grandmother. She has a business selling used clothes and has been in this business for four years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She sells clothes six days a week and sells to all categories of people at retail. 

Her major business challenges include seasonality and the rainy season which makes travel difficult. She aspires to get a permanent business premise and to educate her children to the university level. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees, feeding the family and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Hidajete

texts.en:
Hidajete is a fifty-two-year-old Romani woman from the Roma marginalized community of central Albania. She is married, and has three children ranging from twenty-eight to twenty-four years old. For some time now, she has been receiving a disability compensation. Kindly note that many people from the marginalized communities of Albania become disabled at a very young age because of the extremely poor living conditions and the lack of access to proper nutrition and Hidajete is one of them. 

Hidajete recently requested a loan through VisionFund Albania's institution to improve her family's living conditions by first, building a toilet. "Maybe my income is very little," she says, "yet, I promise to Kiva lenders that I will pay back the loan on time," she continues.

loans.use: To build a toilet in her tiny one-room  house

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is married and has two children, one of whom goes to school. She takes care of additional family members (mother and father). She has had a business selling used clothes for seven years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. 

Besides this clothing business she generates additional income through selling eggs. She works six days a week at the market at a retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and the increasing prices of clothes in Uganda. She hopes to see her business grow big; she wants to get enough profits to buy another plot of land to build rental rooms, and also to become a wholesaler. 

She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor tiene 48 años, es un hombre trabajador y empeñoso, además de solidario y amable, con muchos deseos de superación. Está casado con Beatriz, con quien tiene dos hijos, de 11 y 7 años, a los que quiere mucho. Juntos viven en la casa que construyó gracias a su trabajo.

Él se dedica a dar el servicio de transporte de pasajeros en un motocarro que se compró con el fruto de sus ahorros más un crédito particular. Empezó hace 11 años con el primer motocarro que compró, en el transcurso del tiempo fue renovando a medida que se iban deteriorando por el uso cotidiano. Le gusta su actividad, pues le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual poder solventar sus gastos familiares. Se inició por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso económico, ya que no podía conseguir un empleo estable y ahora se siente con mayor seguridad, pues puede manejar sus horarios, además de ser su propio jefe. Tiene planes de hacer crecer su negocio de transporte comprando un vehículo de carga pesada, ya que el pago en este tipo de transporte de mayor.

Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP y se siente muy agradecido por el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo para poder alcanzar sus objetivos. También le gusta ser parte de su banco comunal, pues se lleva bien con todos sus miembros a los que considera buenas personas.
Con el monto solicitado, de 2000 nuevos soles, refaccionará su motocarro, comprando algunos repuestos y accesorios que necesita para continuar trabajando. Otra parte del dinero lo ahorrará para comprar su vehículo de carga.
texts.en:
Víctor, 48, is a hard-working, determined man. He is also kind and helpful and with a strong desire to progress in life. He is married to Beatriz and they have two children, 11 and 7, who he loves very much. They all live in the house he built with the proceedings of his work. 
Víctor makes a living by transporting people in a moto-car he bought with his savings and a personal loan. He started this activity 11 years ago with a first moto-car which he renovated as it deteriorated with daily use. He likes his livelihood because it provides him with an income. Before he couldn’t get a stable job and now he feels more secure because he is able to manage his hours and to be his own boss. He plans to expand his transportation business by purchasing a heavy-load vehicle because of the higher fees that can be charged for this type of transportation.
This is his third loan with MFP. He is very thankful for the financial support he has received for reaching his goals. He also likes to be a part of his communal bank because he gets along with all its members, which he thinks are good people. 
With the requested loan of 2000 nuevos soles he will revamp his moto-car, buying some replacement parts and accessories that he needs to keep on working. He will also save part of this loan in order to buy his heavy-load vehicle later on.

loans.use: To purchase replacement parts and accesories for his moto-car

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Con un prestamo de 46,575 pesos Raquel ha podido comprar más productos para el pelo y pagar un préstamo que tenía con un prestamista informal del que tenía que pagar intereses muy altos. 
Raquel inició su salón de belleza hace dos años y medio. En este momento es el único ingreso con el que cuenta su casa. Raquel es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos de 16, 15 y 11 años, que están en la escuela.
El deseo de Raquel es que su negocio marche bien para poder ahorrar lo suficiente para comprar una casa para ella y sus niños.
texts.en: With a loan of 46,575 pesos, Raquel has bought more hair products and paid off an informal, very high interest loan. She opened her beauty salon 18 months ago, and now it is her sole source of income. She is the single mother of three children ages 16, 15, and 11 who attend school. Raquel hopes her business prospers so that she can save enough to buy a house for herself and her children.

loans.use: to buy hair products.

loans.name: Asi

texts.en: Asi is a widow taking care of four children. Her schooling is up to the senior high level. Esi sells corn dough at Jukwa market near Abura. She feeds, clothes and educates her children with the income she makes from her sales. The loan received will be invested in the sale of her corn dough. She hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to invest in the sale of her corn dough.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Meet 47-year-old Nancy from Kandeh town, southern area in Bo. She is married with four children between the ages of 8 years and 20 years. Three of her children are currently attending school and one of them in university. In 1990, Nancy established her local foodstuffs business. She began her business because she needed a permanent source of income to support her family. She works at the business from 4:30 am until 8:00 pm; long hours drive from the village where she buys palm oil to Bo town. She says that the main challenge to her business is at times low purchasing power of customers.

Nancy requires a loan in order to buy more palm oil and coconut oil. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and educate her children up to university. In the future, Nancy plans to build a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more palm oil and coconut oil.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia sells plastic bowls, buckets and containers at Jukwa market near Abura.    Felicia is married to a farmer and has five children.  She has been in this business for 15 years now.  She uses her income to help her husband to pay utility bills. Felicia will use her loan to purchase more plastic bowls to sell. With the new profit Felicia will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic bowls to sell.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua  cooks  wakye (rice and beans cooked together) for sale at Jukwa near Abura  She serves it with 'gari' (cassava couscous), macaroni, meat and fish stew.   Ekua has been selling 'wakye' and rice for the past 4 years now. She is married to a farmer and has five children.  Ekua  assists her husband in paying their children’s school fees.  Her loan will be used to purchase bags of rice, beans and fish.  Ekua will use her new profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, beans and fish

loans.name: Amie

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 39-year-old Amie from Kandeh town, southern area in Bo. She is married with three children between the ages of 4 years and 14 years.  Her children attend school. 

Amie runs a general merchandise shop; she sells toothpaste, cigarettes, sugar, and bread. She has been running this business for 20 years. She works at the business 6 days per week and 12 hours a day. Her other source of income comes from her elder sister. She says that the main challenges to her business are transportation costs and insufficient capital.

Amie has requested a loan in order to buy more general stock items like toothpaste, cigarettes, sugar, and bread. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase goods in her shop and start a savings account. In the future, she plans to build a house. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To buy more general stock items like toothpaste, cigarettes, sugar and bread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy eight sacks of fertilizer, two gallons of insecticide, and improved seed for planting and to pay labor to grow 14,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Comfort Adwoa

texts.en:
Comfort is the lady preparing soup.  She operates  a  chop bar (where a variety of African dishes are sold) which she has done  for  13 years.   The foods  she  serves  are  "fufu" (mashed manioc), "banku" (fermented corn dough), meat  soup, fish soup,  and rice balls.  She is married  and has  six children.   

Comfort  uses her income to help her husband to pay their children’s  school fees. She will use her loan to purchase  maize, cassava, fish, meat and other ingredients to prepare  food for sale. With the new profit,  Comfort   plans to operate a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase  maize, cassava, fish, meat and other ingredients to prepare  food for sale.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Musu from Kandeh town, southern area in Bo. She is married with two children 11 years old and 16 years old.  Her children are currently attending school. 

Musu runs a foodstuffs stand where she sells onions, peppers, tomatoes, oil, and flour. She has been running this business for 15 years. She works at the business every day even on holidays. Her husband is a farmer, and she earn another source of income thought small-scale farming. She says that the main challenges to her business are competition in the market and transportation costs.

Musu has requested a loan in order to buy more food items such as onions, peppers, tomatoes, oil, and flour. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and improve her standard of living. In the future, she plans to expand her business and build a house. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more food items such as onions, peppers, tomatoes, oil, and flour.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet 43-year-old Isatu from Kandeh town, southern area in Bo, Sierra Leone. She is married with six children between the ages of 7 years and 25 years. Five of her children are currently attending school. In 2002, Isata established her local foodstuffs business. She began her business because she was an agriculturist and her husband is a security guard but their income is not enough to support their family. She started selling palm oil, cassava couscous and rice to earn more income. She works at her business every day except holidays. She wakes up 5:00 in the morning in search of palm oil in the nearby villages. She says that the main challenges to her business are competition in the market and poor road networks in the villages.

Isata requires a loan in order to buy more palm oil, rice, and cassava couscous. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and improve their family welfare. In the future, Isata plans to open a palm oil store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil, rice, and cassava couscous.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 39-year-old Theresa from Kandeh town, Southern area in Bo. She is married with three children between the ages of 4 years and 18 years old. Theresa's children are currently attending school. 

Theresa runs a clothing and palm oil business; she sells clothes and palm oil. She has been running this business for five years. She works at the business seven days per week and 11 hours a day. She is also working as a gardener to receive another source of income. She describes her major problem as insufficient capital to operate the business.

Theresa has requested a loan in order to purchase more palm oil and clothing material. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve the standard of living for her family and educate her children. In the future, she plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and clothing material.

loans.name: Paty

texts.en:
Paty is a Peruvian artisan who specializes in handcrafted bracelets that feature leather, handwoven textiles and silver accents. She'd like to purchase additional raw materials for her designs.

Paty has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is her story:

"I was always a good student and I excelled in the arts. I learned that my passion was in things I could develop with my own initiative. I especially liked jewelry in all its forms. Few people get to work at what they love, what they were born to do. I combine techniques from knitting and crochet with the art of silverwork. My art is the way I express my emotions. I tend to create different jewelry designs depending on how I feel."

"My love for crafts led me to discover a passion for this art, and Novica has helped me transform this into the work that sustains me. I am in love with jewelry crafting. Thank you for being a part of this by assisting with this microcredit."

Use the link below to view Paty's handcrafted jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=7964

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials for her designs

loans.name: Amistad Group

texts.en:
Gregoria Catarina, better known as Catarina, is a member of the Amistad Trust Bank, which is located in a rural area of Juchanep, a verdant and chilly part of Totonicapán in southwestern Guatemala. The area is famous for its handmade fabrics, majolica ceramics and wood products. 

Thirty-four years old, Catarina lives in a single-room structure with her husband, a tailor, and her two girls (11 and 8 years old) who are currently in primary school. She says that her biggest challenge is raising her girls, as she travels often for her business. Catarina enjoys cooking and spending time with her family whenever she can. Catarina is known as an outstanding member of her Trust Bank because of her positive attitude and good sense of humor, and also because she works hard every single day in order to give the best to her family. Catarina is so excited to get a new loan with Friendship Bridge after successfully repaying her previous loan, which helped to grow her business. Catarina's business is selling traditional clothing, which includes different types of huipils (typical blouses), typical skirts, belts, and aprons. As she wants to increase sales, Catarina is excited to use this loan to diversify her inventory of typical clothing so that she is able to respond to her customers’ demands. She wants to provide the newest fashions to her customers, so she is happy to buy products from four weavers from different regions. By supporting the businesses of these other women, they too can sustain their families. She says, "I seek for the common good, because we have needs from each other." Catarina currently sells in three different places, some as far as an hour away from home. She must get up at 4 am daily to prepare her products and transport them in minivans, buses and pick-ups. 

Catarina appreciates the education lessons Friendship Bridge provides at the monthly loan repayment meetings and finds them beneficial in achieving both her business and personal goals. Catarina's biggest dream is that her business will become self-sustaining so that it will continue to provide income, which will support her girls' education. Over time Catarina has improved her business's administration, all thanks to the business management training provided by Friendship Bridge. In addition, her first child is completing elementary school this year. Catarina is proud that she has been able to support her because of what she has learned through Friendship Bridge’s curriculum that teaches parents how to support their children through school. Catarina only studied through 5th grade. She says that she can't imagine what great things her girls will be able to do if they continue their education. She wants her daughters to follow their dreams, become great professionals and serve the community.

Like Catarina, the 11 other members of the Amistad Trust Bank, most of whom are also mothers, do business in textiles, clothing sales and tailoring, among other trades. They are so happy to be able to obtain another loan to grow their businesses, and thus continue to support their families. The 12 women acknowledge their financial support from people around the world and are grateful that they have opened their hearts to them.

loans.use: To diversify her inventory of clothing.

loans.name: Widiana

texts.en:
Widiana specializes in handcrafted sterling silver jewelry. To continue production, he would like to invest in the purchase of larger quantities of sterling silver.

Widiana has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is his story:

Widiana was born in Gianyar province. "My village is well known for the type of jewelry we create in gold and silver. As a child, my parents taught me how to make rings, necklaces, pendants, and earrings. My work has been well accepted and I am proud to say I have won several awards for the originality and quality of my work."

"Thanks much for your support through this interest-free microcredit. I will use it to buy as much silver as possible, so that I may increase my stock of products, including some new designs."

Use the link below to view Widiana's silver jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=3768

loans.use: to purchase silver in bulk and expand production

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Con un prestamo de 21,000 Lourdes ha podido comprar más mercancía para aumentar la variedad de poductos ofrecidos. Además de la ropa de segunda mano, los tennis de segunda mano tienen mucha demanda en República Dominicana, especialmente antes del inicio del año escolar. Lourdes tiene más de 10 años con este negocio, con el cual puede ayudar a su esposo en la manutención de la casa. El esposo de Lourdes es maestro constructor, juntos tienen 4 hijos que tienen entre 26 y 19 años, el mayor ya terminó la universidad, y los demás aun están estudiando en la universidad.
El deseo de Lourdes es seguir ayudando a sus hijos pues desea que todos tengan la oportunidad de terminar la universidad.
texts.en:
With a loan of 21,000, Lourdes has been able to buy more merchandise to augment the variety of products she offers.  In addition to second-hand clothing, second-hand tennis shoes are in high demand in the Dominican Republic, especially just before the beginning of the school year.  Lourdes has been working in this business for more than 10 years, with which she is able to help her spouse with the household expenses.  Lourdes' husband is a master builder, and together they have 4 children between the ages of 19 and 26 years of age.  The eldest has finished his university studies, while the others are currently studying at the university.

Lourdes' wish is to continue helping her children because she hopes that all of them will have the opportunity to complete their degrees at the university.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Karla

texts.en:
Karla showcases Andean gemstones in handcrafted silver jewelry. She would like to use this loan to purchase raw materials and expand her stock.

Karla has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is her story:

"It's wonderful when people can appreciate the legacy of our ancestral art through different kinds of jewelry. I find inspiration in our Andean culture. But I identify most with preserving our ancient heritage and am glad that I can add something to this process. My parents have worked with jewelry since I was a little girl and they taught me that I can express art and creativity in each piece I craft. Thanks to them, I now create my own designs and I feel proud that I've found my own expression in our family's art."

"My jewelry work has made it possible to finish college while exploring my creativity, which is so satisfying. I'm proud of my jewelry and knowing that each piece brings happiness to someone in another part of the world. This is what motivates me to continue growing as a person. Thank you so much for your support."

Use the link below to view Karla's jewelry designs on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=7497

loans.use: to purchase silver and gemstones for her jewelry designs

loans.name: Erlinda's Group

texts.en: Erlinda is 62 years old and lives in Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and the mother of two children. She earns a living by selling ready-to-wear items and earns about PHP 3,000 a month. She is requesting a loan for PHP 14,900 to buy the materials she needs to repair her house. She has been a member of PMPC for nine years, and hopes to engage in other type of business in the future. Erlinda is the leader of a two-person loan group. Although they borrow as a group, each member has her own business.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair her house.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Con un préstamo de 15,900 pesos Adela ha podido comprar mercancía para ofrecer nuevos productos a sus clientes.
Adela es una negociante nata, toda su vida se ha dedicado a desarrollar actividades que le generen ingresos sin la necesidad de emplearse. Hace tres años Adela inició vendiendo carne en su barrio y notó que quien compra carne compra viveres y verduras para acomprañarla, así que ha decidido anexar una mesa con verduras y vegetales en su carnicería.
Adela es casada, su esposo trabaja instalando pisos. Juntos tienen dos hijos de 10 y 15 años que están en la escuela. 
El deseo de Adela es continuar diversificando su negocio hasta convertirlo en un mini mercado que venda todo tipo de comestibles.
texts.en:
With a loan of 15,900, Adela has been able to buy more products and offer new items to her customers.

Adela is a born businesswoman; all her life, she has been involved in activities that generate an income without her having to become an employee.  Three years ago, Adela began selling meat in her neighborhood, and she noticed that those who bought meat also came out to buy vegetables and other foodstuffs to accompany it.  Therefore, she decided to add a table of vegetables and greens in her butcher shop.

Adela is married, and her husband works installing floors.  Together, they have two children aged 10 and 15, who are both in school.

Adela's wish is to continue diversifying her business and convert it into a mini-market selling all different types of foodstuffs.

loans.use: to buy more goods for her butcher shop.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en: Beatriz is 46 years old and lives in Duanguican, Tudela with her husband and six children. For the last six years, she has earned a living by running a store where she sells a variety of products. She is requesting a loan for PHP 50,000 to buy additional products to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents and other items. Beatriz joined PMPC eight years ago as a way to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en: Alexander is married and the father of three children. He is 43 years old and lives in Salimpono, Panaon, Misamis Occidental, where he earns a living by growing coconuts. He has been in this line of work for five years, and is requesting a loan for PHP 50,000 to buy a motor vehicle. Alexander has been a member of PMPC for the last year and hopes in the future to increase his output by acquiring another parcel of land.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith is 43 years old, married and the mother of four children who lives in Sandugan, Larena, Siquijor. For the last three years, she has earned a living by raising pigs. She is requesting a loan for PHP 50,000 to buy feed and medicines for her piggery. She has been a member of the Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for almost two years and hopes to expand her business so that she can help her children complete college.

loans.use: to buy feed and medications for the pigs she is raising.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en: Eliza is 64 years old and lives in Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban. She is widowed and has three children. To earn a living, Eliza has a business selling food in her community. She earns about PHP 2000 each month doing this type of work. Eliza has requested a loan of PHP 8000 to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar and oil. Eliza has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, she would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar and oil

loans.name: Um

texts.en:
Um is 62 years old, married, and has ten children. Seven of them are already settled for marriage while the rest of them are still single and living with her in a small home at Baray district, Kompong Tom province. Um, like other villagers, operates a farming business to generate income. She plants and harvests rice and potatoes for sale each harvesting season. However, the income she generates from the business seems rarely enough to satisfy the family because Um owns only a small-sized piece of land for farming. Um plans to increase its size some day and make it more productive and thus she will be able to provide basic necessities for her family.

In order to go a long way in pursuing the attainment of her goal and to augment her income, Um would like to ask for a loan of KHR 2,000,000 to purchase farm supplies for her potato crops, including fertilizers and pesticides. She hopes that her family will be secure and she will be able to afford to provide comfortable living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies for her potato crops, including fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea, aged 42, is an industrious farmer who has spent her lifetime dedicated to a farming business which is the major source of income for her family. Chea has the full support of her husband for the maintenance of the field. She manages a few lots of farm land, on which she cultivates rice and potatoes for sale each harvesting season. With the income from the business, Chea is able to send all her children to school. However hard her work is, Chea lives happily according to her life style. She is married with seven single children, two of whom are employed.

With the sum of USD 250 that she requested from Kiva lenders, Chea will purchase gasoline for the maintenance of her plowing machine and pesticides for her crops. She believes that she will be able to increase her productivity with the help of the loan. In the future, she wishes to expand her farming business.

loans.use: to buy gasoline for the maintenance of her plowing machine and pesticides for her crops.

loans.name: Niterimbere Group

texts.fr:
Charlène fait partie du groupe Niterimbere  et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 21 ans et est mariée à Thierry, agriculteur. 
Elle prend soin d’un enfant de 12 ans, qui étudie, membre de sa famille élargie.

Elle fait le commerce de banane et de l’huile de palme  depuis 2 ans. 
Elle est à son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de bananes et une grande quantité  d’huile de palme,  à revendre  pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait    augmenter son capital.
texts.en:
Charlène is part of the Niterimbere group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 21 years old and is married to Thierry, a farmer. She takes care of a 12 year old child, who studies, a member of her extended family.

She has been selling bananas and palm oil for 2 years. She is on her first loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan that she obtains, she is going to increase her capital and buy many bananas and a large quantity of palm oil, to resell in order to make more. In the coming years, she would like to increase her capital.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy many bananas and a large quantity of palm oil, to resell in order to make more.

loans.name: Locresia

texts.en:
Locresia is 57 years old and lives in Taboc Norte, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. Locresia has a store where she sells a variety of products, such as soft drinks, cooking oils, bread, biscuits, candies, and many others. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to renovate her house.

Locresia has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Locresia hopes to own a house and lot.

loans.use: to pay for house repair

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam is 43 years old, a resident of Kompong Cham province, where the land is very fertile, which enables local people to pursue agricultural businesses as their main source of income. They grow various sorts of seasonal crops such as rice, potatoes, beans, maize, corns, peppers, cashew nuts, and sugar cane. As others, Sam is also working in agribusinesses, planting and harvesting rice and potatoes for sale. She has been doing this for almost 13 years and earns approximately KHR 10,000 per day. Sam is married with four children – three single children and a married child.

Sam would like to maintain her farming business, which is why she decided to borrow additional capital to make improvements to it. She has applied for a loan of KHR 3,000,000 to purchase a new plowing machine for the maintenance of the rice field. Sam hopes to achieve financial stability and uplift her family out of poverty some day.

loans.use: to purchase a new plowing machine for the maintenance of the rice field.

loans.name: Soeung

texts.en:
Soeung is 40 years of age and married. She has given birth to three children who are currently studying and under her care. To earn an income for the family, she owns and manages a rice farming business on around two-hectares of farmland, which was passed down from her ancestors. She has many years of experience in this field and has learned a lot from her farming practices, so she can continually improve her business while she operates it.

Due to financial constraints, Soeung would like to borrow additional capital from Kiva lenders to purchase farm supplies such as fertilizers, herbicides and insecticide spray, to keep her crops growing and in good condition. This loan will allow Soeung to make progress in her business and ensure a good harvest. She plans to save her income for her children's educational purposes and future family emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as fertilizers, herbicides and insecticide spray, to keep her crops growing and in good condition.

loans.name: Firdous' Group

texts.en: Firdous has requested for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband, who earns a living by making covers for sofas. She is requesting a loan to buy the cloth he needs to make better-quality and more durable sofa covers for his clients. He wants to do this because it will help him get more orders and increase his sales and income. Firdous is a housewife who stays at home to do her household chores. She is the mother of six children, five boys and one daughter. Her oldest son works while three of her other children are in school. She hopes that as a result of her husband’s business improvement, her children will be able to continue their education.

loans.use: to buy materials for a sofa-covering business.

loans.name: Lordita

texts.en:
Lordita is 55 years old and lives in San Vicente Alto, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has three children. Lordita has a snack vending business, which sells bingka, or rice cakes. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase flour and other raw ingredients for bingka-making.

Lordita has been a member of PMPC for nine years. In the future, Lordita hopes to own a house and lot.

loans.use: to purchase flour and other raw ingredients for making "bingka"

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea is 30 years old, and a married woman. She resides in Ornlong Veng district, Oddar Meanchey province. She and her spouse cultivate around two and a half hectares of farm land just to meet the family’s needs. Together, they are responsible for four dependent children, all of whom are attending a local school. They also help their parents in the business when they don’t have classes. Chea has been doing farming for many years. However, she still uses traditional methods and perseverance to achieve her aims.

To help her improve in the business, Chea would like to take out a loan of KHR 1,000,000 to purchase herbicide spraying, a farm mower, and pay labor costs. Chea hopes to receive this loan to invest in her business which will result in a fruitful harvest in the coming season. She is very happy and appreciative of  the constant support.

loans.use: to purchase herbicide spraying, a farm mower, and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Abduchabor

texts.ru:
В первый раз Абдучабор получил кредит для закупа телят. Абдучабор увеличил количество скота. Получил хорошую прибыль, расширил свою деятельность. Абдучабор женил сыновей. Он отремонтировал коровник. Абдучабор создал хорошие условия для разведения крупного рогатого скота. Он благодарен людям, которые ему помогли в продвижении его деятельности. 
Абдучабор кредитуется в нашей организации несколько лет, он имеет хорошую репутация и отличную кредитную историю. 
Абдучабор хочет получить кредит в размере 10 000 сомони для закупа бычков и корма для скота.
texts.en:
The first time Abduchabor received a loan to purchase calves. Abduchabor increased the number of cattle, received a good profit, and has expanded his activities. Abduchabor held weddings for his sons. He renovated the barn. Abduchabor created good conditions for breeding cattle. He is grateful to the people who helped him to progress in his activities.  

Abduchabor has been borrowing from our organization for several years and has a good reputation and excellent credit history. 

Abduchabor wants to get a loan of 10,000 somoni to purchase calves and cattle feed.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and feed

loans.name: Lok

texts.en:
Lok is 42 years old and married with four children. She is a proud farmer who owns 1.5 hectares of farm land, on which she cultivates rice crops annually to provide enough sustenance for the family. At the same time, Lok raises pigs and a couple of cows for future sale as well as for additional income. She lives happily with her family in a small village in Siem Reap province.

Lok would like to have a vehicle for home use; it would provide good transportation service for her family and help reduce some household expenditures. As a result, she is seeking a loan in the sum of 500 USD to purchase a motorcycle both for home use and business. This will contribute to bettering her living status. For her future plans, Lok wants to save money to expand her farming business and wishes to provide her children with higher education.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle both for home use and business.

loans.name: Denis

texts.es: Denis  de 42 años de edad  vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 19 y 24 años. Su experiencia de negocios nació vendiendo mercancía en el departamento de la Guajira, hermoso lugar ubicado al norte de Colombia. Desde hace 5 años llegó a la ciudad de Cartagena y emprendió su propia aventura de negocios, vendiendo productos variados de necesidad doméstica, pero su inclinación hacia el arte la direccionaron hacia la lencería, como hoy lo hace; ella fabrica hermosos cubrelechos, guardarropas, adornos de cocina, baño y comedor, que  vende a crédito y de contado, a clientes por encargo, mientras ella cada tres días les responde. Denis atiende su negocio desde las 2:00 de la tarde hasta las 11:00 de la noche, sus clientes son principalmente mujeres, amas de casa y empleadas; ella quiere incursionar en un mercado menos doméstico y requiere mejorar su proceso de acabado, esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una fileteadora, una máquina de fotografía y materiales e insumos  como telas e hilos para el desarrollo y perfeccionamiento de su actividad. Con su credikiva planea lograr el éxito y abrir su oferta en almacenes y establecimientos comerciales, pues sueña con ver sus productos exhibidos por todas partes y más adelante tener su propio punto comercial, pues ha programado que sus hijos termines sus carreras universitarias, y todo esto lo logrará gracias a sus esfuerzos y los de su cónyuge, con quien está de acuerdo para potenciarle a sus hijos un futuro exitoso.
texts.en:
Denis is 42 and lives in Cartagena with her husband and two children ages 19 and 24. Her first business experience was selling merchandise in Guajira department, a beautiful place in northern Colombia. She came to Cartagena 5 years ago and started her own business selling various household items; however, she was more interested in art and started making fine linens, which she does today. She makes bedspreads, clothing, and kitchen, bath, and dining room accessories that she sells for cash or credit upon receiving the customer's order, which she fills in three days. 

Denis works from 2:00 p.m. until 11:00 p.m., and most of her customers are women, homemakers and employees. She wants to sell to market professionals and needs to upgrade her finishing process. Therefore, she is seeking her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to buy an overlock sewing machine, a camera, and materials and supplies such as fabric and thread to develop and improve her work. With her Kiva loan, she plans to be successful and offer her merchandise to department stores and commercial venues. She dreams of seeing her merchandise displayed everywhere and eventually have her own store. She is determined that her children finish college, and she will achieve all this through her and her husband's efforts, as he agrees that education will bring success to their children.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine, a camera, and materials and supplies such as fabric and thread to develop and improve her work.

loans.name: Shahida's Group

texts.en:
Shahida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who is an iron-smith and makes iron boxes on order.

With the loan investment he will buy iron and other tools to make better quality iron boxes and increase his profits.

He has been operating his business for many years and his boxes have high demand in the city due to their quality and durability.

Shahida is confident that her husband will successfully be able to improve his income after investing the loan.

loans.use: To buy iron for her husband's iron box-making business

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is a very active lady and performs her household tasks very well by staying at home.

She has eight children. Six of them are studying while the remaining two are not of school-going age yet.

Her husband sells breakfast. His shop is located in the nearby market and he sells a breakfast dish called nan chanay.

Shazia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan investment, he will buy breakfast-making ingredients in a larger quantity, which will help him prepare better quality and quantity of breakfast for his clients.

He will also increase the sitting arrangement at his shop to offer better services to his clients.

He is very experienced in his business and Shazia is hopeful that the loan investment will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her husband's breakfast-making and -selling business

loans.name: Merys Altagracia

texts.es:
Con un préstamo de 31,500 pesos Merys ha podido comprar telas y materiales para su negocio de decoración. Merys se dedica a la confección de colchas, edredones, cortinas, tapizar muebles y confección de gorras como la que muestra en la foto. Merys tiene 8 años de estar desarrollando este negocio y es una apasionada de la buena calidad en la terminación de sus productos así como de la combinación de materiales nuevos con reciclados.
Merys es casada y su esposo es líder de grupo de una fábrica de ropa. Tienen 2 hijos de 12 y 2 años. El mayor está en la escuela. 
Merys desea diseñar más variedad de gorras y sombreros y su mayor sueño es terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Merys was able to use the money from 31,500 peso loan to buy fabric and supplies for her decoration business.  Merys makes bedspreads, quilts, curtains, recovers furniture, and makes hats like the one she is wearing in the picture.  Merys has been developing this business for eight years and she is passionate about the good quality of her completed products and the combination of new and recycled materials.

Merys is married and her husband leads a group that makes clothing.  They have two children ages 12 and 2.  The oldest attends school. 

Merys would like a greater variety of hats and caps and her greatest dream is to build her home.

loans.use: to buy fabric and supplies

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru:
Дилшод родился 1990 году в районе Вахш. Он живет с женой. Дилшод с 14 лет занимается торговлей. Раньше он помогал своим родителям. Торговля является семейным бизнесом. 
Сейчас у Дилшода свой собственный бизнес. У него имеется продуктовый магазин, где он работает продавцом. 
Дилшод просит кредит для закупа кондитерских, хлебобулочных изделий, напитков, молочных продуктов, а также приобретения холодильника для хранения молочных продуктов.
texts.en:
Dilshod was born in 1990 in the Vahsh region. He lives with his wife. Dilshod has been engaged in trade since he was 14 years old. Previously, he helped his parents. Trade is the family business. 

Now Dilshod has his own business. He has a grocery store where he works as a shopkeeper. 
 
Dilshod is askinf for a loan to buy confections, baked goods, beverages, and dairy products, and to acquire a refrigerator to store dairy products.

loans.use: to purchase confections, baked goods, beverages, and dairy products, and to acquire a refrigerator

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en: Gilda is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 7 children. Gilda has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for 9 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Gilda became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, Gilda hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Elsa has a store that sells viand, like fried chicken. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for cooking viand.

Elsa became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, Elsa hopes to improve her business for her children.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making viand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a display case for pastry and bread.

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.ru: Баром- молодой мужчина, со средним образованием.Живет в  сельской местности и занимается откормом скота на дому.Он все свою жизнь держит скот  это занятие является основным занятием в этих местах.У Бахрома дополнительно есть другой доход он автомаляр и в сезон занимается покраской машин.С нашей организацией Бахром сотрудничает более трёх лет и все кредиты использует на откорм скота и всегда целенаправленно  использует все кредиты.На полученный кредит Бахром хочет купить скот и увеличить поголовье скота.
texts.en:
Bahrom is a young man with a secondary education. He lives in a rural area and is engaged in fattening livestock at his home. All his life he has tended cattle. This is the main occupation in these parts. In addition, Bahrom has other income: he has an autoshop and in season he deals with painting cars. 

Bahrom has been working with our organization for more than three years and all his loans have been used for fattening livestock and he always uses all the loans with purpose. With his received loan, Bahrom wants to buy cattle to increase the number of his livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Tursunmurod

texts.ru:
Турсунмурод очень трудолюбивый и умный человек. У него высшее экономическое образование. Ему 64 года. Турсунмурод вдовец. У него двое детей. Его сыновья работают в дехканском хозяйстве. 
Турсунмурод занимается выращиванием овощей и бахчевых культур. Он работает усердно и получает хороший урожай. Кроме того Турсунмурод занимается скотоводством. Он разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности Турсунмурод занимается 16 лет. 
Турсунмурод просит кредит для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en:
Tursunmurod is a very hardworking and intelligent man. He has a degree in economics. He is 64 years old and a widower. He has two children. His work in an orchard. 

Tursunmurod is involved in growing vegetables and melons. He works hard and gets a good crop. He is also engaged in animal husbandry. He breeds cattle for sale in the future. He has been engaged in these activities for 16 years. 

Tursunmurod is asking for a loan to buy cattle.

loans.use: to buy bulls and calves

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Anita  has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She had this business for six years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. 

Anita has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Anita hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita  is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has six children.  Rosita has a food/retail shop (or sari-sari store) that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 8 years. She requested a loan of  4,000PHP  to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.  Rosita has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Rosita hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy T-shirts, blouses, trousers and sandals.

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es: Diana de 25 años de edad es una mujer casada que tiene dos hijos en las edades de 6 y 8 años., los cuales impulsan e inspiran su hacer  día a día.  Desde hace 4 años Diana empezó a vender calzado informal femenino en un mercado doméstico, aprovechando que su esposo es fabricante de este producto y poco a poco fue obteniendo utilidades, que le permitieron ahorrar y comprar una vitrina en la cual exhibirlos. Su hermana estudiante de tecnología, le enseñó a usar el computador y a acceder a la red de internet, allí encontró oportunidades de convertir este conocimiento en un negocio que le generara un poco mas de recursos,  para aumentar sus ingresos. Así fue como adecuó su sala y la convirtió en un café internet con dos computadores,  para sus vecinas mas cercanas; con este pequeño negocio impactó en su barrio, por eso le agregó transcripciones, luego mas computadores, servicio de llamadas y videojuegos. Hoy es necesario ampliar su negocio, para atender su creciente  demanda y lograr aun más ingresos. Actualmente el negocio de producción de calzado de su esposo lo integra a sus actividades, porque ella invierte en materias primas e insumos y su esposo realiza los hermosos diseños, y fábrica el calzado, que al final Diana vende entre su clientela.  Sus compras las realiza de contado en almacenes especializados en calzado y sus proveedores de internet son 3. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará cuerina, pegantes, suelas, e insumos para que su esposo desarrolle con creatividad, múltiples sandalias que sus clientes le han encargado. Con esta inversión dará respuesta oportuna a sus compradores y poco a poco logrará aumentar sus ventas, las que al final se convierten en bienestar para su familia, por quien ella y su esposo trabajan persistentemente..
texts.en:
Diana is 25 years old and a married woman with two children of the ages of 6 and 8 years old.  They motivate her and inspire her to work every day.  About four years ago, Diana began to sell informal women's shoes from a shop in her home, taking advantage of the fact that her husband is a maker of these goods, and little by little gaining profits, which allowed her to save up and buy a glass cabinet to show off her goods.

Her sister is a technology student and taught her to use a computer and to access the internet, and there she found many opportunities to take the business knowledge that she has and use it to generate greater profits, increasing her income.  That is why she converted her living room into an internet cafe with two computers for the use of her nearby neighbors.  This small business had a large impact on her neighborhood, so she has added a transcription service, then more computers, a calling service, and video games.

Today, she feels the need to increase the size of her business to meet her customers' growing demand and to obtain a better income.  Currently, her husband's business of footwear production is also a part of her daily activities, as she invests in prime quality materials and supplies and her husband creates the beautiful designs and fabricates the shoes that Diana sells to her customers.  She makes her purchases in specialty stores for cobbling and has three internet suppliers as well.

She is applying for a micro-loan, her first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy patent leather, heels, soles, and other supplies so that her husband can creatively develop a variety of sandals to the specifications of her customers' requests.  With this investment, it will be an opportunity to fulfill her customers' needs quickly and to slowly increase her sales, which has the end result of greater well-being for her family.  A goal that she and her husband consistently work toward.

loans.use: to buy patent leather, heels, soles, and other inputs to construct sandals.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Yokubjon

texts.ru:
Ёкубчон проживает в городе Кургантюбе. Ему 37 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Ёкубчон занимается торговлей. У него имеется магазин, где он продает канцелярские товары. Торговлей Ёкубчон занимается более пяти лет. 
Кроме того Ёкубчон у себя дома разводит крупнорогатый скот. Сейчас у него дома три быка. 
Ёкубчон берет кредит для приобретения канцелярских товаров и закупа телят, чтобы увеличить ассортимент своего товара и поголовья крупного рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Yokubjon lives in the town of Kurgantyube. He is 37 years old, married and has two children. Yokubjon is a shopkeeper. He has a shop where he sells office supplies. Yokubjon has been engaged in trade for more than five years. 

In addition, Yokubjon raises cattle at his home. Currently, he has three bulls at his home. 

Yokubjon is taking a loan for the purchase of office supplies and to buy calves, in order to increase the range of his goods and the number of his cattle.

loans.use: to purchase office supplies and to buy calves

loans.name: Paulita

texts.en: Paulita is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child. Paulita  has a food/retail shop (sari-sari store) that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000  to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Paulita  has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Paulita hopes to improve her business for the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en: Reynaldo is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has two children. Reynaldo is providing motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan of PHP4,000 to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.  Reynaldo has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Reynaldo hopes to improve his services for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline

loans.name: Tres Caminos Rio Grande Group

texts.es:
El Sr. Jose María, tiene  29 años de edad, está casado, vive junto con su esposa y sus 4 hijos en una aldea  que pertenece al  departamento de Intibucá. Jose ha crecido con su familia agricultora y donde vive es una zona apta para cultivos.  Hace 5 años que realiza sus propios cultivos de papa, hortalizas, maíz y frijoles y esta producción la vende en el mercado local. Esta solicitando un préstamo por  9,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar fertilizantes, abonos, semilla de papa y de habichuela para el cultivo y para darle un buen mantenimiento al mismo. Su meta es seguir trabajando para mantener su actividad productiva y para la educación de sus hijos.
El pertenece al  Grupo que se llama Tres Caminos Rio Grande, que está formado por 12 integrantes, que se dedican a la agricultura y viven en la misma comunidad, en la foto se identifican así: a la izquierda  esta doña  Tomasa de vestido azul, luego Leonarda, Jeremías, Agustina, María Asención, Santos, Pedro, Víctor, Jose María, Dionicio y don Ciriaco a la derecha de camisa color salmón, y doña María Dolores no salió en la foto. Este grupo ha trabajado juntos desde hace varios años apoyándose entre ellos.
texts.en:
Sr. Jose María is 29 years old, married, and lives with his wife and four children in a neighborhood in the Department of Intibucá. Jose grew up in a farming family and lives in an area that is suitable for crops. For the past five years, he has been growing his own crops of potatoes, vegetables, corn, and beans and selling what he produces at the local market. He is requesting a loan of 9,000 HNL so that he can buy fertilizers, compost, potato seedlings, and green bean seeds for growing crops and to provide good maintenance. His goal is to continue working so that he can maintain a productive business and provide an education for his children.

Jose belongs to the group called “Tres Caminos Rio Grande”, which consists of 12 members who engage in agriculture and live in the same community. The photo shows the following members: Doña Tomasa is on the left wearing a blue dress followed by Leonarda, Jeremías, Agustina, María Asención, Santos, Pedro, Víctor, Jose María, Dionicio, and Don Ciriaco on the right who is wearing a salmon-colored shirt. Doña María Dolores is not in the photo. This group has been working together for several years and supporting one another.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, potato seedlings, and green bean seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, cooking fat and a goat to resell.

loans.name: Nazeeran's Group

texts.en:
Nazeeran sells rice. She operates her business from her home and supports her family well. Her husband does a job while her eldest son is a factory worker. Her 3 remaining children are enrolled in local school and getting their education.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner, Asasah, for further expansion of her rice business. With the loan investment, she will buy rice in bulk quantity and of better quality that will help her to increase her sales and income. She is very experienced in her business and has been operating it for the past many years. She is confident that her business will be improved further after investing the loan.

loans.use: To buy rice for rice business

loans.name: Pelan

texts.en: Pelan is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has two children. Pelan is providing motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan of 4,000PHP to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the services. Pelan has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Pelan hopes to improve his services for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 

Merlina sells snacks like banana cakes and hot cakes in their local community. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients like sugar, flour and cheese for making snacks.

Merlina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Merlina hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida is a seamstress and sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She is 55 years old and a mother of 2two sons and a daughter. Her eldest son works in the airforce and her second son is a teacher. Her daughter sews clothes at home to support the family. All of her children are literate and have good educational background.
Khalida has applied for a loan from KIVA partner, Asasah, for her sewing business. With the loan investment, she will buy a new sewing machine to improve her business. This will help her finishing the client orders on time and increase her income.
She isa  very experienced and skillful sewing expert and confident about her business success after investing the loan.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas 2 Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama “Mujeres Unidas 2” está en el 18 Ciclo con 20 integrantes. Gracias al trabajo que ellas hacen están saliendo adelante y se están ayudando las unas a las otras.
Maria es miembro de esta grupo, ella motiva siempre a sus compañeras para que no se desanimen y sigan trabajando juntas siempre. Ella tiene una despensa bien surtida y solicita el crédito para poder surtir con bebidas, lácteos, carnes, verduras y demás insumos su negocio. Agradece a Kiva y fundación paraguaya por la ayuda que esta recibiendo, pues le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
The committee called “Mujeres Unidas 2” (United Women 2) is in its 18th loan cycle with 20 members. Thanks to their work, they have been able to move forward and help one another.

Maria is a member of this group. She always motivates her fellow group members to prevent them from becoming complacent and to keep them working together. Maria has a well-stocked food pantry and is requesting a loan so that she can acquire beverages, dairy products, meats, vegetables, and other items for her business. She is grateful to Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya for the support she has received since it will be of great help.

loans.use: to buy beverages, dairy products, meats, vegetables, and other items.
