Jezza Lynda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her juice and paraphernalia for packing.

She has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Jezza Lynda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her juice and paraphernalia for packing.

loans.name: Vilma Elizabeth

texts.es:
Vilma, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poder realizar una nueva inversión al negocio, se comprará utensilios plásticos y también utensilios de loza o barro como ollas, sartenes, que son los que ofrece su clientela, esto le permitirá mantener surtido el negocio para atender la demanda.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue positivo, ayudándole fortalecer el negocio con los cuales ha logrado mejorar sus ganancias, ayudando mejor a su familia, sus condiciones familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Vilma is asking for a new loan to reinvest in her business.  She will buy plastic utensils and also kitchen utensils made of china and pottery, like pots, skillets, and those which she wants to sell to her customers.  This will allow her to keep her business well-stocked to keep up with demand.

The effect of her prior loan was positive, helping her to strengthen her business with which she has been able to make greater profits, helping her family to do better and improving their economic condition.

loans.use: to buy plastic products and pots, and pottery pans.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 45 years old and married, with seven children.  Five of her children are in school.  She and her family live in the Philippines.

Josephine is in the agricultural business of raising pigs.  She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and medicines for her pigs.

Josephine has been raising pigs for ten years now.  She has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Josephine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for her pigs.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poderlo invertir en las mejoras para la vivienda, él con su familia se han trasladado a una nueva vivienda, por eso volvera a construirle a su esposa el rancho al interior de la vivienda,se comprara láminas, clavos, alambre, madera, que son materiales para poder realizar el trabajo, ya que es una necesidad de su esposa para realizar la venta, esto le ayudará dando los recursos necesarios para que el pueda cumplir con este objetivo.

El préstamo anterior le ayudó a mejorar el lugar donde anteriormente su esposa vendia tortillas, ademas se ha comprado unos bienes para el hogar, su aspiración es mejorar su empleo para aumentar su salario, ya que esto le dará una mejor solvencia para poder cubrir todas las necesidades de la familia.
texts.en:
Juan is requesting a new loan to make improvements to his home. He and his family have moved to a new house, and he is building out the interior of the house for his wife. He will buy sheet metal, nails, wire, and wood, which are the materials he needs to create the space his wife needs to sell her products. The loan will give him the resources necessary to meet this goal.

The prior loan allowed him to upgrade the space where his wife sold tortillas and buy some household items. His goal is to have better work so that he can earn more and have money on hand to meet the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal, nails, wire, and wood.

loans.name: Neojali

texts.es:
Neojalí  tiene 51 años de edad, es padre de familia, él y sus dos hijos trabajan la tierra, son  agricultores desde hace muchos años,  vive en una comunidad  situada en  la zona Sur de Costa Rica, ubicada en Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas, llamada La Danta.  La economía local está basada en actividades agropecuarias, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería.
El está solicitando un préstamo de un millón treinta y cinco mil colones (¢1.035.000) para la compra de árboles pequeños de rambután , esta es una fruta de agradable sabor y de mucha aceptación en el país, además debe comprar un sistema de irrigación para atender la siembra, necesita también  abono y fungicidas para proteger sus cultivos durante el proceso de producción . 
El es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal denla Danta S.A, una de las 110 empresas de crédito comunal de Costa Rica .
texts.en:
Neojalí is 51 years old, the father of a family, and he and his two sons work the land and have been agricultural laborers for many years.  He lives in a community situated in the South of Costa Rica in Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas, called La Danta.  The local economy is based on agricultural activities where the principal production is tubers, coffee, corn, beans, and small animal production.

He is asking for a loan of one million thirty five thousand Colones (¢1.035.000) to buy sapling lychee trees.  This is a small fruit with an agreeable flavor which is very popular in this country.  He also wants to buy an irrigation system to help with the planted trees, and he will also need fertilizers and fungicides to protect his plants during the production process.

He is a member of the Community Loan Group of Denla Danta S.A, one of 110 community loan groups in Costa Rica .

loans.use: to buy lychee trees, fertilizer, and irrigation equipment.

loans.name: Rosa Ines

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 37 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona  con sus 2 pequeños hijos, lastimosamente por diversas razones desde hace varios años se separó de su pareja; ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; ella ha trabajado desde muy joven para apoyar a sus padres y para poder solventar sus gastos, por tal motivo no pudo cursar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado poder estudiar la carrera de Enfermería, en sus ratos libres le gusta dedicar un poco de tiempo a la lectura y en algunas ocasiones cuando visita a sus padres cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, día a día Rosa trabaja brindando servicios de limpieza en una empresa de su ciudad, ella trabaja un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y se siente a gusto realizando su labor, ya que sus jefes la consideran mucho por su buen desempeño y por su trato amable hacia los demás.
Rosa se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería, tales como: polos, chompas, casacas, pantalones y entre otras prendas de vestir; de esta manera Rosa podrá contar con la mercadería necesaria para iniciar su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, ya que de esta manera podrá conseguir ingresos económicos, los cuales desea utilizar para poder asegurar la educación y bienestar de sus pequeños hijos, ya que su gran sueño es verlos convertidos en grandes profesionales y en hombres de bien.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 37 year old woman. She lives in the city of Ica in the district of Parcona, with her 2 small sons. Unfortunately due to several reasons she separated from her partner several years ago. She is a very friendly, hard working and enthusiastic person who dedicated all her strength to moving her family forward. She has worked since she was very young to support her parents and be able to cover her expenses. Because of this, she could not study for a professional degree but has liked being able to study nursing. In her free time she lives to spend a little time reading and sometimes when she visits her parents she cooks the delicious dish "arroz con pollo" (rice with chicken) to share with her family. 

By her own initiative, Rosa works everyday providing cleaning services with a business in her city. She works about 10 hours daily and feels happy to do her work because her bosses hold her in high regard for her work performance and friendly manner to others. 

Rosa is very thankful for the Kiva lenders because thanks to the help provided, she will be able to buy merchandise including polo t shirts, sweaters, jackets and pants, among other articles of clothing. In this way Rosa will be able to have the necessary merchandise to begin her small clothing business and be able to receive income. She hopes to use this money to secure the education and well being of her small children. Her largest dream is to see them become great professionals and good men.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as polo shirts, sweaters, jackets, pants, etc.

loans.name: El Marjon

texts.en: El Marjon lives in Tugas, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. He has earned a living by providing transportation services for seven years to support the needs of his two children. He gets an income of 15,000 PHP a month from this business. For a 25-year-old father, there’s nothing more that can make him happy than to see his children successful in their studies. Without hesitation, El Marjon is borrowing 17,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories and provide his children a better education. He joined GDMPC in 2011. His plan in the future is to hopefully improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Ernesa

texts.en:
This is Ernesa, 26, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Reniel, her business partner, and she is a mother to her two children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Ernesa operates a food stall where she sells mami.  Mami is a noodle soup, which refers to a variety of soups with noodles and other ingredients served in a light broth. This is served in the morning and for snacks. She earns a minimum of PHP 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a  PHP 10,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities of products like noodles, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Ernesa dreams of having her own house and giving all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en:
Charlyn is married and has two children. She is 52 years old and resides at Bonifacio. 

Charlyn owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting corn for sale to earn a living. She has been 14 years in this business. Each month, she earns PHP 18,000 doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase fertilizer such as manure. 

In 2010, Charlyn joined GDMPC. She wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Juan Gilberto

texts.es:
Juan, solicita un nuevo préstamo porque necesita invertir en el negocio, ya que la actividad agrícola está por iniciar, el quiere la siembra de granos básicos, para esto invertirá una parte del préstamo en abono y herbicidas, la otra parte la invertirá en la compra de pescado y camarones para continuar con sus ventas, este préstamo servirá para que continúe en su trabajo y al mismo tiempo puede realizar la siembra de maíz, Juan busca aquellas actividades de las cuales pueda obtener dinero, aunque implique cambiar de negocio cada cierto tiempo.

El préstamo anterior le ayudo a generar más confianza a sus clientes y le permitió atraer a nuevos, incluyendo zonas donde no tenía acceso, esto le ha permitido crecer y al mismo tiempo generar una mejor condición más estable a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is requesting a new loan because he needs to invest in his business, since he is about to begin farming. He wants to sow basic grains, so he will invest part of the loan in fertilizer and herbicides. He will invest the rest in purchasing fish and shrimp to continue selling them. This loan will allow him to continue with his work and grow corn at the same time. Juan looks for any work where he can make money, even if it means changing businesses every so often.

The previous loan helped him gain trust with his customers and allowed him to attract new ones, including areas to where he had no acces. This has allowed him to grow and, at the same time, to provide his family with greater stability.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and herbicides, fish and shrimp.

loans.name: Carlota

texts.en:
Carlota works hard to support her family. She is married and has a computer rental business in the Philippines. Carlota has asked for a loan of PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy an additional unit and more computer supplies. She has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Carlota would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional unit and more computer supplies.

loans.name: Gaudencio

texts.en: Gaudencio, 45 years old, is a married entrepreneur from Bolinsong, Bonifacio with five children. He is earning an income from his rice production business. It has been in operation for almost eight years now and he earn 3,000 PHP a month. To improve his business, Gaudencio is borrowing 2,800 PHP from GDMPC micro credit, which he just joined recently, to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Before long, he’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Luz

texts.en: Luz is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Luz has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home-use products and beverages. She had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to increase her stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Luz has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Luz hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to increase her stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Gilber

texts.es:
Gilber es un joven  agricultor   de  25 años de edad , soltero, vive con sus padres en la zona sur del país, ubicada en Concepción de Pilas en la provincia de Puntarenas. La economía local está basada en actividades agropecuarias, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería.
El está solicitando un préstamo de ochocientos cincuenta mil colones (¢850.000) para la compra de semilla de maíz,  abono granular y fungicidas para proteger sus cultivos durante el desarrollo y evitar también que aparezcan hongos en sus plantaciones, El vende la cosecha en una asociación de la localidad y de esta manera ayuda a sus padres, cubre los gastos de sus estudios  y hace frente a otras obligaciones económicas, desea llegar a ser un productor grande y prosperar y tener mayores ingresos y comodidades para él y su familia y para ello hace el mayor de sus esfuerzos en la actividad agrícola 
Gilber es  socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal denla Danta S.A, una de las 150 empresas de crédito comunal de Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Gilber is a young agricultural worker of 25 years of age, single, and lives with her parents in the Southern region of the country, located in Concepción de Pilas in the province of Puntarenas. The local economy is based on farming and agriculture, where there is planting of root vegetables, coffee, corn, beans, and small animal raising.

He is asking for a loan of eight hundred and fifty thousand Colones (¢850,000) to buy corn for seed, solid fertilizers, and fungicides to protect his plants during their development and avoid the appearance of mushrooms or fungus in his fields.  He sells the harvested crops in an association in his locale and in this way he helps his parents, covers the costs of his studies, and makes headway in his other economic obligations.  He wants to become a large scale producer and prosper and have a greater income for himself and his family and for this he needs to make his strongest effort toward his agricultural activities.

Gilber is a member of the community banking group Denla Danta S.A, one of the 150 community credit banking groups in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy grain fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides, and a day laborer to plant the corn.

loans.name: Maria Higinia

texts.es:
María, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para realizar la compra de materiales para la producción de tortillas, obteniendo los productos como la leña y el maíz a un precio más cómodo, ya que realizara una compra por mayor, esto le permitirá tener a la mano lo necesario continuar realizando las ventas.

Con el préstamo anterior logró mejorar la disponibilidad en el negocio, ya que realizó una buena compra y de sus ganancias ha logrado mantenerse en este tiempo reinvirtiendo en el negocio, su familia cuenta con una condicion mas favorable.
texts.en:
María is requesting a new loan in order to purchase materials to make tortillas. This will allow her to obtain products such as firewood and corn at  affordable prices, since she will purchase wholesale, and everything she needs to make her sales will be at hand. 

With the previous loan she managed to improve her business' liquidity, because she made a good purchase and has been able to support herself with the profit during this time. She has reinvested in the business and her family is now in a more favorable situation.

loans.use: to purchase firewood and corn.

loans.name: José Miguel

texts.es:
José Miguel es un señor  de 45 años de edad,  es ganadero vive con su pareja y sus dos hijos pequeños  en una comunidad de la zona Sur de Costa Rica, ubicada en Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas. La economía local está basada en actividades agropecuarias, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería, y otros productos.
José Miguel tiene esta actividad ganadera como la única fuente de ingreso para mantener a su familia.
El necesita un préstamo por  ochocientos cincuenta mil colones (¢850.000) para comprar ganado de engorde y revenderlo en las ferias ganaderas  trimestrales locales.
Con este préstamo él piensa preparase con más cabezas de ganado para la próxima venta que ya se avecina, José Miguel es socio de la  Empresa de Crédito Comunal de La Danta S.A.  y manifiesta estar muy agradecido porque este es un medio de adquirir financiamiento de acceso rápido y a plazos aceptables para gente trabajadora y que desea superarse.
texts.en:
José Miguel is a 45 year old man, a rancher who lives with his partner and two small children in a community in the southern region of Costa Rica.  He is located in Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas.  The local economy is based on agricultural activities  among which are the growth of tubers, coffee, corn, beans, and small animals and other products.

José Miguel works as a cattle rancher, and it is his only means of supporting his family.

He needs a loan of eight hundred and fifty thousand Colons (¢850,000) to buy cattle to fatten and resell them at the cattle fairs which happen three times a year in his area.

With this loan, he thinks he will be well prepared with more head of cattle for the next cattle sale that is coming up.  José Miguel is a member of the community credit group of La Danta S.A.  and he says he is very thankful because this is a way of acquiring financing quickly and at good rates for working people who want to be successful.

loans.use: to buy cattle to fatten.

loans.name: Constancia

texts.en:
Constancia is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Constancia has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for eight years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. 

Constancia has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
Sergio, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres ocupando una habitación pequeña, la misma esta ubicada en la zona Barrio Grafico de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que se dedica a la venta de salteñas, tucumanas (in english  are called turnovers) y refrescos dentro de una universidad privada ya que debe solventar los gastos de estudios, alimentación y pago de servicios básicos, pues con lo poco que gana trabajando por más de ocho horas no le alcanza para aumentar su capital y comprar sus insumos para la elaboración de salteñas y tucumanas, es por eso que solicita el crédito para aumentar su capital y poder comprar los insumos como ser papas, carne de pollo y de res, huevos, etc., y tener mejores ingresos para terminar sus estudios ya que actualmente estudia técnico medio en el área de contabilidad.
El sueño de Sergio es mejorar sus ingresos y poder independizarse para mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Sergio is single, and he does not have children.  He lives in his parents’ house, occupying one small room.  The house is in the Bario Grafico area of the city of La Paz.

He currently gets income from selling “salteñas” [traditional meat-filled pastries], “tucumanas” [turnovers], and soft drinks at a private university.  He does this because he needs to cover the expenses for education, food and basic services.  

With the little that he earns for working over eight hours, he does not have enough to increase his capital and to buy supplies to make the salteñas and tucumanas.  That is why he is requesting a loan.  He will use the loan to buy supplies like potatoes, chicken, beef, and eggs, etc.  He will then have better income in order to complete his studies.  He is currently studying to be a certified accounting technician.

Sergio’s dream is to improve his income and to be able to become independent.  He wants this in order to improve his quality of life.

This is the second time he has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy supplies like potatoes, chicken, beef, eggs, and flour for making “salteñas” [traditional meat-filled pastries] and “tucumanas” [turnovers].

loans.name: Prudencia

texts.es:
Prudencia, es soltera y tiene un hijo pequeño, vive en dos habitaciones alquiladas pequeñas  con paredes de ladrillo y el piso de tierra, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja por más de diez horas confeccionando trajes para varones y mujeres ya que es el único ingreso que tiene para los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia. Anteriormente elaboraba mantas, pero ahora ha cambiado de rubro y le va mejor.
El  crédito lo requiere para la compra de telas para la confección de trajes ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para aumentar su capital.
El sueño de Prudencia es mejorar sus ingresos y adquirir un anticrético ya que desea ahorrar en el pago de alquileres y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la cuarta vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la cuarta con KIVA.
texts.en:
Prudencia is single, and she has a small child.  She lives in two small rented rooms with brick walls and dirt floors.  The house is in the Irpavi area of the city of La Paz.

She currently works for over ten hours making men’s and women’s clothes.  It is the only income she has for the food expenses and payments for her family’s basic services.  She used to make blankets, but she has now changed her business, and it is going better for her.

She needs the loan to buy fabric to make clothes.  She does not earn enough to increase her capital.

Prudencia's dream is to improve her income and to get an “anticrético” [A tenant pays a fixed sum upon renting a house instead of montly rent. The sum is considered a loan to the property owner and is returned in full when the rental period is over.]  She wants to save the rent payments and improve her quality of life.

This is the fourth time she has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make men's and women's clothes.

loans.name: Noel Antonio

texts.es:
Noel Antonio, reside en el departamento de Masaya ciudad de las flores, tiene la edad de 37 años, casado su núcleo familiar conformado por su hija y su esposa. Tiene de experiencia 16 años en el mercado, consiste en el  servicio de venta de comida (sopas y nacatamales), trabaja cinco días a la semana que son los días que considera es mas fuerte la demanda,   por lo general las ventas las realiza al mediodía porque nos comenta que esta en un buen punto porque al frente de su puesto se detienen los vehículos de transporte pesado a descansar por lo que aprovechan en  almorzar.
Noel Antonio  escucho que en Ceprodel apoyan al mejor  desarrollo de los negocio y  manifiesta que quiere seguir en el mercado dando siempre  un mejor servicio. Por eso se acerca a nuestras oficinas para solicitar un financiamiento que le permita realizar las compras de alimento para  elaborar el producto ya que con lo que tiene no le da abasto, porque comenta que esta teniendo mas demanda y su negocio ha ido engrandeciendo.
texts.en:
Noel Antonio lives in the department of Masaya, Las Flores city. He is 37 and married. His nuclear family is made up of his daughter and his wife.
He has 16 years' experience in the market selling food (soups and nactamales). He works five days per week on the days he believes he has the greatest demand. In general he makes his sales at noon; he says he is in a good spot, because transportation vehicles stop right out front of his stall for rest stops, and they take advantage of that time to eat.
Noel Antonio heard that Ceprodel supports business development, and he says he wants to keep going in the market and provide a better and better service. For this reason he has come to our offices to request a loan which will allow him to purchase food for making his products; his current stock is not enough because he says he is experiencing a greater demand and his business is expanding.

loans.use: to purchase tablecloths, plastic tables, plastic chairs, cups, plates, glasses, hogs, a large fritter, zinc laminate, wood.

loans.name: Maria Herlinda

texts.es: La Sra. Maria de 49 años de edad es casada y no tiene dependientes económicos. Ella   y su esposo trabajan como operados en diferentes maquiladoras de la ciudad. Maria es una persona emprendedora y que sabe enfrentar los obstáculos que se le presentan en la vida y no darse por vencida, ella ha sabido salir adelante junto con su esposo son un gran ejemplo para la sociedad por que a pesar de la muchas adversidades siempre han salido adelante. En esta ocasión Maria pide de nuestra ayuda para construir un cuarto en la planta alta de su casa ya que quiere   mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia agradecería mucho la ayuda que se pueda brindar.
texts.en: Maria is 49 years old and married and no longer has dependent children.  She and her husband work as operators in different factories in the city.  Maria is a hardworking person and knows how to face obstacles as they present themselves in her life and they will not conquer her.  She has learned to get ahead along with her husband, and they are an example for their community because in spite of many adversities they have always gotten ahead.  On this occasion, Maria asked for our help to construct a room on the upper floor of her house, as she wanted to improve the quality of life for her family and she is thankful for the help that she has been given.

loans.use: construction of a room on the upper floor.

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
San Juan  se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá, es un grupo muy unido ya que todas ellas trabajan y se ayudan las unas a las otras.
Albina es una de estas mujeres, ella se dedica a la venta de queso y leche desde hace ya un tiempo, por lo que ya tiene muy buena clientela. Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante y es por ello que siempre da lo mejor de si misma. Solicita el crédito para la compra de leche y también de queso, para que con esto pueda seguir ayudando a su familia y también surtiendo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
“San Juan” is the name of this excellent group of women from the city of Itá. It is a very unified group in which all of the women work and help one another.

Albina is one of these women. She has been selling cheese and milk for some time and has many good customers. Albina is a person who has plenty of drive to succeed, which explains why she always gives her best. She is requesting a loan to buy milk and cheese so that she can continue helping her family and supplying products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy milk and cheese.

loans.name: Waldo

texts.es:
Waldo, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus familiares ocupando solo una habitación, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Senkata de la ciudad de El Alto.
El estudió solo hasta la secundaria y actualmente trabaja como albañil realizando todo tipo de trabajos en construcción a contrato o de forma independiente ya que trabaja por más de doce horas al día.
El crédito lo requiere para alquilar un terreno en la ZonA de Luribay para la plantación de fruta, especificamente duraznos, ya que desea dedicarse a la agricultura para mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida para posteriormente independizarse.
Es la primera vez que el cliente solicita crédito con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Waldo is single, and he does not have children.  He live in his relatives’ house, occupying only one room.  The house is in the Senkata area of the city of El Alto.

He only went to school up until high school.  He currently works as a bricklayer.  He does all types of construction work by contract or independently.  He works for over 12 hours a day.

He needs to loan to rent a piece of lant in the Luribay area.  He will plant fruit, specifically, he will plant peaches.  He wishes to devote himself to agriculture in order to improve his income and his quality of life.  He will also do this in order to later become independent.

This is the first time he has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to rent land in the Luribay area in order to grow peaches.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy, esta casada y tiene tres hijos de los cuales dos ya son independientes, viven en una casa alquilada  ocupando dos habitaciones, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
Nancy trabaja como contador público en una empresa privada por más de ocho horas ya que debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación y educación de su familia; también cuenta con los ingresos de la jubilación de su esposo.
Nancy solicita el crédito para pagar la universidad de su tercer hijo ya que él aun no trabaja y con lo poco que ellos ganan no les alcanza para poder pagar los estudios de su hijo.
El sueño de Nancy es que su hijo sea profesional y también tener casa propia para darle más seguridad y comodidad a su familia de esta forma mejorar sus ingresos.
Es la quinta vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Nancy is married and has three children; two of them are independent.  They live in a rented house, and they occupy two rooms.  The house in in the Tembladerani area of the city of La Paz.

Nancy works as a public accountant in a private company for over eight hours.  She does this because she needs to cover her family’s food and education expenses.  She also has income from her husband’s retirement.

Nancy is requesting the loan to pay university expenses for her third child.  He does not work yet, and the little that they earn is not enough to be able to pay for her son’s education.

Nancy’s dream is for her son to be a professional.  She also dreams of having her own house in order to make her family safer and more comfortable.  This way their income will improve.

This is the fifth time she has requested a loan from IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay tuition at the university that her third child attends.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana, esta casada y tiene tres hijos que están en etapa escolar, viven en casa propia ocupando tres habitaciones, la casa esta ubicada en la zona  Las Lomas de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que trabaja por más de diez horas como portera en un colegio y su esposo trabaja como sastre y con lo poco que ganan deben cubrir los gastos de educación, alimentación ya pago de servicios básicos de su familia; es por eso que solicita el crédito para la compra de cemento, estuco y ladrillos  ya que desea refaccionar el muro perimetral de su vivienda para dar más seguridad a su familia.
El sueño de Susana, es mejorar sus ingresos y tener un negocio propio ya que el trabajo que realiza actualmente es muy sacrificado, y también desea mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Susana is married and has three school age children.  They live in their own house, occupying three rooms.  The house is in the Las Lomas area of the city of La Paz.

She currently gets income from working over ten hours as a janitor at a school.  Her husband works as a tailor.  With the little that they earn they need to cover the family’s expenses for education, food, and basic services.

That is why she is requesting the loan to buy cement, stucco, and bricks.  She wishes to repair the perimeter wall of her house in order to make her family safer.

Susana’s dream is to improve her income and to have her own business.  The work she currently does is very hard.  She also wishes to improve her quality of life.

This is the second time she has worked with IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy cement, stucco, and bricks to repair the perimeter wall of her house.

loans.name: Saul

texts.es:
Saúl, tiene 39 años de edad, vive con dos hijos y su esposa en una aldea cercana de Puerto Cortes.
El tiene un año de haber establecido su propio negocio de venta de ropa de segunda mano. El negocio está ubicado en una plaza comercial donde alquila actualmente, vende todo tipo de ropa usada. Anteriormente él se dedicaba a realizar trabajos de jornalero, pero necesitaba obtener más ingresos para mantener el hogar y se decidió por este negocio. El solicita un préstamo de 10,000 Lempiras para comprar más ropa para la venta y siempre mantener surtido. Su idea es que a medida va creciendo la demanda va a establecer otro negocio en otro lugar como una sucursal para incrementar los ingresos.
texts.en:
Saúl, age 39, lives with his wife and children in a village near Puerto Cortes.

He established his own business of selling second-hand clothes one year ago.  The business is in a commercial plaza where he currently rents.  He sells all types of used clothes.  He used to work as a day worker.  However, he needed more income to support his household, and he decided upon this business.

He is requesting a loan for 10,000 lempiras to buy more clothes to sell and to always be stocked.  He believes that as demand is growing he will establish another business in another place as a branch to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy used clothes to stock his business.

loans.name: Lorena Elizabeth

texts.es:
Lorena de 31 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene una hija de 8 años de edad y vive con su madre en una Colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula.
Lorena es muy trabajadora y en busca de obtener ingresos hace 5 años decidió establecer su propio negocio en su casa, donde vende mercadería en general, vende ropa nueva para damas caballeros y niños, ropa interior, zapatos, sandalias y cosméticos, además vende choco bananos y topogigios ( helados). Alguna  mercadería la compra al crédito y otra de contado. El préstamo que solicita por 5,000.00 Lempiras es para comprar ropa nueva para surtir el negocio y aumentar las ventas y también le permitirá realizar las compras solo de contado y no tener deuda con los proveedores. La  meta de este año es trabajar solo con préstamos de ODEF.
texts.en:
Lorena, age 31, is a single mother, and she has an eight year old daughter.  She lives with her mother in a suburban neighborhood in San Pedro Sula.

Lorena is very hard-working.  Five years ago, in the search to get income, she decided to establish her own business in her house.  She sells general merchandise, new clothes for women, men, and children, underwear, shoes, sandals, and cosmetics.  She also sells chocolate bananas and “topogigios” (ice cream).  She buys some merchandise on credit and some for cash. 

The 5,000 lempira loan she is requesting is to buy new clothes to stock her business and increase sales.  The loan will also allow her to buy for cash and not have debt with the providers.

Her goal this year is to work only with loans from ODEF.

loans.use: to buy new clothes to stock her business and increase sales.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 48 years old and married with five children.

Concepcion is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Concepcion requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and medicine for her pigs.

Concepcion has been raising pigs for six years and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF, and more recently, from Kiva, to sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for her pigs.

loans.name: Marcela Elizabeth

texts.es: MARCELA TIENE 38 AÑOS ES SOLTERA Y SIN HIJOS. ES UNA MUJER INDEPENDIENTE QUE QUIERE SAKUR ADELANTE Y AYUDAR A SUS PADRES. ELLA VIVE EN OLMOS, EN EL NORTE DEL PERU.  MARCELA CUENTA CON UN ESTABLECIMIENTO EN EL PUEBLO DONDE VENDE  GOLISINAS. GASEOSAS, CERVEZA Y COMIDA. TIENE 4 AÑOS VENDIENDO EN ESTA TIENDA Y TIENE BUENA CLIENTELA  YA QUE LOS CARROS LLEGAN ABASTECER DE COMBUSTIBLE Y APROVECHAN EN REALIZAR COMPRAS. ELLA IDENTIFICO ESTA OPORTUNIDAD DE HACER NEGOCIOS Y LE HA RESULTADO SER RENTABLE. PRECISAMENTE CON EL FIN DE SEGUIR TOMANDO VENTAJE DE LOS BENEFICIOS COMERCIALES DE SU TIENDA, ELLA SOLICITA UN CREDITO DE 1500 SOLES A EDPYME ALTERNATIVA PARA LA COMPRA DE MOSTRADORES (VITRINAS) Y MERCADERIA YA QUE NECESITA EL CAPITAL PARA SURTIR LA BODEGA.
texts.en:
Marcela is 38, single, and has no children. She is an independent woman who wants to succeed and help her parents. She lives in Olmos, in northern Peru. 

Marcela has an establishment in the town where she sells candy, soft drinks, beer and food. She has been selling in this store for four years and has a good clientele. The cars come to buy fuel, and take advantage of this to make purchases. She identified this business opportunity and it has turned out to be profitable for her. 

Precisely to continue to take advantage of the commercial benefits of her store, she is requesting a loan of 1500 soles from Edpyme Alternative, in order  to buy display counters and merchandise. She needs the capital to stock the small grocery store.

loans.use: To buy display counters, and merchandise. She needs the capital to stock the small grocery store.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Lucia works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling vegetables in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store.  Lucia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Lucia has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nancy is 35 years old and four of her children are in school.

Nancy has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines. Nancy requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell in her food stall.

Nancy has been in this business for five years. In the future, Nancy would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en: Ofelia is from Sta. Maria, Tangub City. She is 48 years old and married with 4 children. Ofelia raises pigs to sell, and she has been doing this for 12 years. She earns 20,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Ofelia joined Kiva partner, GDMPC. Ofelia is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Oliva

texts.en: Oliva is 63 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Oliva has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for 9 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Oliva has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Oliva hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Ricardo Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Ricardo es un joven de 22 años, es soltero, vive con su madre y hermanos en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Subtanjalla, él es una persona muy alegre, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo por superarse y salir adelante junto con su familia; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar para apoyar a su madre, no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería de Sistemas que tanto quería, pero sueña con poder hacerlo pronto.
Gracias al apoyo de su madre, desde hace 2 años producto de su esfuerzo y de ahorros de trabajos anteriores, Ricardo pudo poner en marcha su pequeño negocio de cabinas de internet, día a día desde tempranas horas de la mañana brinda sus servicios, él se siente a gusto en su negocio y cree que le va bien por la buena atención que ofrece a sus clientes.
Ricardo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una computadora, ya que desea contar con ella para poder aumentar sus cabinas de internet y así poder incrementar sus ingresos económicos; de esta manera Ricardo espera poder utilizar sus ganancias para apoyar a su madre en la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ricardo is a young man of 22 years of age. He is single and lives with his mother and siblings in the city of Ica in the district of Subtanjalla. He is a very happy, hardworking an enthusiastic person with a strong desire to improve and get ahead together with his family. Unfortunately because he needed to work to support his mother, he could not study to become a Systems Engineer as he had badly wanted to,  but he dreams of doing so one day soon.   

Thanks to his mother's support, two years ago as a product of his hard work and savings from prior work, Ricardo was able to set up his small internet cafe business. Every day from very early in the morning he offers his services. He feels happy with his business and believes it is going well because of the good service he offers his clients. 

Ricardo is very thankful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help he will be able to buy a computer, which he hopes to use to expand his internet business and in this way increase his income. In this way Ricardo hopes to be able to use his earnings to help his mother to build their house.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Sari Mertha Group

texts.en:
Ni Luh is 31 years old and lives in Melaya, West Bali.  She is married and has one child who is still in school.   Her husband works as a farmer.  Though Ni Luh often helps her husband, she also raises pigs in her yard to supplement her family’s income.  She has been raising pigs for five years.  

Ni Luh is the head of the Sari Mertha group, which is made up of 12 neighbors from the same village.  With the 1M IDR loan that Ni Luh receives, she will purchase three piglets and pig feed.  She plans to sell the piglets after six months for use as pork. With her earnings, she plans to purchase more pigs.  With the income from her pig raising, she hopes to be able to pay school fees.

loans.use: To purchase three piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Ernalyn

texts.en: Ernalyn is a widow who has one kid. Ernalyn is 38 years old and lives in Bolinsong, Bonifacio. Ernalyn owns and operate a farm, planting & harvesting rice to sell to earn a living and she's been in this business for 13 years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 4,400 PHP to pay labor costs for land plowing. In 2010, Ernalyn joined GDMPC. In the future, Ernalyn wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay labor costs for land plowing

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha is a widow who has three children. Editha is 50 years old and lives in Bolinsong, Bonifacio. Editha owns and operates a farm, planting & harvesting rice to sell to earn a living and she's been in this business for 14 years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 3,700 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In 2008, Editha joined GDMPC. In the future, Editha wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en: Marcela is married, 51 years of age, and lives in Silanga, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, together with her 5 kids. Marcela operates a sari-sari store to earn a living. She has been in this business for 12 years, and she earns 10,000 PHP every month. She is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase supplementary goods for her general store. She joined GDMPC in 2009. Marcela wishes that her business will expand.

loans.use: To purchase supplementary goods for her general store

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.en: Rose Marie is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. Rose Marie has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for 7 years. She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Rose Marie has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Rose Marie hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: Cesar tiene 28 años de edad, es conviviente y con 1 hijos. Vive en la zona rural del Distrito de Tambogrande y solo cuenta con servicio de energía eléctrica. El se dedica primordialmente a la actividad de la ganaderia ovinos y cerdos, ademas a la agricultura contando con 1 hectarea de terreno agrícola sembrado de limón que cosecha semanalmente. Este terreno recibo por herencia de su padre, muestra negocios bien asistidos y mas de 5 años de experiencia en los mismos. Cesar es una persona que conoce muy bien su rubro y sabe identificar oportunidades y piensa que este es un buen momento para sacar un credito de 2200 soles con Edpyme Alternativa y el apoyo de Kiva. Piensa invertir en la compra de alimentos para el engorde de sus ovinos y cerdos ademas la compra de fertilizantes para el cultivo de limon y asi lograr una mejor produccíon y vender sus animales a un mejor precio. Seguira buscando nuevas maneras de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Cesar is 28, and lives with his partner and one son. He lives in the rural part of Tambogrande district, and only has electricity service.  His primary activity is raising sheep and pigs. He also farms, and has one hectare of farmland planted with lemons, which he harvests weekly. He inherited this land from his father. 

His businesses are well looked after, and he has more than five years experience in them. Cesar is a person who knows his line of business very well, and knows how to identify opportunities. He believes this a good time to take out a loan of 2200 soles from Edpyme Alternativa, with the support of Kiva. 

He intends to purchase feed for fattening his sheep and pigs, as well as fertilizers for his lemon plantation. This way he can achieve better production and sell his animals at a better price. 

He will continue seeking new ways of improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase feed for fattening his sheep and pigs, and to buy fertilizers for his lemon plantation.

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.en: Zoraida is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Zoraida has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for nine years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.  Zoraida has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Zoraida hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Myla

texts.en:
Myla is from Migcanaway, Tangub City. She is 36 years old and married. 

To make a living, Myla runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home-use products in the local community. Myla has been in her business for 5 years and earns 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Myla is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. In 2011, Myla joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Sari Maju Group

texts.en:
The Sari Maju group received their third loans from MUK and each member gets 1,5M IDR. The loan will be used to support the pig-raising business, by purchasing piglets or feed.
Because her sow is pregnant, Ni Komang will use her loan to purchase feed for the piglets who will be born soon. She hopes the piglets will be born safely and she will be able to sell all the piglets after 2 months. The profit from this business will be used for her family and also for saving for future needs. She has a dream of renovating her house using the profits from this business.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed

loans.name: Jaine

texts.en: Jaine is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. Jaine has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for 8 years. She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Jaine has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Jaine hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
This is Eden, 45, resident of Baccor, Cavite, Philippines. Her husband is Erlando, and she is mother to their three children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business.

Eden operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php600 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory and for the maintenance of her sewing machine. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Eden hopes that her business will grow and expand through all her hard work on it. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en: Mary Grace is a 38-year-old resident of Pangabuan, Tangub City. Mary Grace provides for her 5 children from the little amount of 10,000 PHP she gains monthly from her own piggery business. She has been doing this for 5 years as an aid to the income gained from her husband. However, in 2009 she became a member of GDMPC. She has applied for a loan at GDMPC in the amount of 30,000 PHP to buy feeding supplies. Mary Grace wants to make an expansion to her business one day.

loans.use: To buy feeding supplies

loans.name: Kenny Elizabeth

texts.es:
Kenny es una joven de 21 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, ella convive con su pareja a quien ama y espera formar pronto su familia; ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadores y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar para apoyar a su padres no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas que tanto desea, pero sueña con poder hacerlo pronto; en sus ratos libres le gusta hacer deporte y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pato para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, día a día Kenny trabaja como ayudante de cocina en un restaurante de su ciudad, ella labora un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y se siente a gusto realizando su labor, ya que sus jefes la consideran mucho por su buen desempeño y por su trato amable hacia los demás.
Kenny se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir sus gastos médicos, tales como: radiografías, gastos de farmacia y medicamentos; de esta manera Kenny podrá realizar su chequeo médico que tanto necesita, para así poder conseguir alivio a sus dolencias; así en un futuro no muy lejano ella espera poder tener su propio negocio de venta de comida y su casa propia.
texts.en:
Kenny is a young woman of 21 years of age. She lives in the city of Pisco with her partner who she loves and with whom she hopes to soon form her family. She is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person with a strong desire to get ahead. Unfortunately because she had to work to support her family she unable to study business administration, which she wanted to do very much, but she hopes to be able to do so soon. In her free time she likes to play sport and sometimes she cooks the delicious "rice with duck"  dish to share with her family. 

With much determination and hard work, every day Kenny works as a kitchen hand in a restaurant in her city.  She works approximately 10 hours every day and enjoys her work, since her bosses have a high opinion of her due to her good work and her friendly disposition.

Kenny is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to their help she will be able to cover medical expenses such as: radiography, pharmaceutic expenses and medications. In this way Kenny will be able to have the medical check-up she needs so much so as to obtain relief for her pain. In this way in the not-distant future she hopes to be able to have her own food-sales business and her own house.

loans.use: to cover medical expenses such as radiography, pharmaceutical expenses and medication.

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
El señor Porfirio se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 30 años, el habita en la comunidad las nubes, su principal actividad es la siembra de Maíz, pero además se dedica a la siembra de ayotes, el cual lo podemos apreciar en la fotografía que se le tomo, el inicio a trabajar desde muy pequeño con sus padres y es por esa razón que se ha dedicado toda su vida al trabajo de campo. 
Es un hombre con deseos de superación, ya que cada dia el lo demuestra en su trabajo y con la ayuda de la familia kiva a través de los créditos que le otorguen.
texts.en:
Porfirio has been farming for 30 years. He lives in the community of Las Nubes. His main activity is growing corn, but he also grows squash, as we can see in the photo that was taken. He started working from a young age with his parents, and that is why he has devoted his whole life to farm work. 

He is a man with the desire to improve himself. He demonstrates this each day in his work, with the help of the Kiva family through the loans they grant him.

loans.use: To pay for farming expenses.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Estevina

texts.es: Estevina tiene 46 años de edad es soltera y sin hijos dependientes. Es una mujer independiente con mucha energia que vive en casa propia en una zona rural cerca a la ciudad de Mochumi en el norte del Peru. Ella es una persona que siempre ha esta maneras de salir adelante y ha podido lograr entender de ganaderia, agriculura e incluso de venta de bebidas. Por un lado, la actividad en la que se ha especializado Estevina es la crianza y venta de animales, los cuales cría en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio y los comercializa quincenalmente. Adicionalmente clienta se dedica a la elaboración y venta de chicha, contando con clientela fidelizada. Ademas ella se dedica a la agricultura y tiene sembrado 1 Ha de maíz. Precisamente, ella ve oportuno solicitar un prestamo de 1000 soles a Edpyme Alternativa con el apoyo de Kiva, para mantener sus diversas actividades. En articular ella solicita el crédito para invertirlo en alimento para animales y en labores agrícolas.
texts.en: Estevina is 46 years old. She is single and has noe dependent children. She is an independent women who has a lot of energy and lives in her own home in a rural area near the city of Mochumi in northern Peru. She is a person who has always sought ways to get ahead and has been able to learn cattle ranching and farming and even selling beverages. The activity that Estevina has specialized in is raising and selling animals. She raises them in pens located in the back of her house and she sells them every two weeks. In addition, she makes and sells chicha. She has regular customers. She also farms and has planted 1 hectare of corn. Right now, she has decided to take out a loan of 1000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa with the support of  Kiva, to maintain her different activities. In particular, she is asking for a loan to invest in animal feed and on agricultural labor costs.

loans.use: to invest in animal feed and agricultural labor costs, such as planting the corn.

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.en:
Dionisio  is  56  years old, single and lives in the Philippines. He has 1 child. 
 
Dionisio has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. He has had this business for 9 years. He requested a loan for  5,000 PHP  to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Dionisio has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Dionisio hopes to improve his business for the education of his child.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en:
Ricky is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 2 children. 

Ricky is providing motorela, or motorcycle services. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy tools and  pay for the gasoline for the services.

Ricky has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future,Ricky hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline.

loans.name: Merilyn

texts.en:
Merilyn is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 

Merilyn has a pigpen and she sells grown and matured pigs. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 4,000 PHP to buy animal feed for the pigs.

Merilyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Merilyn hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Karina Jeanneth

texts.es:
Karina,manifiesta que su negocio está aumentando, para esto considera necesaria la inversión de un nuevo préstamo que le permite realizar las compras de los productos para elaborar la comida, carne, condimentos, aceite, verduras, arroz, frijoles, ya que éstos los utiliza a diario para poder preparar los diferentes menús a los clientes.
El préstamo anterior ayudó a mejorar su calidad en el negocio, manteniendo una mejor variedad de comida para los diferentes gustos de su clientela, considera que ha tenido variaciones positivas y que sus ganancias están manteniéndose para poder cubrir las necesidades en su familia.
texts.en:
Karina says that her business is growing. That is why she thinks it is neccesary to invest in a new loan that will allow her to buy products to make her food, such as meat, condiments, oil, vegetables, rice, and beans. These are the things she uses every day to make the different dishes for the cutsomers.

The previous loan helped her to improve the quality of the loan, keeping a variety of food for her customers' different tastes. She thinks that she has had positive changes and that her earnings are being maintained in order to cover her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy meat, condiments, oil, vegatables, rice and beans.

loans.name: Saul Antonio

texts.es:
Saúl, solicita un nuevo préstamo para poder invertir en la producción de maíz, ya que está iniciando su nueva siembra de esta época, se comprará abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, que son los insumos que para mejorar la producción.

Con el préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo que le permitió mejorar la producción de maíz, el efecto se ha sido reflejado en la buena cosecha que recibió, de la cual logró alimentar a su familia en este tiempo y comercializar otra parte para poder tener entradas de dinero.
texts.en:
Saúl is asking for a new loan to be able to invest in corn production, since he is starting a new crop this season. He will buy fertilizer, herbicides and  insecticides, which are the materials to improve the production.

With the previous loan, there was a positive effect that allowed him to improve corn production. This effect can be seen in the harvest he obtained, with which he was able to feed his family and sell another part to have some income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, and insecticides.

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
Juan Bautista es un hombre de 42 años de edad, casado,  tiene cuatro hijos menores de edad, todos estudiantes ,él  vive junto a  su familia en una comunidad de la zona Sur de Costa Rica, ubicada en Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas. La economía local está basada en actividades agropecuarias, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería.
Juan se dedica a comprar ganado pequeño, lo somete al proceso de engorde y lo revende en las ferias ganaderas, actividad que es muy común en la zona, ahí se lleva el ganado para venderlo a otros ganaderos más grandes, él está solicitando un préstamo por ochocientos cincuenta mil colones (¢850.000) para comprar 5 terneros engordarlos y venderlos.
Nos comentó que el suyo es el único ingreso que tiene su familia  y  por eso se esfuerza mucho en el trabajo que realiza para que sus animales sean de gran aceptación en este mercado.
Juan Bautista es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal en la Danta, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. ELV espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico, además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Juan Bautista is a 42 year old man who is married with four minor children, all of whom are students. He lives with his family in a community in the southern part of Costa Rica, located in Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas. The local economy is agriculture based, with a focus on tubers, coffee, corn, beans and livestock.  

Juan buys young cattle, fattens them and then re-sells them at livestock fairs, a business that is very common in the area. He takes his cattle there to sell to other larger ranchers. He is applying for a loan for 800,000 colones in order to purchase five calves, fatten them and re-sell them. 

He tells us that this is the only income his family has and thus he puts a lot of effort into his work so that his animals are very popular in this market.

Juan Bautista is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Communal Bank in La Danta, one of the 150 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. He hopes to continue growing at a personal and financial level as well as to actively participate in the credit organization in his community.

loans.use: purchase 5 calves.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is 45 years old, married, and lives in the Philippines. She has two children.

Emilia has a food/retail shop, or "sari-sari" store, that sells canned goods, snacks, personal-care products, home-use products, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.  Emilia  is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Emilia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. 

Nelson is providing motorela, or motorcycle, transport services. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for gasoline for his service.

Nelson is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Nelson hopes to improve his service for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo es un hombre de 40 años de edad, padre de  dos niños , vive junto a  su familia, en una comunidad de la zona Sur de Costa Rica, ubicada en Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas llamada La Danta.  La economía local está basada en actividades agropecuarias, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería.
Eduardo  está solicitando un préstamo de un millón treinta y cinco mil colones (¢1.035.000) para  la compra de semilla de jengibre y tiquizque, ambos son tubérculos de gran aceptación en el mercado costarricense, necesita también insumos para darle mantenimiento a su siembra por medio de abono y fungicidas para proteger sus cultivos de plagas y hongos que puedan afectar la producción mientras se desarrolla,  gracias a este préstamo podrá seguir desarrollando esta actividad y sembrando estos productos pues esta labor es precisamente la que le permite llevar el sustento a su familia. 
El pertenece como muchos otros agricultores de la zona a la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de la Danta S.A, una de las 150 empresas de crédito comunal de Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Eduardo is a 40 year old man and the father of two children.  He lives with his family in a community in the southern part of Costa Rica, located in Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas. The local economy is agriculture based, with a focus on tubers, coffee, corn, beans and livestock.  

Educardo is applying for a loan of one million, thirty-five thousand colones to purchase ginger and tiquizque seed, both very popular tubers in the Costa Rican market. He also needs supplies to maintain his fields with fertilizer and fungicides to protect his crops from plagues and fungus that can affect production as they develop. Thanks to this loan he will be able to continue developing his business and planting these products since this labor is precisely what enables him to feed his family.

He belongs, along with many other farmers in the area, to the Empresa de Crédito Commual Bank of La Danta, S.A., one of the 150 communal credit businesses of Costa Rica.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and tuber seeds.

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna  is 39 years old and married.  She lives in the Philippines.

Rosanna has a food/retail shop, or "sari-sari" store, that sells canned goods, snacks, personal-care products, home-use products, and beverages. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000  to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. 

Rosanna  is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Rosanna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with three children. 

Narcisa  has a food/retail shop, or "sari-sari" store, that sells canned goods, snacks, personal-care products, home-use products, and beverages. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Narcisa is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Narcisa hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Nelyn

texts.en:
Nelyn is 64 years old and lives in Libertad Alto, Sinacaban. She is widowed with three children.

Nelyn has a store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for five years. Nelyn requested a loan of PHP 14,500 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

Nelyn has been a member of PMPC for five years.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 53 years old and lives in Libertad Alto, Sinacaban. She is married with seven children. 

Elvie has a store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for six years. Elvie requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.  

Elvie has been a member of PMPC for seven years.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
El  Sr. Armando es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 19 años, es soltero, se dedica como vendedor ambulante de artículos de mercerías y bijouteries, artículos de celulares y accesorios.
El es un joven con muchos anhelos y sueños que desea cumplir, es por ellos que desea seguir trabajando y seguir trabajando. Es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de bijouteries, artículos de mercería, y demás, ya que quiere poder seguir trabajando y de esa forma estar cada vez más cerca de cumplir con sus sueños.
texts.en:
Sr. Armando is from the city of Santaní. He is 19 years old, single, and works as a street vendor. He sells sewing supplies, trinkets, mobile phones, and accessories. Armando is a young man who has many ambitions and dreams to fulfill. For this reason, he wants to continue working. He is a hardworking and enterprising individual.

Armando is requesting a loan in order to buy trinkets, sewing supplies, and other merchandise. He wants to continue working so that he can be one step closer to fulfilling his dreams.

loans.use: to buy trinkets, sewing supplies, and other merchandise.

loans.name: Rafael David

texts.es:
Rafael, solicita un préstamo para poder realizar su trabajo agrícola, está iniciando la siembra de maíz, maicillo, y pipian, él pagara el alquiler del terreno comprandose además los insumos como el abono, semilla mejorada, herbicidas, pago de mozos, este préstamo será muy importante para Rafael ya que cubrirá todos los gastos necesarios para realizar la siembra.

Con el préstamo anterior logró comprarse los materiales necesarios, de los cuales logró obtener una cosecha abundante esta producción le ha permitido mejorar su condición alimenticia en el hogar, comprando lo necesario para el sustento y algunos artículos.
texts.en:
Rafael is requesting a loan in order to carry out his farm work. He is beginning the planting of corn, sorghum and squash. He will pay to lease land, also buying agricultural supplies such as manure, improved seed and herbicides, and paying for farm labor. 

This loan will be very important for Rafael as he will cover all the needed expenses for carrying out the planting.

With the previous loan he managed to buy the necessary materials, with which he succeeded in obtaining an abundant harvest. This production has allowed him to improve his household's diet, by buying what he needs for his livelihood plus a few other items.

loans.use: To pay to lease land and buy fertilizer, improved seed and herbicides, and to pay for farm labor.

loans.name: Martha Julia

texts.es:
Doña Martha tiene 49 años, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos y vive en el Municipio de Tela, Atlántida.
Doña Martha tiene un negocio de venta de ropa nueva y usada, para dama y niños y ropa de cama, adicionalmente también tiene un puesto de venta de golosinas (churros, dulces, galletas, refrescos etc.). Este negocio lo tiene establecido en su casa hasta donde llegan los clientes a comprar. Con este negocio ha tenido los ingresos que le han permitido mantener a su familia, ya que no cuenta con la ayuda del padre de sus hijos. Dedica casi todo el día a su negocio.
Ella para seguir manteniendo estable su negocio ha solicitado un préstamo a Odef por la cantidad de 10000 lempiras para compra de un fardo de ropa de cama y compra de golosinas, con esta inversión podrá mejorar los ingresos y sus ventas aumentaran favorablemente.
Su meta es darle a sus hijos una buena educacion.
texts.en:
Doña Martha is a 49-year-old single mother with three children. She lives in the town of Tela, Atlántida.

Doña Martha has a business of selling new and used clothing for women and children. She also sells bed sheets and manages a vending post where she sells snack foods (donuts, sweets, cookies, soft drinks, and other items). This business is established at her home, which enables her to sustain her family since she does not receive assistance from the father of her children. She spends almost the entire day at her business.

Martha wants to continue maintaining a stable business, so she is requesting a loan from ODEF in the amount of 10,000 HNL. She will buy one bundle of bed sheets and also snack foods. This investment will improve her income and increase her sales favorably. Her goal is to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy snack foods and a bundle of bed sheets.

loans.name: Bat-Erdene

texts.en:
Bat-erdene is 41 years old and lives with his wife and three children, a son aged 17 and twin sons aged 9, in a small yurt in Dornogovi province of Mongolia. His older son goes to the local high school; his twin sons go to the local secondary school. 

Bat-erdene owns a small yard, and in this yard he grows vegetables. Mongolian summer time is very sunny and very comfortable for growing vegetables in a greenhouse. He is very experienced in this field, from 2000 through 2007. 

Bat-Erdene is planning to expand his vegetable growing in a greenhouse. He is requesting a loan of 3,200,000 MNT to purchase a greenhouse for vegetables. 

Bat-erdene hopes to grow his business and harvest more vegetables to sell. He expects major changes and his family's living to improve.

loans.use: to buy a greenhouse for growing vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy perfumes.

loans.name: Saima's Group

texts.en:
Saima is 24 years old, married recently, and has no children yet.
In order to support her husband financially, she does decorative embroidery. She is very skillful in her work and receives a good number of orders every month.
She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband who operates a grocery store in the market.
With the loan investment, he will buy grocery items like cooking oils, spices, snacks etc in larger quantity and of better quality. This will help him increase his sales and income.
Saima has a lot of confidence in her husband that he will make good use of the loan money and will improve his business.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for her husband's grocery store business

loans.name: Rosa Marina

texts.es:
Rosa, es una mujer de hogar, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, ella junto a su pareja se dedican a realizar el cultivo de maíz y frijol, tienen 16 años dedicándose a esta actividad de la cual han logrado mantenerse hasta el momento.

Solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra de los materiales utilizados en la agricultura como el abono, herbicidas, pago de mozos, pago de bueyes para el arado de la tierra, esto le ayudará a continuar junto con su esposo realizando la producción de maíz y frijol y poder obtener buenas cosechas.

Su objetivo es seguir cultivando, poder tener una buena producción y al mismo tiempo expandir sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Rosa is a homemaker. She lives with her husband and two children. Together with her husband she has grown corn and beans for 16 years, which has helped sustain them up til now.

She asks for a loan to buy agricultural supplies like compost and herbicides, and to pay for workers and oxcarts to plow the land. This will help her and her husband to continue growing corn and beans and to get good harvests.

Her goal is to keep planting, have a good production and at the same time to expand her crops.

loans.use: to buy compost and herbicides and to pay for workers and oxcarts.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is fifty-three years old and married to Mary. Together, they have five children whom they support. He has been farming for the last five years, earning a monthly income of 17,000 KES.

James has applied for his second loan of 30,000 KES from KADET LTD, which he plans to use to purchase farm inputs, e.g., fertilizers and pesticides, and to pay for labor. 

He will invest the anticipated profit back into his business. His future dream is to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs, e.g., fertilizers and pesticides, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.en:
Agripina is a widow with five children. She is 59 years old and lives in Manamong, Aloran, Misamis Occidental.
