Agripina is engaged in a general store business to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan for Php 10,000 for additional capital to purchase more inventory for her buy & sell business.
Agripina has been a member of PMPC for 3 year.  In the future, she hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 34 years old and married. She sells eggs in the Kasarani area, a business she has been doing for the last two years. With this loan, she desires to buy more eggs for sale and expand her business.
With the additional income, she will educate her children in school and give them a better life.

loans.use: to buy more eggs so that she can supply other traders.

loans.name: Santos Elizabeth

texts.es:
Santos, solicita un nuevo préstamo para realizar la compra de algunos materiales para el trabajo de carpintería que realiza su esposo, además se comprará materiales de cocina para continuar con sus ventas por ejemplo aceite, maíz, condimentos, hojas, pollos, pues éstos son los que intervienen en la elaboración de tamales, para la carpintería de su esposo le apoyará con una parte de este préstamo comprándose madera de diferentes tipos, con el objetivo de que mantenga el material necesario para la elaboración de muebles.

Como el préstamo anterior ha logrado mantener la producción de tamales y en algunos pequeños trabajos de la carpintería de su esposo, considera que su familia ha contado con un mejor recurso económico en este tiempo ya que no ha faltado el sustento y la alimentación diaria, su venta de tamales está creciendo y su venta de tortillas por el momento no la está realizando.
texts.en:
Santos is requesting a new loan to buy some material for the carpentry work done by her husband. As well she will buy cooking supplies in order to continue with her own sales. She will buy cooking oil, corn, condiments, plantain leaves and chickens since this is what she uses to make tamales. She will support her husband and his carpentry with part of this loan, buying him different kinds of wood, so that he will have the necessary material to make furniture.

Since her previous loan succeeded in supporting the production of tamales and some of her husband’s small carpentry projects, she feels that her family has had a better economic resource this time because it has been sustained and not lacked daily meals. While her tamale sales are growing, she is not selling tortillas at the moment.

loans.use: to buy oil, corn, condiments, plantain leaves, chickens and wood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy boards and planks of wood.

loans.name: Sumbersari Permai Group

texts.en:
The Sumbersari Permai group received another loan from MUK of 15M IDR for its 10 members, with each member getting 1.5M IDR. These loans are used to support the efforts of raising pigs.
Ni Kadek is using this loan to buy two superior quality piglets for fattening. The price today is 400.000 IDR per piglet. The remainder of the loan will be used to buy feed. To reduce the cost of feeds, Ni Kadek is feeding them with traditional feeds made from banana stems and various kinds of leaves.
She is pursuing this work effort to support her family's economic situation, and particularly to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy two superior quality piglets

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poder invertir en el negocio de hojalatería, comprandose hierro y carbón para realizar los diferentes trabajos en herramientas que comunmente son utilizadas por los agricultores o personas del campo, por ejemplo cumas, machetes, este prestamo le ayudará a continuar trabajando y mejorar su producción de hojalatería.

Con el préstamo anterior logró comprar para el negocio los materiales, que le permitio elaborar herramientas para la temporada de la siembra y al mismo tiempo aumentó la producción de cumas, su condición familiar se ha permanecido estable.
texts.en:
Manuel is requesting a new loan so that he can invest in his sheet metal shop. He will buy iron and coal in order to carry out various jobs involving tools that are commonly used by farmers or rural people, for example machetes and cumas (a machete with a curved blade). This loan will help him to continue working and to improve his production of sheet metal. 

With the previous loan he managed to buy materials for the business, which allowed him to make tools for the planting season. At the same time he increased his production of cumas. His family situation has remained stable.

loans.use: To buy iron and coal.

loans.name: Gloria Elizabeth Del Carmen

texts.es:
Gloria, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 12 años y la otra de siete años, ambas estudian en la escuela, en la casa que habita es heredada por el padre de Gloria, se dedica a la elaboración y comercialización de loza, aprendió esta actividad desde muy pequeña con su madre, hoy en día trabaja para mantener su hogar desde las ocho de la mañana hasta las cuatro de la tarde, el proceso comienza desde halar la tierra, prepararla, sentar el barro, raspar, secar, y lijar y por último quemar el producto ya terminado.
Solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra de tierra, nacascohl, leña, que es lo necesario para realizar la elaboración de loza, este préstamo será de mucha ayuda pues tendrá lo necesario en materia prima para continuar produciendo las ollas, comales, sartenes, entre otros utensilios de cocina que son elaborados a base de barro llamada Loza.

Su aspiración es a través del negocio poder impulsar a sus hijas a que estudien, ya que cuenta con experiencia de no haber asistido a la escuela y por lo mismo desea ver a sus realizadas profesionalmente, para que puedan mejorar su futuro y las oportunidades, es un negocio ella quiere mejorar creciendo en clientes y en la producción.
texts.en:
Gloria lives with her husband and their two children, ages 12 and 7 who are both in school. They inherited their house from Gloria's father. She makes and sells pottery, an activity that she learned from a young age from her mother. Today she works to take care of her household from 8am until 4pm. The process starts by pulling the dirt, preparing it, setting the mud, scraping it, drying it, sanding it down, and finally firing the finished product. 

She asks for a loan to buy dirt, nacaschol [a product used to make black dye] and firewood, which are needed to make the pottery. This loan will be very helpful to her because she'll have the basic materials that she needs to continue producing the pots, griddles, frying pans and other cooking utensils that are made from the mud called Loza. 

Her dream is through her business to be able to propel her children in their studies, because she wasn't able to go to school and she wants to see them become professionals so that they can have a better future and opportunities. In her business, she wants to continue improving her production and number of customers.

loans.use: to buy dirt, nacaschol [used to make black dye] and firewood.

loans.name: Raquel Yres

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Raquel, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Lideres” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. Nuestra socia se dedica a vender productos de primera necesidad en una tienda de abarrotes la cual abrió con mucho esfuerzo, actividad que viene realizando hace mucho tiempo y que le permite sacar adelante a su familia. Raquel en esta oportunidad invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar productos como arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, aceite, bebidas etc. para pode capitalizar su negocio.
Raquel está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y ayudarla a mantener y desarrollarse en sus actividades económicas para dar una mejor educacion a sus hijos aue aun dependen de ella.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Raquel belongs to the village bank "Los Lideres" [The Leaders] in the city of Cusco, Peru. She sells basic goods in a grocery store that she opened after a lot of hard work. She has been doing it for a long time now and it allows her to get her family ahead. On this occasion, Raquel is investing the requested loan in the purchase of products like rice, sugar, noodles, milk, oil, drinks, etc to be able to capitalize on her business.

Raquel is very grateful to Kiva for allowing her to give a better quality of life to her family and helping to maintain and develop her economic activities to give her children, who still depend on her, a better education.

She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments according to the repayment plan.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like rice, sugar, noodles, milk, oil and drinks.

loans.name: Roland

texts.en:
Roland is 43 years old and lives in North Poblacion, Larena, Siquijor. He is single.

Roland has a beauty salon to earn a living and has had this business for seventeen years. He earns about 10,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase beauty supplies for his beauty salon.

Roland has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative since May 31, 2012. In the future, Roland hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase beauty supplies for his beauty salon.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 27-year-old lady from Kisumu, married to Thomas who works in a bookshop. She has one child who is two years old.

Rose is in the business of selling clothes. She has done this for the last seven years and makes a monthly income of KES. 20,000 which she uses to support her family.

She has applied for her second loan with KADET LTD which she will use to purchase more stock of assorted clothes for sale. Rose plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her child and provide for the basic needs of the family. Her dream is to provide the best for her family and own a big shop for clothes in town.

loans.use: To buy stock of assorted clothes for sale.

loans.name: Emeliana

texts.en:
Emeliana is 62 years old and lives in Mialem, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 5 children. 

Emeliana has a sand and gravel quarrying business and earns approximately 2,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to be used to pay the labor costs of the workers digging the quarry of sand and gravel. 

Emeliana has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, she hopes to engage in other types of business.

loans.use: to pay the labor costs of the workers digging a quarry.

loans.name: Azteca Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Azteca” está conformado por 20 emprendedores que se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de ropa, costuras, negocios, almacenes, venta de leña y carbón, venta de pan amasado, servicios entre otros. Todos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco.
Jessica integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en primera fila , ocupando el primer ligar de izquierda a derecha, viste una chaqueta de color café y pantalones de color negro, usa lentes y su cabello es de color castaño claro y lo usa suelto.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio, específicamente a la venta de ropa, desde hace 3 años. Comenta que trabaja en su casa de lunes a viernes y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad ya que sus hijos son pequeños.
La mercadería que va necesitando la compra en la ciudad de Santiago a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará ropa de damas, hombres, niños y bebes de diferentes tallas y modelos.
Una de las metas de Jessica en su negocio son tener un local donde pueda atender a su clientela, para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Jessica vive junto a su esposo quien se desempeña como cajero, y 2 hijas de 6 y 3 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel familiar es poder tener su casa propia para darle un buen pasar a sus hijos.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que las capacitaciones han sido fundamentales para su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos ye inversiones.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
The village bank called "Azteca" is made up of 20 entrepreneurs who work in different fields, among them: clothing sales, sewing, business, warehouses, selling firewood and coal, selling bread and other things. They all live in the city of Temuco.

One member is Jessica, who is pictured standing in the first row on the far left wearing a brown jacket and black pants. She wears glasses and her hair is light brown and worn down. 

Jessica is a merchant; specifically, she has been selling clothing for three years. She works at home Monday through Friday and her schedule changes with her availability, as she is a mother of young children. She goes to buy her merchandise in the city of Santiago for a better price which makes it economically convenient. With the loan she will buy clothing for women, men, children and infants in different sizes and styles.

One of Jessica's business goals is to have a store where she can attend to her customers so that she can make more money and have a better quality of life.

Jessica lives with her husband, who is a bank teller, and her two daughters, ages 6 and 3. Her dream for her family is to be able to own a home to give her children a good place to live.  She is very happy and thankful for the opportunity given to her by Fondo Esperanza because it will allow her to invest in her business. She says that the trainings have been important for her business and also for her personal development because she learned to organize and distribute her income and investments better. 

Temuco is the capital of the region of Araucania. The city is 670 km south of Santiago (Chile's capital). On the outskirts there are a series of lakeside resorts (Pucon, Villarica) and striking native flora and fauna concentrated in the nearby natural parks. Half of the Mapuche people, an indigenous group in Chile, live in this region.

loans.use: to buy women's, men's, children's and infants' clothing in different sizes and styles.

loans.name: Rudy Jaaziel

texts.es: El joven Rudy es emprendedor con muchos deseos de superarse y su calidad de vida mejorarla, trabaja en el INTA como tecnico desde hace varios años, pide el apoyo financiero para completar la compra de una computadora, la cual le ayudaria a agilizar sus trabajos de clase y tener resultados favorables, con lo que se le abririan posibilidades a un mejor cargo.
texts.en:
Rudy is an entrepreneur with a great desire to better himself and improve his quality of life. He has been working at INTA (Nicaraguan Institute  for Agricultural Technology) as a technician for several years. 

He is requesting the loan to undertake the purchase of a computer, which would help him do his schoolwork more quickly and have favorable results. This would open up for him the possibility of a better position at work.

loans.use: To buy a computer.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 37 years old, married and the father of four school-age children. He has operated a hotel business for the last five years, earning a monthly income of KES 50,000. He has applied for his fourth of loan KES 100,000 from KADET LTD to purchase more meat, milk and furniture for his business. 
He will invest the anticipated profits back into his business. His future dreams are to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase more meat, milk and furniture.

loans.name: Celso

texts.en:
Celso, 62, is married, has three children and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.
Celso is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. He has been doing this for six years. He has requested a loan of 10000 PHP to purchase commercial fertilizers and sprays for his rice production. 
Celso has been a member of PMPC one year. In the future, Celso hopes to acquire more parcels of land.

loans.use: to purchase commercial fertilizers and sprays.

loans.name: Tele

texts.en: Tele is 49 years old, married and has five children. She runs a business sewing and designing clothes for her community. She has three years of experience with this business. Tele has requested a loan to purchase a new sewing machine, thread and material for her business. She plans to use her profits to provide her family with a good living and also help her kids' education. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine, thread and material.

loans.name: Altanzul

texts.en:
Altanzul, 25, works as a electrician in a private company. He used to work as a builder for a few years. He has two children who are babies and who live with their grandparents in the countryside. Altanzul lives with his wife on his small plot of the land in the ger district (ger is a Mongolian traditional nomadic yurt) in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife works as a receptionist in a hotel. Both of their salaries are low and usually do not meet their family's necessities. So, Altanzul also runs a taxi business on nights and weekends to earn extra income. 
He owns an old, small house on his land plot and lately it has been in very bad condition and cold to live in. It was built about 20 years ago and it has not had any major renovation or repairs. In winter it has a heat loss through the walls and windows. So he sent his children to his parents in the countryside. 
This summer he is planning to repair his house by installing wall insulation and building a small, one-room addition. It is very beneficial for his family to live comfortably and to stay warm at home. Every winter it costs much money to buy the coal to keep his house warm. He knows that it is harmful to his family's health and living environment. Also, he has a plan to build a small garage beside his home for his taxi car. Now he needs some money to buy the building materials for his house repair project.

loans.use: to buy the building materials for his house repair, wall insulation and house extension, and for building a garage.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 37 years old, married and has five children. She has a small plantation and grows taros to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than three years. Rosa has requested a loan to purchase barbed wire, picks, a water hose, a rake and wheelbarrow to help her improve her plantation. 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. With her profits, Rosa hopes to keep improving her plantation to provide better income to help her family's financial situation.

loans.use: to purchase barbed wire, picks, a water hose, a rake and wheelbarrow

loans.name: Association Dental N°4 Group

texts.fr:
L'association "DentaL 4" se compose de cinq femmes.Elles sont toutes mariées.Elles exercent individuellement un commerce de tissus et de produits cosmétiques.Elles achètent en gros et se partagent les produits en fonction de l'apport de chacune.La marchandise est revendu à crédit pour une durée maximale de deux mois.Ce commerce leur rapporte des revenus qui leur permettent de subvenir à certains de leurs besoins mais aussi à ceux de leurs famille.Le chef de groupe (au milieu) est une femme mariée, mère de quatre enfants.Trois de ces enfants fréquentent l'école primaire.Comme les autres membres du groupe, elle vend des tissus et des produits cosmétiques dans une cantine construite devant son domicile.
Actuellement, le groupe sollicite un pret de 500000f pour acheter des tissus et des articles de mercerie.Leur ambition est d'acheter des terrains pour construire leurs propres maisons.
texts.en:
The "Dental 4" association consists of five married women, who are all individually involved in selling fabrics and cosmetic products.

They buy their goods in bulk and share the merchandise they have purchased according to each member's contribution.  Their merchandise is sold on credit with a maximum repayment term of two months.  This business allows the group's members to generate an income which allows them to meet some of their needs and those of their families.

The group's leader (in the middle) is a married woman and the mother of four children, three of whom attend primary school.  Like the other members of her group, she sells fabrics and cosmetic products in a stall built in front of her house.

The group is currently requesting a loan of 500,000 francs for the purchase of fabrics and sewing supplies.  Their ambition is to buy some plots of land to build their own houses.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Madame Ama exerce comme activité depuis 2010, la vente de charbon de bois. Elle le vend seule à domicile et s’approvisionne à Lomé et dans les villes voisine de Lomé. Elle est âgée de 48ans, mariée à un entrepreneur, ils ont en charge 02 enfants dont 01 scolarisé. Elle est à son premier crédit de WAGES et ce prêt lui servira à s’approvisionner en marchandises considérable afin de mieux répondre aux désirs des clients. Madame Ama envisage de stocker en quantité considérable les sacs de charbon de bois afin de tirer plus de bénéfices et pouvoir veiller à la scolarisation des enfants.
texts.en:
Ama has been selling charcoal since 2010.  She buys her merchandise in Lomé and in other towns around Lomé.  She sells alone from her home.

She is 48 years old, married to an entrepreneur.  Ama and her husband have two children in their care, one of whom attends school.

This is her first loan with WAGES.  This loan will be used to buy a very large quantity of merchandise in order to better meet her customers' needs.  She is planning to store many bags of charcoal in order to make more profits and to ensure that the children attend school.

loans.use: to buy some bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Faamanuiaga

texts.en:
Faamanuiaga is 28 years old and married with three children. She has a small garden where she grows banana and taro, which she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for five years. Faamanuiaga needs a loan to to buy new farming materials such as bush knives, a plant sprayer, fertilizer, and barbed wire.

She has been a member of SPBD since May of this year. Faamanuiaga will use the profits from her sales to support her family and to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials such as bush knives, plant sprayer, fertilizer, and barbed wire.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Lea has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. 

Lea has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Lea hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Siinei

texts.en:
Siinei is 37 years old and married with six children. She has a small garden where she grows banana and taro that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for many years. Siinei needs a loan to to buy plant sprayer, fertilizer, barbed wire, rakes, and bush knives. 

She has been a member of SPBD since May of this year. Siinei will use the profits from her sales to support her family and to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy plant sprayer, fertilizer, barbed wire, rakes, and bush knives.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Celsa has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for nine years. She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. 

Celsa has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Celsa hopes to improve her business for the education of her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Virgen De Los Remedios Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Virgen de los Remedios es de  la Ciudad de Caaguazús. Las miembros son muy trabajadoras y unidas, cada una de ellas tiene la voluntad de salir adelante y progresar.
Celsa es la presidenta del grupo, ella se define como una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante y ayudar a su familia. Ella es modista y dice que tiene muy buena clientela porque siempre hace muy buenos trabajos y eso gusta a sus clientes.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, gomas y demás tipos de insumos para poder seguir trabajando y cumpliendo con su trabajo.
texts.en:
The group “Virgen de Los Remedios” is from the city of Caaguazú. The members are hardworking and unified. Each one has the willingness to move forward and make progress.

Celsa is the group president. She defines herself as a person who has tremendous desire to succeed and help her family. Celsa is a dressmaker and says that she has very good clients because she always does good work that is to their liking.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy fabrics, thread, erasers, and other supplies so that she can continue working and completing her jobs.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, erasers, and other supplies.

loans.name: Zarqashan's Group

texts.en:
Zarqashan has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband, who is a rickshaw driver. With the loan investment he will change his rickshaw body and also repair its engine. This will help him save his precious business assets and also provide better quality transport services to his passengers.

Zarqashan does sewing. She works for her neighboring clients and sews beautiful looking clothes, which helps her make a reasonable income every month. She has given birth to two sons and four daughters. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. Zarqashan is a very positive minded lady and confident about her family’s better future as a result of the loan investment in her husband’s business.

loans.use: to change the rickshaw body and repair its engine.

loans.name: Metchelyn

texts.en: Metchelyn is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with 2 children. Metchelyn has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Metchelyn became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Iram's Group

texts.en:
Iram is a housewife who remains at her home and does her household responsibilities. She is very active and efficient and performs her duties very well.

Her husband runs a local food restaurant. His food tastes very good and the service is very good. His customers come to his restaurant everyday for lunch and dinner.

Iram has given birth to a son and a daughter. Her daughter is 13 years old while her son is only 3 years old.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan investment he will buy a larger quantity and better quality of food making ingredients that will help him improve his business further.

loans.use: To buy food making ingredients for a restaurant business

loans.name: Asiasiga

texts.en:
Asiasiga is 24 years old and married with two children. She has a small garden where she grows banana and taro that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for many years. Asiasiga needs a loan to to buy plant sprayer, rakes, bush knives, and barbed wire. 

She has been a member of SPBD since May of this year. Asiasiga will use the profits from her sales to support her family and to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase plant sprayer, rakes, bush knives, and barbed wire.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is separated with 1 child. 

James has a pig farm that sells grown and matured pigs. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy animal feed for the pigs.

James became a member of HSPFI in 2012.  In the future, James hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for pigs

loans.name: Rubilyn

texts.en: Rubilyn is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. Rubilyn has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. She became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, Rubilyn hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en: Cresencia is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 8 children. Cresencia has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for 8 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Cresencia became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Putri Mandiri Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut and all members of Putri Mandiri agreed to continue to have a loan for their businesses. They still need a loan to develop a business of raising pigs. They will stop borrowing when they have enough savings for their own capital.

With full support from her children who worked as farmers, Ni Ketut will use the loan to buy two superior piglets for 500,000 IDR each. The remainder of the loan will be used to buy food. By keeping the pigs for fattening, Ni Ketut hopes there will be an increase in profits. For everyday needs, Ni Ketut gets things from her garden. Her business also sells the means worship for Hindus.

loans.use: to buy two superior piglets.

loans.name: Sonrisas Frente Al Mar Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Sonrisas frente al mar” está conformado por 18 emprendedores que se dedican al rubro del comercio, específicamente venta de ropa usada, venta de empanadas, venta de paltas, venta de tomates, venta de figuras de yeso, venta de toras y pasteles, servicios entre otros. Todos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Valparaíso.
Jorge, presidente del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en primera fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste una polera de color rojo y encima lleva puesto un chaleco de color gris, su cabello es corto y de color castaño oscuro.
El se dedica al rubro de venta de papas peladas y picadas selladas al vacio, desde hace 1 año. Comenta que trabaja en su casa todos los días, entrega su mercadería a locales ya establecidos y también a su clientela de forma ambulante de casa en casa, su horario de trabajo lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
La mercadería la compra en distribuidoras que se especializan en vender sus productos a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará 18 kilos de papas.
Las metas en su negocio es establecer un local en su propia casa, ya que tiene el espacio suficiente dentro de ella, llegar a ser un pequeño empresario.
Jorge vive junto a su hermano quien trabaja en repostería. Sus sueños son poder comprar más maquinarias como peladora de papa, picadora de papa, para abastecer su negocio, así con esto generar mayores ganancias.
El está muy contento y agradecido de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza para invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómodo con el grupo que participa, ya que son unidos, existe respeto y confianza. Respecto a  las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
This community bank is called "Smiles by the Sea." It is made up of 18 small business owners who work selling various products and services including: used clothing, emapanadas (fried bread with meat or other fillings), avocados, tomatoes, plaster figurines, cakes and baked goods, and a variety of services. All the members live in the city of Valparaiso.

Jorge, president of the community bank, is standing in the first row in the photo second from the left with the red polo shirt and gray vest. He has short, dark gray hair. He has worked selling peeled and chopped potatoes in vacuum sealed bags for one year. He says that he works practically every day. He brings his goods to certain established locations and also delivers directly to clients' homes. His work schedule depends on his availability and his clients'. 

He purchases his merchandise from distributors that specialize in offering their products at a low cost, therefore it's the best choice economically. With the loan Jorge will purchase 18 kilograms of potatoes. 

His goals are to establish a small store in his house because he has enough space and to become a small businessman.

Jorge lives with his brother who works in a pastry shop. He dreams of buying a potato peeler and a potato slicer for his business to make his own supply of pre-sliced potatoes and thus keep more of the profits. 

He is pleased and thankful for the opportunity provided by Fondo Esperanza (The Hope Fund) to invest in his business. Also, he feels very comfortable with the group because they are united and respect and trust one another. He has appreciated the trainings offered at the meetings, and he has learned how to run his business better.

Valparaiso is located 120 kilometers Northeast of Santiago. It is the regional capital and the seat of the national legislature. It is the largest port in the country and has many beautiful locations, for example the Nobel Prize-winning poet Pablo Neruda's home,

loans.use: purchase 18 kilograms of potatoes

loans.name: Magaly Esmeraly

texts.es:
Magaly, es madre soltera de un niño de tres años de edad, actualmente vive en compañía de sus padres y se dedica a atender una granja de pollos de engorde, éste ha sido su medio para poder trabajar y poder apoyar a sus hijos cubriendo todos sus gastos, este negocio tiene un año de haber surgido, y le ha permitido hasta el momento ganar un número de clientes.

Solicita un préstamo para comprarse pollos pequeños y también concentrado para alimentarlos, este préstamo le ayudará a aumentar la granja y a fortalecer sus ventas, ya que tendrá un mayor número de pollos con el objetivo de atraer más clientes.

La aspiración de Magaly es a aumentar sus ingresos económicos del trabajo que realiza, ya que también le permitirán a apoyar a sus padres al mismo tiempo que está pendiente de su hijo.
texts.en:
Magaly is a single mother with a three-year old son. She currently lives with her parents and works taking care of a chicken farm. Through this work she has been able to support her child and cover all of her living costs. The business began a year ago, and she has been able to gain a number of clients.

She will use the loan to purchase young chicks and chicken feed concentrate. This loan will be used to expand the farm and strengthen her sales because she will have more chickens and will work to attract more clients.

Magaly’s aspiration is to boost her earnings from her business because it will allow her to support her parents and at the same time care for his son.

loans.use: Compra de pollos pequeños y también concentrado.

loans.name: Roger Mauricio

texts.es: Roger Mauricio es un hombre con alto espiritu de superacion profesional y personal, su esposa trabaja como ejecutiva de ventas del Gallo mas Gallo la cual la ayuda con los gastos familiares ambos son trabajadores. solicita refinanciamiento para pagar estudio de maestria en docencia universitaria en la universidad Martin Lutero, ademàs de su salario este clientes tiene ingresos del cultivo de granos basico y de raices y tuberculos, su mayor sueño en la vida es que sus hijos gozen de salud,  tener estabilidad laboral para ayudar a sus hijos y culminar la maestria.
texts.en: Roger Mauricio is a man with a spirit to succeed professionally and personally. His wife works as a sales executive at "El Gallo Mas Gallo" an appliance retailer which helps cover the family's expenses. Both are hardworking individuals. He is applying for a loan to pay for his studies; he is earning a Masters degree in University Teaching in Martin Luther University. Aside from their salary, Roger and his wife earn money growing basic grains, tubers, and other vegetables. His greatest dreams are for his children to be healthy, to have steady work to provide for his family, and to complete his Masters degree.

loans.use: pay for his Masters degree

loans.name: Juana De La Cruz

texts.es:
Juana, se dedica a la venta de pupusas, este negocio tiene tres años de existir y surgió por iniciativa propia, ella vive con tres hijos, es madre soltera, pero sus hijos le ayudan para elaborar la venta todos los días, actualmente están estudiando en la escuela.

Solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra de materiales que utiliza en la producción de su venta como el aceite, quesillo, Chicharron, entre otros productos que son necesarios para invertir en el negocio, pues esto mejorará su servicio a los clientes y le ayudará también a mantener la preferencia de ellos.

Su aspiración es a través del préstamo realizar una buena inversión en el negocio, que le permita continuar apoyando a sus hijos en los estudios y también poderles ofrecer condiciones de vida más estables.
texts.en:
Juana earns her living selling pupusas (a type of maize tortilla). She has had this business, which she started of her own initiative, for three years. She lives with her three children. She is a single mother but her children help her with sales every day. At the moment they are studying at school.  

She is asking for a loan in order to buy materials which she will use in the production of her foods such as oil, farmers' cheese and pork rind, amongst other products which she needs for her business. This will improve the service she provides to her clients and will help her to remain popular with them.  

Her dream is for the investment she is making in her business to be successful, so that she can continue supporting her children with their studies and to offer them more stable living conditions.

loans.use: to buy oil, farmers' cheese and pork rind.

loans.name: Industrial Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está situado en el barrio Industrial de la ciudad de Curuguaty, conformado por 13 mujeres. Ellas están en el primer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras y desean poder seguir trabajando y creciendo.
Andreza es miembro del grupo y cuenta que por medio de la ayuda de su grupo está pudiendo salir adelante y ayudar a los suyos.  Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de segunda mano, y cuenta que le está yendo muy bien porque sus prendas son muy aceptadas.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, para que de esa forma pueda seguir trabajando y ayudando a su familia, dándoles lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
This group is situated in the neighborhood of Industrial in the city of Curuguaty and consists of 13 women.  They are participating in their first loan cycle as part of the Program of Women Entrepreneurs.  They want to continue working and growing.  

Andreza is a member of the group.  With the help of her group, she has been able to move forward and help her loved ones.  She sells secondhand clothing and is doing very well because her products are well-accepted.  

She is requesting a loan in order to buy clothes so that she can continue working and helping her family, thus allowing her to provide what they need.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothing to sell.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en: Natividad is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. Natividad has a pig farm that sells grown and matured pigs. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy animal feed for the pigs. Natividad has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Natividad hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds for pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more motor parts to resell

loans.name: Codjo

texts.fr: Jeune homme habile de 33ans, Mr Codjo a un enfant de 02ans. Sa conjointe est revendeuse et il est dans le même domaine qu’elle sauf qu’il s’est plus penché sur la vente de chaussures. Il mène l’activité seul dans une boutique et sa difficulté est la concurrence sur le terrain. Pour pouvoir bien répondre aux besoins des clients, il sollicite de WAGES un premier crédit pour acheter des chaussures. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité, avoir une autre boutique de vente de chaussures, permettre à son enfant d’avoir une meilleure éducation et construire plus tard sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Codjo is a skillful 33 year-old-man, father of a two-year-old child.  His wife is a reseller and she is involved in the same business as he is, but Codjo specializes more in the sale of shoes.

He works alone in a shop and his main difficulty is the local competition.

In order to adequately meet his customers' needs, he is requesting his first loan from WAGES to buy some shoes.

He wants to reinvest in the business, open another shoe shop, ensure that his child receives a better education and, one day, build his own house.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Sara's Group

texts.en:
Sara has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband, who is a movie maker and photographer and offers his services at different ceremonies, parties, etc. With the loan investment, he will buy a new movie camera and a still camera to improve his services, which will help him get more orders every month and increase his income.

Sara is a housewife who remains at home and takes care of her household responsibilities. She is the mother of 2 sons and a daughter. Only her eldest son is getting an education. Her remaining children are not of school going age yet. Sara is confident that the loan will help her husband to earn more profits from his business and she will be able to send her remaining children to school in the future.

loans.use: to buy a camera for a photography and movie-making business

loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en:
Cyrus is 36 years old and married. He is the father of three children whom he supports. He has been a mixed crop farmer for the last 12 years. He earns a monthly income of KES 5,000. 

Cyrus has applied for his first loan of KES 15,000 from KADET LTD. With the loan, he plans to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and pesticides, and to pay for labor.

He will invest the anticipated profits back into his business. His future dream is to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and pesticides, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah is 52 years old and married. He is blessed with four children whom he and his wife support. He has earned a living from selling timber for the last 11 years. He earns a monthly income of KES 70,000.  

Jonah has applied for his third loan of KES 80,000 from KADET LTD. He will use the loan to purchase more logs for timber sales.

He will invest the anticipated profits in his children's education. His future dream is to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase more logs for timber sales.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is a single mother of two children, one of whom goes to school. She does not support additional family members. 

Farida has a business selling fruits and vegetables. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 UGX to buy more baskets of cabbages, tomatoes, onions and eggplants. She has been in this business for three years selling wholesale from home, seven days a week. 

She also generates additional income through selling charcoal. Her major business challenges include transportation of vegetables from the market to her home and seasonality.  

Farida aspires to start growing vegetables herself and also to build her own house. She currently resides in a rented house with no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of cabbages, tomatoes, onions and eggplants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell.

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 42 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive en una colonia del municipio de San Manuel Cortes junto a sus dos hijos.
Ella tiene dos años de haber establecido su taller de costura donde confecciona y repara prendas de vestir para damas, como ser: vestidos, faldas, blusas, pantalones, ropa de niña, bóxer  etc. adquirió experiencia en un taller de costura, allí trabajó varios años realizando esta actividad. Además ella estudio belleza. El préstamo que solicita es por 10,000.00 lempiras para comprar telas y materiales, las telas las compra por mayor y retazos por libras para elaborar ropa de cama,donde va comprar es más barato. Esta inversión le ayudara a cumplir con los pedidos que tiene con los clientes. su meta es prepararse más, que sus hijos continúen el estudio y también para comprar otra máquina de costura mas.
texts.en:
Blanca, age 42, is a single mother.  She lives with her two children in a neighborhood in the San Manuel Cortes municipality.

Two years ago she established her seamstress shop where she makes and repairs women’s clothing like dresses, skirts, blouses, pants, girls’ clothing, and boxer shorts etc.  She acquired experience in a seamstress shop where she worked for several years doing this business activity.  She also studied beauty.

The loan she is requesting for 10,000 lempiras is to buy fabric and materials.  She will buy the fabric wholesale and remnants by the pound in order to make bedding.  She will buy where it is cheaper.  This investment will help her fill orders that she has with her customers.

Her goals are to produce more, that her children continue their education, and to buy another sewing machine to sew more.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials like fabric, thread, and needles, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Quelita

texts.es:
Quelita tiene 54 años, es una mujer trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Su pareja es Cesar, quien es agricultor, fruto de esta unión tienen cuatro hijos de 23, 22, 21 y 15 años de edad, a quienes quieren mucho.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, para eso cuenta con una bodega instalada en su vivienda desde hace 7 años. Inició este negocio por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso adicional, con el uso de un crédito pudo completar lo que necesitaba para instalar su tienda y con el tiempo ha logrado incrementar su clientela. Le gusta su negocio, pues le permite estar en casa y contar con la tranquilidad de un ingreso económico, además puede emplear sus momentos libres en otras actividades como el cuidado de su hogar. Por lo contrario, no le gusta cuando sus clientes le solicitan créditos por sus compras, pues comenta que ya tuvo malas experiencias con este tipo de venta y no le pagaron, por eso ahora se niega y todo lo que vende lo hace al contado, eso le trae mejores resultados.

Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP y se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo financiero que le brindan. También le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal, pues conoce a sus integrantes y los considera personas responsables y solidarias.
El monto solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de más abarrotes, como arroz, azúcar, huevos, leche y otros, al por mayor, buscando los mejores más bajos precios para así obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Quelita is 54 years old and she is a hardworking woman with a great desire to progress in life. He lifetime companion’s name is Cesar and he is a farmer; they have four children aged 23, 22, 21 and 15 whom they love very much.

She sells groceries in a shop she has set in her house about 7 years ago. She has started this activity because she needed an additional income and thanks to a loan she obtained she could finish buying all she needed to open her shop, in time succeeding in increasing the number of her customers. She likes her job because she can stay hone while counting on the security provided by an economic income; on top of this, she can use her free time to engage in other activities such as taking care of her house. On the other hand, she does not like it when customers ask to pay their shopping on credit: she says she has had bad experiences with this form of payment because she was not repaid, and for this reason she now refuses to accept it, and she sells everything for cash, as this is how she gets the best results.

This is the third loan she is requesting from MFP and she feels deeply grateful for the economic support she has received. She also likes being a part of her Communal Bank because she knows the other members and she thinks they are responsible and caring people.

The 1500 PEN she has requested will be invested in the purchase of more groceries such as rice, sugar, eggs, milk and other products at wholesale prices; she will look for the best products at the cheapest prices in order to earn a better income.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, eggs, milk and other products at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Elvisa

texts.en:
Elvisa is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children.

Elvisa has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for 4 years.

She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Elvisa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Elvisa hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Elder Omar

texts.es:
Elder Omar de 24 años de edad, casado, tiene un hijo de 4 años de edad, vive en la Colonia Mi Única Esperanza, San Pedro Sula.
Elder tiene más de 3 años de experiencia en la reparación de motocicletas, anteriormente trabajaba como operario en una maquila por dos días y los otros 4 días los trabajaba en un taller de motocicletas.  Hace más de un año que decidió establecer su propio negocio con el propósito de obtener mejores ingresos, ofrece servicios de reparación de motocicletas a domicilio y también trabaja en su casa y vende repuestos. Sus clientes son personas que tienen ruta (es decir los vendedores ambulantes en motocicletas), personas particulares y empleados de empresa privada, lo contactan vía teléfono cuando requieren de sus servicios. 
El préstamo que solicito anteriormente le ayudo mucho a suplirse de más herramientas de trabajo y su negocio ha mejorado porque está vendiendo repuestos también.  Ahora solicita un segundo préstamo por 10,000 lempiras para surtir de repuestos de motocicleta para vender tales como monturas, vías, retrovisores, cadenas, catarinas etc. Su sueño es seguir creciendo en el negocio, brindando un buen servicio para obtener mejores ingresos para el hogar y darle una calidad de vida a su familia.Esta agradecido por la oportunidad y el apoyo que estan brindando.
texts.en:
Elder Omar, age 24, is married and has a four year old son.  He lives in the Mi Única Esperanza neighborhood in San Pedro Sula.  Elder has over three years of experience repairing motorcycles.  He used to work two days as an operator in a factory, and the other four days he worked in a motorcycle shop.

Over one year ago he decided to establish his own business in order to get improved income.  He offers motorcycle repair services at customers’ homes, and he also works at his house and sells replacement parts.  His customers are people who have routes (that is to say those who sell in an itinerant manner on motorcycles), private people, and employees of private companies.  They contact him by telephone when they need his services.

The loan he requested previously helped him a lot to be supplied with work tools.  His business has improved because he is also selling the replacement parts.

He is now requesting a second loan for 10,000 lempiras to stock up on motorcycle replacement parts to sell.  He will buy things like saddles, gauges, rear view mirrors, chains, and sprockets, etc.

His dream is to continue growing in the business and providing good service.  He will do this in order to get better income for his household and to give his family a better quality of life.

He is grateful for the opportunity and support he is being given.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle replacement parts to sell and to repair motorcycles.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a 23-years-old man from Kisumu City. He is married to Hyline who is also a business lady. They have one child aged three years.

Joshua operates a retail shop. He has done this for the past three years and earns a monthly income of KES. 15,000.

He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD after he experienced an increase in customers and he needed more supply. He is taking a loan worth KES. 50,000 to buy jericans of liquid oil, sacks of sugar and bundles of wheat flour. Besides this he also plans to send his child to school and thus will use the anticipated profits for that.

His dream is to graduate from retail to whole sale.

loans.use: to expand his business.

loans.name: Shadi

texts.en:
Shadi is 31 years old, and he is from Gaza. He has owned a cosmetics and accessories shop since 2010, in which he sells cosmetics, accessories, pashminas, and perfumes.

Shadi asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy shelves, a new door, and display glass for the shop, and to change the decor. He hopes that his income will increase, which will help him move to live in a better place. His ambition is to be one of the biggest shops that imports accessories.

loans.use: to buy shelves, a new door, and display glass for the shop, and to change the decor.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her business of making shoe uppers. With the loan investment she will buy leather and thread in larger quantities and of better quality. This will allow her to fulfill client orders on time and increase her sales and income.

She is very experienced and skillful in her work and has good number of business contacts. She is confident that by investing the loan, she will be able to put her business in a more profitable position.

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Nasreen.

loans.use: To buy leather and thread for her business of making shoe uppers.

loans.name: Despertar Andino Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “DESPERTAR ANDINO” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Zulma es la secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: costura y venta de deportivos, tienda de flete de polleras, venta de salchipapa, tienda de automotrices, tienda de barrio, costura de polleras, producción de enaguas, comerciante de ropa, mochilas y carteras, venta de ropa usada.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Zulma es una integrante, ella indica que desde hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de carteras, ella cuenta que este oficio lo adquirió por iniciativa propia, observando el comercio que se tenía con este producto.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para ampliar el negocio (compra de carteras) mismo que comprará de la ciudad de Oruro y posteriormente lo instalara en su espacio de comercialización los cuales atiende todos los días. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The Despertar Andino communal bank will start its second cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the of the Alto Lima community center.  It is comprised of ten members, and it is headed by a board of directors.  Zulma is the secretary.  The members’ businesses are varied, and among them are: sewing and selling sport uniforms, a store distributing traditional skirts, selling “salchipapa” [fried potatoes and fried sausages], an automotive store, a neighborhood store, making traditional skirts, producing petticoats, selling clothes, backpacks and wallets, and selling used clothing.

The loan they will take will benefit small business owners like Zulma.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago by an invitation from a friend who is a member of the institution.  She currently has a business selling wallets.  She says that she got this line of work on her own initiative by observing the sales that this product had.

The loan that she will now take is to expand her business (buy wallets).  She will buy the wallets in the city of Oruro, and she will later set them up in a commercial space that she tends to every day.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family as much as possible.  She is in a common-law marriage, and she has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the health resources.

loans.use: to buy wallets.

loans.name: Marcial

texts.en:
Marcial is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 4 children.

Marcial sells fish in his local community. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy a variety of fish to resell, like milk fish and sardines.

Marcial has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to resell.

loans.name: Ablam

texts.fr: Revendeuse de savons nommé « SI JE SAVAIS » depuis 2004, Madame Ablam est âgée de 35ans et est mariée à un revendeur. Elle fait elle même  la préparation du savon à domicile et est aidée par 01 personne. Madame Ablam sollicite un premier crédit de WAGES pour acheter des matières premières (de l'huile, de la soude caustique, de colorant, de plante médicinale, de parfum..) entrant dans la préparation dudit savon. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité, augmenter la taille de son activité par une grande production afin de servir une grande clientèle et entretenir sa famille.
texts.en: Mrs. Ablam has been selling soaps called “Si Je Savais” since 2004.  She is 35 years old and married to a salesman.  She prepares the soap herself at home and has one person who works for her.  Mrs. Ablam is requesting her first loan through WAGES to buy essential materials (oil, caustic soda, dyes, medicinal plants, perfumes, etc.) which go into making this soap.   She wants to reinvest in her business, to grow her business, and to increase production in order to serve a large number of customers and to support her family.

loans.use: to buy the essential materials for making soap.

loans.name: Reneboy

texts.en:
Reneboy is married with 3 children. He is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Reneboy operates a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for 5 years, and every month he earns 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) from this work. He has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to repair his existing vehicle for better service.

Reneboy has been a member of GDMPC in 2010. In the future, Reneboy hopes to fund the remaining studies of his children and to gain double income from his business.

loans.use: to repair existing his vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Arsenio

texts.en:
Arsenio is 51 years old, married, and has four children.  He lives in Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. He is in the coconut production business, which he has been doing for five years. He earn 6,000 PHP a month. 

To improve business, Arsenio is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP from GDMPC, which he will use to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops.

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
Flor is 43 years old, single, and has two children.  She lives in the Philippines. Flor sells longganisa (pork sausage), hot dogs, and choriso in her local community. She has had this business for five years. 

Flor is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more hot dogs, longganisa, and choriso to sell.  She has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Flor hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase hot dogs, longganisa, and choriso.

loans.name: Aristan

texts.en: Mr. Aristan is 58 years old and lives with his youngest son and wife in Bayan-Olgii province. He lives in a small private house and he is unemployed.  His wife is unemployed as well. His son is a college student. He wants to buy a big truck to transport river stones.  He has recently met many people in the construction sector that will buy the river stone. He wants to establish a company that has many trucks and cars in the future.

loans.use: to buy a big truck to transport riverstones

loans.name: Nomanyo

texts.fr: Madame Nomanyo est revendeuse de sous-vêtements femmes, habits des nouveaux nés… dans un marché de la place. Elle est dans cette activité il ya 05ans et cela lui procure des revenus lui permettant de se prendre en charge. Sa difficulté est la mévente et ce second cycle qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de s’approvisionner en marchandises. Elle veut agrandir l’activité et plus tard de lancer dans la vie maritale. Notons qu'elle est âgée de 31ans.
texts.en: Mrs. Nomanyo sells undergarments for women and clothing for infants at a market.  She has been doing this work for five years and this brings her an income which allows her to take care of her needs.  Her main problem has been lower sales and this second loan will allow her to get more merchandise.  She wants to grow her business and to get married later.  She is 31 years old.

loans.use: to buy undergarments and clothing for infants.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 34 years old, comes from Kisumu city, and is married to Samson. They have four children aged 14, 12, 11 and nine; besides her biological children, she supports three other children who are orphans.

Florence operates a food stall and she has been in this business for the last seven years, earning a monthly income of KES12,000. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD worth KES 20,000 which she is planning to use to buy more foodstuffs for the food stall. With the anticipated profits she will pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to grow her business and offer her children a better education.

loans.use: To expand her business by buying foodstuffs in bulk

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is now a widow with six children. Teresita is 66 years old and resides in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Teresita used her last loan to purchase materials that are needed in laundry services such as soaps, etc. Her business is successful, and she's taking care of her planting business. She is asking for a new loan to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In the future she hopes to be able to grow her businesses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Revendeur de batteries et appareils électroniques dans la zone portuaire depuis 2006, Mr Kossi est père de 03 enfants dont 02 sur les bancs d’école. L’ainé a 08ans et le dernier 08mois. Sa conjointe est revendeuse et il est âgé de 33ans. Il y a un moment qu’il fait des opérations financières avec WAGES, il sollicite ce premier crédit pour s’approvisionner en batteries et en appareils électroniques. Avec les profits, il souhaite acheter une moto pour mieux se déplacer, avoir une boutique pour installer ses marchandises et avoir une paix dans sa famille.
texts.en: Mr. Kossi has been selling batteries and electronic equipment near the harbor since 2006.  He is the father of three children, two of whom attend school.  The oldest is eight years and the youngest is eight months old.   He is 33 years old and his wife is a vendor.   It has been a while since he has been involved with WAGES. He is requesting his first loan in order to buy supplies of batteries and electronic equipment.  With his profits, he would like to buy a motorcycle to get around more easily, to have a shop for his merchandise, and to have peace for his family.

loans.use: to buy batteries and electronic equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Shakeela's Group

texts.en:
Shakeela is a seamstress, sewing clothes for her neighboring clients. She is very skillful and has a lot of interest in sewing. She works 4-5 hours a day to complete the orders of her clients.  She is a very good housewife and performs her household duties very well. Her husband is also a tailor and operates his shop in the market.

Shakeela has given birth to two daughters and two sons. All of them are getting their education by attending a nearby school. She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her business. With the loan investment she will buy a new sewing machine that will allow her to complete the client orders in less period of time and increase her profits.

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Shakeela.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia  is  56  years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Julia  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for eight  years. She requested a loan for  5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Julia  has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Julia hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna  is  48  years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. Edna  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 5  years. She requested a loan for  5,000 PHP  to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Edna  has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Edna hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi sells items like belts, sunglasses, caps, etc., a business she has done for the last five years where she makes a monthly income of KES 10,000. She saw the need to take a second loan from KADET LTD after experiencing an increase in demand for the goods, so she is applying for her second loan worth KES. 60,000 which she will use to buy more stock of sunglasses, belts and caps for sale. She will use the profits to educate her child.

Her dream is to establish her business well.

loans.use: to buy a stock of sunglasses, belts and caps for sale.

loans.name: Lailanica

texts.en: Lailanica is  24  years old, single and lives in the Philippines. Lailanica  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for four  years. She requested a loan for  5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Lailanica  has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Lailanica hopes to improve her business so she can continue her studies.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en:
Pascal is sixty-three years old and married with two children in college. He has been earning a living  from the farming business for the last eighteen years, earning a monthly income of KES 8,000.

He has applied  for his first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD, and he plans to use it to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for use in the farm for better yields.

The anticipated profit shall be used to expand the business. His future hope  is to be a famous farmer.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Gisela Maria

texts.es: Gisela Maria  se desempeña como secretaria del poder judicial desde hace muchos años, la que se ha desempeñado con gran responsabilidad y honestidad,cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo ambos trabajan y reciben un ingreso mensual.  solicita su credito para  comprar una computadora portatil y para gastos de Estudios de su hija mayor quien se encuentra estudiando en  la UNAN Leon y la necesita para realizar sus trabajos.  su mayor sueño en la vida es que su hija culmine la universidad y encuentre un trabajo digno de acorde a su carrera y tener estabilidad laboral para seguir apoyandola en sus estudios.
texts.en:
For many years, Gisela Maria has been working responsibly and honestly in her position as court secretary. She has her husband's support; both work and earn monthly incomes. She is requesting a loan to buy a laptop computer and to pay her oldest daughter's education expenses. 

Her daughter is a student at UNAN Leon and needs the computer to do her homework. Gisela Maria's greatest dream in life is seeing her daughter finish her degree and find decent work in her profession and having a stable job so that she can continue helping her daughter with her education.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Regina De La Paz

texts.es:
Regina, vive con sus dos hijos de 22 y 19 años de edad, vive en casa propia en la cual tiene instalada una panadería, este negocio surgió hace seis años por iniciativa de su esposo, quien tenía la aspiración de mejorar los ingresos familiares a través de un negocio rentable, hasta el momento se han logrado sostener  de panadería.

Solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra de materiales para el proceso de la elaboración de pan, como la harina, levadura, azúcar y leña, éstos materiales son los más importante para que ella pueda continuar produciendo pan, este préstamo le dara la fortaleza para poder incrementar su producción y ofrecer pan de calidad a su clientela.

La aspiración de Regina es aumentar su negocio cada vez más a través de la utilización de los préstamos y la buena administración por su parte, ya que esto le permitirá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Regina lives with her two children ages 22 and 19 in her own house where she has a bakery. Six years ago, her husband started the business to increase the family's income through a profitable enterprise, and they have kept the bakery going.

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for making bread such as wheat flour, yeast, sugar, and wood. These items are most important for making bread, and this loan will allow her to increase production and offer her customers high quality bread.  Regina's dream is to keep expanding her business through loans and good management on her part, which will allow her to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, yeast, sugar, and wood.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda of Sibugon Lopez, Lopez Jaena helps her family through her pot-making business. She’s a 58-year-old married mom of five kids, who tries her best to earn on her own. For five years, she has managed this pottery business and earns about 5,500 PHP per month. 

Right now, she needs to buy more clay to be used in her business. She joined GDMPC in 2009 and thanks GDMPC micro-finance for the loan of 10,000 PHP they are providing her. Erlinda desires to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more clay to be used in her business

loans.name: Yelba Mabel

texts.es: La joven Yelba  de 25 años de edad,  labora como secretaria del Instituto Rubén Darios desde hace 6 años años consecutivos para el Ministerio de Educaciòn es bien reconocida en el Municipio, ella es una mujer bien trabajadora y  muy  responsable, es bien dedicada a su trabajo y a su familia, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo quien se desempeña como docente de secundaria como tambien trabaja como docente de la Universidad URACCAN d  ambos comparten con los gastos familiares.  solicita su credito para pago de aranceles de su carrera y compra de una computadora para la realizacion de sus trabajos e investigaciones. Su sueño es culminar sus estudios , que su familia gozen de salud y que no les falte lo basico en el hogar.
texts.en:
Yelba is 25 years old and has worked as a secretary for the Ruben Dario Institute for six years in the Ministry of Education. She is well known in the municipality. 

She is a hard working and very responsible woman. She is dedicated to her work and her family. She has the support of her husband who works as a teacher of a secondary school and the University URACCAN. Both share the family's expenses. 

She is requesting a loan to pay her tuition fees and buy a computer, which she will use to do her work and research. Her dream is to finish her education, for her family to have good health and that they do not lack the basic needs at home.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees and buy a computer

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Merlyn is selling dried fish in their local community. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy more dried fish to re-sell.

Merlyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Merlyn hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to re-sell

loans.name: Mryna

texts.en:
Mryna is a 34-year-old married mom of four kids, who tries her best to earn on her own. Mryna lives in Biasong, Lopez Jaena, and helps her family through a clay pot making business. For five years, she's managed this pottery business and earns about 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) per month. 

Currently she needs to buy more clay to be used in her business. She joined recently and thanks to GDMPC microfinance for the loan of 5,000 PHP they provided to her. Mryna hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more clay to use in her business

loans.name: Lleny

texts.es:
Lleny tiene 35 años, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de tener muchas ganas de progresar. Está casada con Fernando, quien es mecánico, fruto de esa unión tiene tres hijos de 13, 9 y 3 años, a quienes quieren mucho. Juntos, viven en la casa que obtuvieron como resultado de su trabajo.

La actividad que ella realiza es la venta de fajas femeninas, las cuales compra de la ciudad de Lima donde tiene una tía quien le envía las prendas a pedido y ella las vende entre sus colegas de trabajo, ya que se desempeña como docente en una escuela de la ciudad. Se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 3 años y su forma de venta es al crédito con un plazo máximo de 30 días. Le gusta su actividad, pues le permite tener un ingreso económico adicional al sueldo, ya que muchas veces no le alcanzaba para pagar sus cuentas a pesar que las comparte con su esposo. Así también, gracias al crédito que obtuvo anteriormente pudo establecer una pequeña tienda de repuestos donde eventualmente ayuda a su esposo que trabaja ahí como mecánico. Ahora pretende expandir e implementar esa tienda con más artículos que ofrecer a su clientela. 

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y se siente agradecida de contar con este apoyo financiero para poder alcanzar sus objetivos. Además, está a gusto con su banco comunal, pues considera que sus integrantes son personas responsables.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, comprará repuestos de motores y repuestos para complementar su trabajo en su taller mecánico. También comprará más fajas femeninas para continuar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Lleny is 35 years. She is a hardworking and persevering woman with a great desire to progress in life. She is married with Fernando, who is a mechanic, and they have three children aged 13, 9 and 3 whom they love very much. They all live in the house they have been able to buy thanks to their working efforts.

She sells women’s girdles that she buys in the city of Lima where she has an aunt that sends her the products she orders; she then sells them to her working colleagues, as she is a teacher in a school of her town. She has been engaged in this activity for 3 years, and she sells on credit collecting it after 30 days at a max. She likes her activity because it allows her to earn another income on top of her salary, as in some occasions she did not have enough to pay for her expenses even though she shares them with her husband. In this way and also thanks to a loan she has previously received, she has succeeded in opening a small spare parts shop and she sometimes helps her husband who works there as a mechanic. She now wants to expand and improve this shop with more items to offer to her customers.

This is the third loan she is requesting to MFP and she feels deeply grateful to be able to count on this economic support to reach her goals. She also likes her Communal Bank because she thinks its members are responsible.

The 1500 PEN she has requested will be used to buy motorcycle spare parts and other spare parts to stock up her garage. She will also buy more women’s girdles to carry on with this selling activity as well.

loans.use: To buy more women's girdles to sell and more spare parts to stock up her garage.
