loans.name: Gentian

texts.en:
Gentian is married. He lives in Kosovo. He is an enthusiastic person, who puts all his effort into his business. He works at an accounting business. Gentian has an office to maintain accounting books for small and medium enterprises in his area. He has been running this business for three years. He loves what he does and is committed to it. 

He inherited this business from his father, which makes it easier to work with.

Gentians request a loan from KosInvest to buy office equipment such as a photocopy machine and a computer. He is expecting that the loan assistance will help him to meet his business needs. 

He plans in the future to expand his business and to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To buy office equipment such as a photocopy machine and a computer

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is forty-nine years old, married  to Simon, and blessed with three  children that they support. She has been a mixed crop farmer for the last nine years, earning a monthly income of KES 13,500 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to purchase farm inputs, e.g., fertilizers, pesticides and pay for labor.

She will invest the anticipated profits back in the business. Her future dream is  to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs e.g., fertilizers, pesticides and pay for labor

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 27 years old, married and blessed with two children who are both in school. She runs a tailoring business which has been in operation for the last 15 years and earns her a monthly income of KES 100,000.   


She has applied for her second loan of KES. 100,000 from KADET LTD after completion of the previous one. She plans to use it to purchase another sewing machine, materials and pay wages to her worker as an addition to her monthly income. She anticipates profits which she plans to re-invest back into her business. 


She in future dreams of having a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase another sewing machine and materials and to pay wages

loans.name: Phobe

texts.en:
Phobe is forty-one years old, married to David, and they are blessed with three children. She has been earning a living from the green grocery business for the last four years, earning a monthly income of 12,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). 

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our credit officers, and is applying for her fourth loan of 10,000 KES. She plans to use it to add to her stock of vegetables, onions, and carrots. 

The anticipated profits she will invest back into her business. Her future dreams are to have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables, onions, and carrots

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Mryna

texts.en:
For over 10 years in Talic, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Mryna, a 56-year-old married mother of 3 children, has made a living through the operation of a retail store selling a variety of food and home-use products. She earns 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2011, Mryna joined GDMPC. She is now requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, soaps, etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is 63 years old and is married. She purchases and sells local drinks. She has been in this business for four years and she does her work from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day per week, except on the weekends. 

Bernadette has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy large quantities of sorghum to make local drinks for resale. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future, to pay school fees for her children and she will be able to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of sorghum to make local drinks for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Lendy

texts.en: Lendy, 36, lives in Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental. He has earned income by providing transportation services for five years, supporting two children. He earns 5,000 PHP a month frrom this business. For a father, there’s nothing that can make him happier than to see his children successful in their studies. Lendy wants to borrow 10,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to repair the transport vehicle used in his business and provide his children with a better education. He is new to GDMPC. His plan in the future is to improve his business.

loans.use: to repair transport vehicle used in his business.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is a 44-year-old business lady, married to George who is a business man. They are blessed with two children, ages 23 and 17. She has been running a retail shop for the past 10 years with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family. 

Peninah is applying for her fourth loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. She will use the loan to restock her shop with sugar, rice and maize flour. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. 

She hopes to open a wholesale shop and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to restock her shop with sugar, rice and maize flour.

loans.name: Msallam

texts.en:
Msallam is 51 years old and lives in one of the villages near Tulkarem. He is married and has two children.

Msallam owns a small restaurant in the area where he makes and sells humos and falafel (traditional foods). He asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy a refrigerator, do some tiling and flooring, and enlarge the space of the shop.

His ambition is to increase his income and provide his children with the best education.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, do some tiling and flooring, and enlarge the space of the shop.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: Maribel is a 31-year old resident of Biasong, Lopez Jaena. She provides her three children's needs from the little amount of 11,240 PHP she has earned monthly from her own piggery business for 4 years, as an aid to the income earned by her husband. However, in 2011 she became a member of GDMPC, and she has applied for a loan at GDMPC micro finance of 15,000 PHP to buy feeding supplies. Maribel wants to make an expansion of her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline is a 34-year-old businesswoman.  She is married to Richard, who is a businessman, and they currently have no children. She has been running a boutique shop as a primary business and a barber shop as a secondary business for the past four years, with a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her second loan from KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. Magdaline will use the loan to buy more new clothes and a shaving machine. With the anticipated profit from the two businesses she will boost her business with more stock for resale. 

She hopes to get enough funds to build some rental houses.

loans.use: To buy more new clothes and a shaving machine

loans.name: Kiminza

texts.en:
Kiminza is forty-seven years old and married with three children. He has run a food stall business for the last year earning a monthly income of 5,000 KES. 

He has applied for his first loan of 10,000 KES from KADET Ltd., which he plans to use to purchase additional stock of sugar, meat and rice for the business.

He will invest the anticipated profits back into his business. His future dreams are to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of sugar, meat and rice for his business

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 34 years old and is a married with two children, ages 4 and 5. She purchases and sells various goods such as lotions, soap, sugar, biscuits, and books. She has been in this business for one year, and she's at work from 6 a.m to 8 p.m every day during the week.

Chantal has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as lotions, soap, sugar, biscuits and books for resale. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future, and she will be able to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy various goods such as: lotions, soap, sugar, biscuits and books for resale.
